**The Supreme Numinous Treasure Repentance for Audience with Heaven**

**Title:** *The Supreme Numinous Treasure Repentance for Audience with Heaven*
**Ten fascicles.** *Source text:* *Zhengtong Daoist Canon*, *Dongzhen* Section, *Weiyi* Category.

---

**Fascicle One**

At that time, the Primordial Celestial Venerable, the Supreme Dao Lord, and the Supreme Old Lord were in the Jade Purity Sacred Realm of the Great Brahma Heaven, seated upon the Seven-Treasured Purple Tenuity Terrace within the Heaven of Great Blessing. Assembling the multitude of immortals, they expounded the wondrous Dharma of True Unity, manifesting great majestic power and spreading vast auspicious radiance. Universally illuminating the boundless worlds, they revealed to all sentient beings the karmic conditions of good and evil, enabling them to know the retributions of past lives, the rewards of merit and sin, and the consequences of the Three Times.

Thereupon, the celestial great sages burned incense and prostrated in audience, arraying themselves in ranks to attend and listen to the Dharma-sound. The Primordial Celestial Venerable emitted nine-colored divine light, penetrating and illuminating all heavens below and the myriad lands. His majestic spirit transformed, pervading without obstruction, as clear as if held in the palm of the hand. The assembled immortals to his left and right, riding this majestic radiance, beheld the heavens and the karmic conditions of good and evil, both inner and outer, fully revealed.

They saw great sages and lofty perfected ones, their necks bearing circular aureoles, their forms adorned with wondrous marks—some riding upon light and traversing the void, soaring on dragons and driving cranes, treading clouds and pacing the emptiness, or journeying in simurgh-drawn chariots with phoenix canopies, roaming the Eight Extremes in carefree nonaction, their divine transformations self-mastered. Some beheld celestial and terrestrial immortals, golden lads and jade maidens, innumerable multitudes, blessed with happiness and joy. Some saw immortals bearing banners and holding tablets, burning incense and scattering flowers, multiplying their forms in transformation. Some saw flying celestial deva-kings and karmic youths, patrolling the human realm, recording good and evil to report to the heavens. Some saw the palaces of the sun and moon, the jeweled abodes of the stellar lodges, and the numinous officials of mountains, rivers, seas, and peaks, examining the people, assessing their good and evil deeds and merits, without the slightest error.

Then, the Ten Flower Perfected Ones, together with the celestial great sages, burned incense and prostrated in audience, ascending to address the Most Venerable: "Today, we have been granted the honor of attending this jeweled pavilion, beholding and hearing this wondrous assembly. Humbly standing at your side, we pray that you manifest your majestic power, erect a great Dharma-bridge, and guide all beings, that they may attain the Dao and forever transcend the delusions of the dust."

Thereupon, the Primordial Celestial Venerable addressed the attendant perfected ones at his side: "You, the assembled immortals, follow my auspicious radiance and descend to observe the myriad lands and the earth, the mountains and rivers, and the multitudes of people, witnessing the retributions of good and evil. Those who establish meritorious deeds and broadly cultivate fields of blessing shall each receive the blessings of the heavens and humanity.

They saw emperors, empresses, generals, and ministers burning incense in the main halls, widely convening Dharma-assemblies, observing fasts and offering libations, reciting scriptures and performing repentance rites for the sake of all humans and devas to avert calamities and pray for blessings. They saw emperors, empresses, generals, and ministers humbling themselves before all beings, generously offering a hundred treasures to worship the heavens. They saw emperors, empresses, generals, and ministers establishing palaces and temples, sculpting sacred images, reciting scriptures and prostrating in worship to broadly seek blessings and benefits for all humans and devas. They saw emperors, empresses, generals, and ministers dispersing wealth and treasures to relieve the poor, the aged, the sick, and the destitute. They saw emperors, empresses, generals, and ministers constantly practicing compassion, refraining from killing or harming, avoiding extravagance and waste, and always practicing frugality.

They saw worthy Daoists constructing numinous temples and stellar altars, copying scriptures and crafting images. They saw worthy Daoists abstaining from grains and fasting, purifying body and mind, reciting and studying scriptures. They saw worthy Daoists releasing life to extend longevity, aiding and benefiting the impoverished. They saw worthy Daoists diligently striving toward the stellar Han to seek lightness and ascension. They saw worthy Daoists loyal to their lords and filial to their parents, compassionate and loving toward friends.

They saw emperors, kings, civil and military ministers hunting and killing, harming and injuring the common people. They saw emperors, kings, civil and military ministers imposing cruel and harsh punishments, oppressing the people. They saw emperors, kings, civil and military ministers indulging in lust and desire, unrestrained in the six senses, feasting and reveling without moderation. They saw emperors, kings, civil and military ministers destroying palaces and temples, burning and demolishing Dharma-halls. They saw emperors, kings, civil and military ministers disdaining monastics, humiliating Dharma-teachers, inflicting pain and punishment. They saw emperors, kings, civil and military ministers slighting Heaven and Earth, the sun and moon, and the stellar lodges, poisoning and harming the virtuous. They saw men and women slandering the Dharma-body of monastics, engaging in licentious acts within temples, killing living creatures, and defiling sacred grounds. They saw men and women killing their parents, committing the five heinous acts of unfiliality, defying Heaven and betraying Earth, disbelieving in sin and merit. They saw men and women stealing the permanent possessions of the Three Treasures—offerings of wealth, flowers, fruits, banners, and canopies. They saw men and women betraying the Dao and rebelling against their teachers, violating vows and breaking oaths, deceiving others to settle debts. They saw men and women bound in willow locks and imprisoned, whipped, beaten, and tortured, their bodies maimed. They saw men and women with incomplete six senses, mute, deaf, or dumb, their hands and feet crippled and contracted. They saw men and women foolish, dull, and witless, afflicted with leprosy or madness. They saw men and women devoured or stung by venomous insects and fierce beasts. They saw men and women separated midway in life, not fulfilling their bonds with kin. They saw men and women torn from their mothers, sold into slavery. They saw men and women with bodies split open, rotting with maggots and festering with pus and blood.

They further saw hells where feet tread upon knife-mountains, limbs severed and bodies broken. They saw hells where hands grasp sword-trees, limbs and joints torn asunder. They saw hells where fire is swallowed and coals are eaten, smoke issuing from the entire body. They saw hells where pestles pound, mills grind, and bodies are reduced to dust. They saw hells where bodies embrace copper pillars, forms scorched and withered."

They further saw hells where bodies lie upon iron beds, fat melting and flesh burning. They saw hells where cauldrons boil, bodies stewed and dissolved into rot. They saw hells where saws split the form, blood streaming from the entire body. They saw hells where pressing rocks crush the frame, blood bursting from every pore. They saw hells where bodies sink in freezing ice, the entire form cracking and splitting. They saw hells where fire-mountains rest upon the head, face and body scorched and withered. They saw hells where iron birds peck out the eyes, skin and flesh torn asunder. They saw hells where tongues are pulled out, pierced by iron awls. They saw hells where dark waves are drawn and poured to flood the four rivers. They saw hells where stones are carried to fill rivers, laboring day and night without respite.

They further saw beings reborn as hungry ghosts. They saw beings reborn as the six kinds of livestock—oxen, sheep, swine, and dogs. They saw beings reborn among border tribes and lowly outcasts. They saw beings reborn with the six afflictions—deafness, blindness, muteness, dumbness, withered hands, and lame feet. They saw beings reborn as insects, beasts, flies, and gnats. They saw beings reborn as filth-dwelling worms in the mire. They saw beings reborn as noxious creatures—birds, beasts, fish, turtles, shrimp, and crabs.

At that time, all the great sages and divine immortals in the Dharma assembly beheld such karmic retributions and causal conditions throughout the heavens and the earth, where sin and blessing differ. They knew not what cultivation in past lives had led to present transgressions, nor what blessings in past lives had brought present suffering. Some were seeds sown in former lives, calamity flowing to descendants; others were offenses accumulated in a single lifetime, bearing this karmic retribution. They prostrated and entreated the Heavenly Worthy in great compassion to bestow awakening, that all sentient beings might comprehend the causal conditions of past lives, the retribution of sin and blessing, the rewards and punishments of the heavens—every detail without deviation. If they aroused the mind to seek deliverance and followed the sacred words, all would attain liberation.

The Most High Primordial Heavenly Worthy again addressed the attendant perfected ones at his side: "If in the world below there are perfected persons and faithful disciples who arouse the unsurpassed Dao-mind, greatly bestow wealth and treasure to relieve the destitute, release creatures to extend their lives, erect wondrous seven-jeweled terraces, establish images of the Three Clarities, observe precepts and burn incense, and hold grand jiao rites to honor the hundred numina of heaven and earth, the stellar hosts of the celestial palaces, and offer a hundred precious offerings, I shall dispatch the Heavenly Worthy of Great Compassion and Salvation from Suffering to open the cinnabar-script purple texts in the Supreme Ultimate Palace, proclaim the august names of the Heavenly Worthies, extol and chant the cavernous hymns, and entreat the erasure of the souls languishing in the nine dark hells of eternal night, releasing the toils and entanglements of sin endured by their ancestors and parents through kalpas past. All shall be absolved and released, their souls ascending to the heavenly halls, where they shall wander carefree, their clothing and sustenance naturally provided. Their boundless blessings shall increase, their boundless sins shall dissolve. Their merit shall be towering, and all shall attain liberation."

Thus, in burning incense, they return their bodies and devote their lives, prostrating with the five limbs to the ground. With sincere minds, they pay homage:

The Primordial Lord of the Origin addresses all the divine immortals, saying: "I now bestow these precious titles of the Heavenly Worthies, the Perfected, and the Heavenly Masters, dispatching the Perfected of the Jade Clarity to descend into the world below, scattering them across the ten thousand states and nine provinces, to be transmitted, transcribed, and recited in worship. Should there be those who cultivate the True, or people who gather blessings—whether on the eight seasonal nodes, the Three Origins, or their own birthdays—who, for the sake of the emperor or the lord of the realm, burn incense, scatter flowers, offer rare and wondrous fruits, perform grand jiao rites to the stars, and make offerings to the sacred mountains and cavern-heavens, as well as to the divine immortals who have attained the Dao, they shall secure the peace and prosperity of the nation, ensuring its endurance with Heaven, bringing harmony to the myriad realms, and uniting the four seas under a common culture."

The divine ascends to the Golden Gates, their names inscribed in the Jade Clarity. The heavens are free of defilement, and the ten thousand states enjoy perfect peace. Their merit towers high, their blessings and felicity boundless.

Should there be those who uphold the Dao, who arouse the unsurpassed intention for the Dao, and on the days of the Three Origins and eight seasonal nodes, for the sake of the emperor, the lord of the realm, or the heir apparent and crown prince, burn incense and bow in reverence, reciting the precious titles of the Three Clarities and the names of the Celestial Venerables and perfected ones, they shall secure the peace of the imperial throne, preserving the enduring harmony of Heaven, ensuring their line shall never be severed, and that they shall forever remain sovereigns of the people."

Master Chongmiao prostrated in thanks before the Celestial Venerable of the Golden Gates and offered this hymn of praise:
"The Celestial Venerable bestows his mandate,
His sagely calculations stretch far and long.
Golden branches flourish,
Jade leaves ever fragrant.
The Five Stars follow their order,
The Seven Luminaries cast their radiance.
Resplendent and glorious,
The wondrous celestial verses resound through the void.
Bless our sagely emperor,
His precious throne without end.
Heaven is clear, Earth is tranquil,
The myriad realms shine with brilliance."

*Thus concludes the first fascicle of The Supreme Numinous Treasure Repentance for Audience with Heaven and Atonement for Transgressions.*

*The second fascicle of The Supreme Numinous Treasure Repentance for Audience with Heaven and Atonement for Transgressions begins.*

At that time, the Primordial Celestial Venerable, at the beginning of the Red Clarity Kalpa, in the Upper Palace of the Fire Refinement within the Southern Vermilion Open Yang of the Great Luo Heaven of Jade Clarity, convened a grand assembly of the host of immortals. The Celestial Thearchs of the four directions, the boundless heavenly beings, jade lads and jade maidens, holding talismans and bearing tablets, burned incense and scattered flowers. They chanted the verses of the grottoes, circling the wondrous terrace of the celestial treasures. Dragon candles and phoenix lamps were arrayed in rows, illuminating the Most Honored One.

The sacred virtue towers sublime; yet we have never beheld it. At that time, the Primordial Celestial Venerable, with great majestic power, spread vast auspicious radiance, universally illuminating the ten directions. In the boundless lands, all became of one appearance—inner and outer opened and pervaded, like lapis lazuli, pure and luminous without obstruction. The great sages of the ten directions and all attendant perfected beings, following the Most Honored One’s auspicious light, descended to behold the ten directions, the myriad lands, the nine provinces, mountains and rivers, the great earth, the suffering and joy of the people, hells and heavens, the retribution of sins and blessings, all as if before their very eyes.

At that time, the divine kings of the heavens and the spirit officials of the Three Bureaus arrayed themselves in ranks to pay homage. They presented the registers of the sins and blessings of the lands and peoples of the world, each clearly distinguished, without error or omission. Then, the Perfected of Jade Clarity and the Perfected of Golden Splendor, along with all the immortals in the assembly, burned incense and bowed in reverence, prostrating before the Most Honored One. Today, we humbly partake in this Dharma feast, beholding the compassionate radiance, listening to the Dharma’s sound, awakening the deluded in the dust, and universally guiding them to realize the Dao—truly, this is our long-accumulated blessing.

The Primordial Celestial Venerable addressed the attendant perfected beings at his side: "I have often descended from the Jade Clarity Heaven to observe all the myriad people. Those who accumulate goodness and revere blessings all receive their due retribution. I see those who broadly create scriptures and images, establish temples to deliver people, practice almsgiving and fasting, relieve the living and deliver the dead, universally saving all—such beings are reborn as kings in heavenly realms, as rulers of kingdoms. Those who make offerings to the Three Treasures, burn incense and light lamps, recite scriptures and pay homage, widely establish fields of blessing, and rescue from disasters and hardships—such beings are reborn as queens and mothers of nations. Those who joyfully believe in the scriptures and Dharma, uphold fasting and contemplate the Dao, and give alms to the poor—such beings are reborn in wealthy, noble, and wise forms. Those who constantly practice compassion, relieve the living and deliver the dead, revere the Three Treasures, and never cease burning incense—such beings are reborn in pure, renunciate forms. Those who believe, practice, and make offerings to the stars—such beings are reborn with long lives, purity, and upright beauty. Those who complete temples and establish sacred altars—such beings are reborn in great wealth, nobility, and wisdom. Those who give alms to relieve the poor and accomplish merit without stint—such beings are reborn among heavenly beings. Those who do not kill, steal, envy, or harm—such beings are reborn with long lives and complete faculties. Those who make offerings to the Three Treasures, cherish all beings, and practice compassion toward creatures—such beings are reborn in lofty, noble, and exalted forms. Those whose descendants flourish, with long lives and wealth—such blessings arise from making offerings to the Celestial Venerable, the Great Dao, and the stars. Those whose couples are harmonious and whose sons and daughters are gentle and obedient—such blessings arise from never severing love and affection. Those who are respected and revered wherever they go, enjoying sweet food and fine clothing—such blessings arise from revering heaven and earth and faithfully honoring the Three Treasures. Those who are nobly exalted in this life, feared by all—such

Those who indulge excessively in alcohol and favor pungent, foul, and filthy foods—such beings in this life suffer madness and are consumed by raging fire, and in past lives were reborn as apes and monkeys. They descend into hell, plunged into cauldrons of boiling liquid.

Moreover, all beings who in this life have severed or crippled limbs, clenched and withered hands, or lame and crooked feet—such afflictions arise from disrespecting the Three Treasures and the stars. Those who are blind in both eyes or whose tongues fester and rot—such afflictions arise from slandering the scriptures and belittling the Three Treasures. Those who are mute and unable to speak, or whose noses are blocked and cannot smell—such afflictions arise from deceiving the ordained and disbelieving the scriptures and Daoist teachings. Those whose eyebrows fall out, lips curl back, tongues loll, or noses collapse—such afflictions arise from destroying sacred altars and slandering the Three Treasures. Those who are deranged, deluded, and grotesque in appearance—such afflictions arise from arrogance, contempt, and mockery of the ordained and the Dharma-body.

Those who encounter bandits and have their possessions harmed—such misfortune arises from plundering the Three Treasures and the permanent endowments of the sacred. Those who drown in water or are harmed by fish and dragons—such misfortune arises from damaging the permanent endowments of the Three Treasures. Those who are burned and scorched by fire or devoured by venomous snakes—such misfortune arises from killing the ordained and demolishing monasteries. Those who have venomous creatures enter their mouths and vomit blood and filth—such afflictions arise from cursing with foul speech and invoking malevolent spirits. Those who have venomous creatures enter their orifices, are devoured by tigers and wolves, or are harmed by fierce beasts—such misfortune arises from secret schemes, poisonous malice, and deceitful hearts.

Those whose parents, spouses, and children are separated, never living together, and constantly quarreling day and night—such misfortune arises from jealousy, adultery, breaking others’ harmony, and severing others’ flesh and blood. Those who engage in lewdness without regard for kinship, beauty, or ugliness—such beings arise from the realm of swine, dogs, and the six domestic animals. Those who crave meat, delight in killing, and indulge in alcohol to the point of madness—such beings arise from the realm of fish, turtles, frogs, venomous creatures, and fierce beasts. Those whose bodies are filthy, unclean, and foul-smelling—such beings arise from the realm of toads and venomous insects.

Those reborn as oxen, horses, and the six domestic animals—such rebirths arise from killing living beings, evading taboos, and defaulting on debts. Those reborn as wild beasts, roebucks, deer, vipers, and pythons—such rebirths arise from jealousy, poisonous malice, and secret schemes. Those reborn as starving tigers and jackals—such rebirths arise from oppression, plunder, killing, and injury. Those reborn as filth-dwelling insects, toads, tadpoles, crickets, and ants—such rebirths arise from disdaining the Three Treasures and lacking reverence and faith. Those reborn as mad dogs, wild boars, fish, turtles, and monstrous creatures—such rebirths arise from turning against their teachers, abandoning their roots, and violating the scriptures and teachings.

Those reborn as swallows, sparrows, and turtledoves—such rebirths arise from debating the scriptures and creating negative karma with their speech. Those reborn as hawks, falcons, and birds of prey—such rebirths arise from offending the ordained and destroying the scriptures and teachings. Those who miscarry or give birth to children with swollen bellies and thin necks—such afflictions arise from mocking the Three Treasures and arrogantly disparaging the ordained. Those who are imprisoned in shackles and subjected to torture and corporal punishment—such misfortune arises from flattery, poisonous partisanship, and cruelty toward the poor and lowly. Those who are whipped, beaten, and bound in shackles and prisons—such misfortune arises from malicious greed and cruelty.

Those reborn as cats, dogs, wild dogs, jackals, wolves, foxes, and raccoon dogs—such rebirths arise from greed, stinginess, falsehood, and deceit. Those reborn with the bodies of rats, moles, centipedes, crickets, and lizards—such rebirths arise from secret malice and jealousy. Those reborn as bees, wasps, scorpions, venomous lizards, and geckos—such rebirths arise from cursing the ordained and disrespecting the Three Treasures. Those reborn as spiders, earthworms, mosquitoes, fleas, and lice—such rebirths arise from disdaining the Dharma, belittling the Dao, and mocking and slandering the scriptures. Those reborn as barbarians of lowly status, bald and with severed hair, deep-set eyes, long noses, and foul-smelling bodies—such rebirths arise from killing living beings, sexual misconduct, and disbelief in karmic causes and conditions.

The Celestial Venerable of Primordial Beginning addressed the attendant perfected beings at his side: "The sins and karmic retributions described above condemn beings to hell, where they endure various tortures and punishments, suffering through kalpas before obtaining these forms. Some experience karmic retribution in this very life, the causes and conditions of their bodily afflictions clearly revealed. Each must purify their minds and repent, thereby gaining immeasurable blessings."

The Celestial Venerable of Primordial Beginning further addressed the attendant perfected beings: "If in the lower realms there are faithful men and women of the Dao who, with utmost sincerity, establish altars for the Three Clarities and the Five Emperors’ stellar platforms on behalf of the empress, imperial consorts, the seven ancestral temples, and the noble lineages of past generations—hanging banners, offering flowers, rare and precious fruits, lighting incense and lamps, and performing grand jiao rites to the stars to redeem and liberate souls—then I shall dispatch the Heavenly Venerable of Great Compassion and Salvation, who will open the vermilion gates of the Scarlet Mound, inscribe the purple registers, proclaim the august names of the Celestial Venerables, chant and praise the cavernous scriptures, and release the stagnant souls of the Nine Dark Realms. Their past karmic obstructions will dissolve, the Five Paths will open, and they will attain carefree non-action, transcending to blessed rebirth. All their transgressions will be eradicated. Therefore, offer incense, surrender body and life, and prostrate with the five limbs touching the ground."

Here ends the second fascicle of *The Supreme Lingbao Repentance Before Heaven for Atonement of Sins*.

At that time, the Primordial Celestial Venerable of the Origin was in the Supreme Great Luo Heaven, within the Jade Capital and Golden Portal, seated upon the Heavenly Treasure Wondrous Terrace. Together with the Most High Jade Maid of the Dawn and the Most High Sagely Ancestor, the Most High and Venerable Lord Lao, he assembled the multitude of immortals to expound the wondrous Dharma and lecture on the scriptures and precepts. At that moment, the great sages of all heavens and all the assembled Perfected Ones burned incense, scattered flowers, held banners and staffs, chanted the cavernous hymns, and paced the void in praise. Their merit and virtue were towering, unheard of and unseen before. Today, they had the fortune to approach the precious hall, array themselves in ranks, and stand in attendance, reverently listening to the Dharma sounds, hoping to receive liberation and deliverance.

Then, the Primordial Celestial Venerable of the Origin addressed the attendant Perfected Ones on his left and right, saying: "With my awe-inspiring radiance, I universally illuminate the boundless worlds, the multitudes of the lower realms, and all sentient beings. Yet they remain foolish, benighted, and sunk in the snares of the world, mired in the six desires, unable to awaken. Constantly abiding in suffering and affliction, they drift and wander through the cycles of birth and death, never attaining enlightenment. Should there be faithful men and women who arouse the supreme intention of the Dao, on behalf of all sentient beings, establishing the precious altars of the Three Purities and the sacred altars of the Five Emperors, hanging banners and offering flowers, burning incense and prostrating in reverence, reciting scriptures and repenting; for their ancestral kin, deceased parents, wives, children, and family members, they may extinguish transgressions, purify body and mind, constantly savor the numinous sounds, avoid falling into evil destinies, and steadfastly practice devotion, repenting for past and present lives."

When the mind is raised and set in motion, should it harbor disbelief, slander the Three Treasures, defile the Three Treasures, mock the Three Treasures, revile the Three Treasures, curse the Three Treasures, deceive or neglect the Three Treasures, display arrogance toward the Three Treasures, or speak coarsely of the Three Treasures; disparage scriptures and registers, debate their authenticity, alter them with falsehoods, argue over right and wrong, distinguish between deep and shallow, discuss their merits and flaws, present oneself in impurity, wear unclean garments, have unclean hands and feet, foul breath, consume wine and meat, partake of pungent and rank foods, utter filthy words, or lack reverence in the heart—

Or fail to cleanse the hands, omit burning incense, neglect rinsing the mouth or bathing, and thus enter the sacred altar, offending the honored images, defiling the true immortals, divine sages, Heavenly Kings, Valiant Guardians, Jade Maidens, Golden Lads, and Altar Guardians; or show disrespect toward the scriptures and teachings of the Three Clarities and the Perfected, or toward ordained Dharma masters, displaying arrogance and refusing to believe and uphold—

Or ride horses and carriages directly into temples and sacred altars, approaching the honored images too closely, desecrating the blessed grounds; or upon seeing others observe fasts and receive precepts, persist in disbelief; or upon witnessing rituals, scripture recitations, or offerings, disrupt and dismiss them as delusions; or enter the Daoist sanctuary and speak loudly, disturbing the assembly; or speak and act with intent to debate right and wrong, compare truth and falsehood; or rely on the Three Treasures to seek wealth through deceit; or falsely teach the Dharma to deceive the people; or misuse the wealth of the Three Treasures to sustain oneself; or threaten and intimidate monastics to extort their possessions, supporting wives and children—

Such transgressions are boundless and immeasurable. Today, with a sincere heart laid bare, we bow in repentance to Heaven and Earth, the Three Treasures, and the stars, on behalf of our ancestral parents and living kin, kneeling in earnest supplication to beseech the eradication of sins, purifying inner and outer, that all may attain deliverance.

The Most High Lord of the Primordial Dao again addressed the attendant immortals at his side: "I grieve for the multitudes of the lower realms, still dwelling in the world, whose three karmas and six senses bear the weight of grave offenses. They persist in killing, inflicting cruel suffering, devoid of compassion, slaughtering creatures great and small, consuming the six livestock. For the sake of parents, themselves, siblings, spouses, children, extended kin, and village gatherings, they harm countless beings without reckoning.

They kill cattle, sheep, donkeys, horses, pigs, dogs, chickens, and domesticated livestock; or deer, foxes, hares, tigers, leopards, and wild beasts of the mountains and forests; or geese, ducks, birds, magpies, turtledoves, hawks, kites, wild ducks, egrets, and flying fowl; or insects, snakes, vipers, scorpions, bees, wasps, centipedes, millipedes, ants, and crawling creatures; or soft-shelled turtles, fish, turtles, snails, clams, frogs, crabs, and water-dwelling beings; or dung beetles, midges, mole crickets, caterpillars, mantises, earthworms, and tiny insects; or mosquitoes, fleas, lice, mayflies, grubs, and creatures born of transformation.

They hunt with hawks and hounds, set nets and traps, killing countless beings; or set fires to mountains, exhausting forests and draining marshes, slaughtering life; or wield bows, arrows, blades, and staves to kill; or crush with hands and feet, sit or lie upon, killing; or till fields and build walls, killing; or construct houses, dig pits, remove soil, dismantle fences, and erect barriers, killing; or destroy embryos and eggs, pour boiling water on the ground, killing; or kill before scripture images, sacred altars, and temples; or sacrifice to ghosts and spirits, or kill in anger; or take lives in their hands, or die by the blade; or sever heads and limbs, flay skin and fur, roast in fierce fires, boil in scalding water; or separate mother and child, severing their nurturing bond; or utterly destroy their life root, ensuring their annihilation.

They kill virtuous persons and Daoists, the old and weak, women and men; or kill creditors and enemies; or kill the good and kind in all directions; or kill through fear, coercion, poison, curses, or revilement; or commit suicide or incite others to kill. Such killings, with every movement of hand or body, take countless lives, their offenses boundless and grave, too grievous to hear.

Yet today, if there are faithful men and women of the Dao who, with wholehearted sincerity, bow to Heaven in repentance, present memorials and petitions, hold grand offerings to the Three Officials, release life to extend destiny, bestow alms and treasures, relieve the destitute, burn incense and perform the Daoist walk, chant the cavernous scriptures, and circumambulate in repentance—on behalf of their seven generations of ancestors, deceased parents, and all kin—they may wash away sins, reform evil, and purify body and mind. All their prayers shall be fulfilled, all their hopes realized. Their delivered kin shall ascend to the Southern Palace, attain the Dao, and be received by immortals, roaming freely in non-action, their blessings immeasurable."

The Most High Lord of the Primordial Dao again addressed the attendant immortals at his side: "If among the faithful below there are those who, on behalf of aquatic beings—shelled creatures, dragons, fish, turtles, shrimp, snails, clams, and all water-dwelling creatures—establish the precious altars of the Three Clarities and the sacred altars of the Five Emperors, burn incense and light lamps, present memorials and petitions, repenting for the heavy karmic offenses of those dwelling in water, I shall dispatch the Heavenly Worthy of Great Compassion and Salvation from the Cloud Tower and the Golden Repository of Sacred Scriptures to proclaim the august name of the Heavenly Worthy, that all in Heaven and Earth may praise and chant the cavernous scriptures, meditate on the divine and contemplate the Dao, beseeching the erasure of the records of the Nine Hells and the Long Night. Thus shall all aquatic beings and shelled creatures be liberated from suffering, their boundless sins extinguished, and all attain deliverance."

The fourth scroll of *The Supreme Lingbao Repentance for Offering Homage to Heaven and Atoning for Transgressions*.

At that time, the Primordial Supreme Lord was in the Jade Capital’s Golden Portal of the Great Luo Heaven, upon the Purple Tenuity Heavenly Terrace. Assembling a great congregation of immortals, he expounded the wondrous Dharma, delivering and saving devas and humans, enabling all to awaken to the Dao, sparing them from manifold sufferings. Manifesting great majestic virtue, he emitted great radiance, universally illuminating the ten thousand states. All karmic consequences of transgressions and blessings were made manifest before their eyes—profound, subtle, and wondrous—offering expedient means to open the path to liberation. All the destitute souls in the hells, suffering immeasurable agony and unbearable torment, were thus addressed.

And by this grace, they were rescued and uplifted, no longer drowned in the depths of suffering, all attaining transcendence.

At that time, the Primordial Supreme Lord, in his boundless compassion, further revealed the essential Dao, that both past and future might partake of its benefits. He addressed the attendant perfected ones at his side, saying:

"Humans receive life from the same single qi; yet upon birth, their fate is bound to the Three Origins. Longevity or premature death, fortune or misfortune, wealth or poverty, nobility or lowliness—all arise from karmic conditions of sin and blessing, good and evil, life and death. Each follows the root of their past existence, and all receive retribution according to their karmic power, never deviating, as the shadow follows the form, as the echo answers the sound.

On the fifteenth day of the first month of the Upper Origin, the celestial officials of the Heavenly Bureau ascend to the Heavenly Palace, presenting the registers of the world’s sins and blessings. On the fifteenth day of the seventh month of the Middle Origin, the terrestrial officials of the Earthly Bureau ascend to the Heavenly Palace, presenting the registers of the world’s sins and blessings. On the fifteenth day of the tenth month of the Lower Origin, the aquatic officials of the Water Bureau ascend to the Heavenly Palace, presenting the registers of the world’s sins and blessings.

On these Three Origin days, together with the Three Realms and the Ten Directions, the Four Bureaus and Five Emperors, the spirits of good and evil, and all divine officials, they ascend to the Golden Palace before the throne of the Primordial Supreme Lord to examine the registers of men and women’s lives and deaths, the karmic conditions of sin and blessing, and the black ledgers of names from the Nine Dark Hells and the Watery Prison of destitute souls.

At this time, if there are faithful men and women who awaken to the natural Daoist intent, constructing Purple Tenuity treasure terraces, Jade Capital treasure mountains, pavilions and towers adorned with a hundred treasures, offering incense and flowers, burning incense and practicing the Dao, chanting sacred hymns, lighting lamps and releasing living beings, performing the *Step-in-Emptiness* rituals, making offerings and vows, submitting petitions of repentance, and holding grand fasts and jiao rites, reverently beseeching Heaven and Earth day and night without ceasing—then I shall dispatch the Ten Perfected Celestials, the divine immortals of the heavens, the officials of the Three Realms and Four Bureaus, and the youthful spirits of salvation to descend into the human realm, all gathering at the ritual site to eradicate their sins and protect the living. Thus, the land will be at peace, men and women will rejoice in prosperity, all blessings will descend, and no evils will arise. The suffering souls of hell will all be liberated at once, ascending to the joy of Heaven, and the realm will enjoy effortless great peace. Their merit will be towering, and their blessings boundless."

The Primordial Supreme Lord again addressed the attendant perfected ones at his side, saying: "I see that in the boundless worlds of the Ten Directions, the Heavenly Kings of the Ten Directions construct thirty-two-tiered celestial terraces and treasure platters, all adorned with purple gold, pearls, jades, brocades, and grains, with purple nets and treasure canopies, purple-tasseled banners and streamers, a hundred kinds of flowers and foods, vessels of a hundred treasures, and celestial music filling the void, all coming to the ritual site in array for offerings.

At that time, the Heavenly Worthy, through his divine power, transformed the land of this assembly into lapis lazuli, translucent within and without, all of one color, equal in near and far. The Three Realms and Ten Directions all partook of blessings and joy beyond words. The Nine Dark Hells ceased their trials, the Five Sufferings halted their bitterness, the land was at peace, and the people enjoyed long life."

The Primordial Supreme Lord again addressed the attendant perfected ones at his side, saying: "If in the lower realm there are faithful men and women who invite Daoist masters and Dharma teachers to regularly proclaim the scriptures and precepts on the Three Origin festival days, expounding the karmic conditions of sin and blessing, repenting their own impurities—the foul and filthy Four Great Elements, the fragile and transient union of the body, the impermanence of every thought, the Three Actions and Six Roots constructing all evils, gradually staining and forming transgressions, cycling through birth and death, falling into the Three Wretched Realms, the Nine Dark Hells, enduring all manner of torments—swallowing fire and eating coals, boiled in cauldrons, treading upon knife mountains, grasping at sword trees, ground in mills, pounded in mortars, sawed apart, drilled and chiseled, having their eyes pecked by iron birds, their tongues plowed by iron plows, beaten by ox-headed demons, their bodies burdened with iron staves, their pus and blood flowing, their bodies rotting away, sinking into darkness, revolving in the muddy hells, carrying stones to fill rivers, tortured day and night. Once entering the Fengdu Hell, they endure ten thousand kalpas without reprieve—all self-inflicted by the karmic power of sentient beings.

If there are faithful men and women who awaken to goodness, constructing Jade Capital high seats and Purple Tenuity celestial terraces for the sake of their seven generations of ancestors, their living parents and kin, the Five Sufferings and Three Wretched Realms, the destitute souls, hungry ghosts, animals, prisoners, the elderly and sick, hanging banners and offering flowers, presenting a hundred treasures, performing jiao rites to the stars, submitting petitions, bowing in repentance, burning incense to extinguish the roots of sin—all will be transcended.

The Primordial Heavenly Worthy addressed the attendant perfected ones at his side, saying: "If on the Three Origin festival days, faithful men and women hold fasts and jiao rites for all humans and devas, reciting scriptures, bowing in repentance, making offerings to the Heavenly Worthies, immortals, stellar deities, and the hundred bureaus of the earthly prison, and for the sake of their ancestors and parents, awaken even a single good thought with unwavering sincerity—then their past, present, and future parents of three generations will gain boundless blessings and have all their sins extinguished."

The Primordial Supreme Lord addressed the attendant perfected ones at his side, saying: "I see that the people of the lower realm suffer many calamities and harm from evil spirits. For the sake of their deceased ancestors, parents, and honored kin, on the Five La Days—when Heaven and Earth grant amnesty—it is fitting to hold fasts, practice the Dao, bow in repentance, and submit petitions to rescue and transcend their ancestors, gaining boundless blessings.

On the first day of the first month, the Heavenly La Day, the Five Emperor Immortals gather in the Azure Heaven’s Peaceful Treasure Flower Grove at the Azure Spirit Palace to examine the registers of the world’s sins and blessings. On the fifth day of the fifth month, the Earthly La Day, the Five Emperor Immortals gather in the Cinnabar Heaven’s Brahma Treasure Prosperous Yang at the Vermilion Spirit Palace to examine the registers of the world’s sins and blessings. On the seventh day of the seventh month, the Daoist La Day, the Five Emperor Immortals gather in the Golden Gate’s Plain Spirit Palace to examine the registers of the world’s sins and blessings. On the first day of the tenth month, the People’s Year La Day, the Five Emperor Immortals gather in the Dark Heaven’s Cavern Yin at the Black Spirit Palace to examine the registers of the world’s sins and blessings."

On the La Day that falls in the twelfth month—the La Day of Kings and Lords—the Five Emperors of the Five Directions gather in the Primordial Spirit’s Wu-Ji Golden Gate within the Jade Capital of the Mysterious Metropolis, in the Eight Radiance Hall of the Primordial Supreme Lord, to examine the registers of the world’s sins and blessings. These five La Days are the days when Heaven and Earth converge, when the ledgers of fortune, misfortune, life, and death are fixed.

If there are men and women who, for their past ancestors and parents, perform rites of repentance, submit petitions, and offer thanks for transgressions, they may erase names from the Black Register of sins and ascend to deliver their seven generations of ancestors, inscribing their names in the Upper Clarity. All shall thus attain deliverance.

These five La Days concern the nine generations of ancestors and parents of the living, as well as the ghostly souls in the Dark Mountain. On these days, the Great Emperor of the Northern Darkness of Fengdu summons them forth for interrogation, questioning those long confined in the nether courts, whose sins have accumulated over the ages, whose offenses and origins are bound to the names of their descendants and the locations of their graves. If, after kalpas of time, no redemption has been sought, the living shall be implicated on this day, their names and those of their kin and nine clans recorded as the living’s offenses, their transgressions bound to the dark courts, their nine clans doomed to annihilation.

On this day, one may submit petitions and perform rites of repentance for deceased ancestors and parents, redeeming them from the dark paths, so that each of the departed may attain deliverance. Daily sacrifices must not be neglected, for the depths of Fengdu are profound and difficult to penetrate; only by relying on true principles may one resolve past transgressions, release the souls from the dark courts, and prevent prolonged confinement. If the dead remain long confined, the Heavenly Offices shall hold the officials of the dark courts accountable, and the living shall also be held responsible. Blessings shall turn to misfortune, and calamities shall arise therefrom.

If there are filial sons and daughters who, on this day, observe fasts and offer jiao rites, their names shall be stricken from the Black Register, and they shall gain boundless blessings, all attaining deliverance.

The Primordial Supreme Lord addressed the attendant perfected ones at His side: "The beings of the lower realms possess varying perceptions; their habits of evil and good, their roots and foundations, differ. I now speak these essential words, and all should believe and uphold them.

If beings engage in killing, harm, and injury, they shall be gathered through the Gate of Compassion.
If they steal, rob, or seize wealth, they shall be gathered through the Gate of Righteous Sharing.
If they indulge in licentiousness and debauchery, they shall be gathered through the Gate of Chastity.
If they are greedy, miserly, and stingy, they shall be gathered through the Gate of Almsgiving.
If they are wrathful and contentious, they shall be gathered through the Gate of Joy.
If they are foolish and deluded, they shall be gathered through the Gate of Expedient Means.
If they engage in frivolous and flowery speech, they shall be gathered through the Gate of Simplicity and Rectitude.
If they lie and deceive, they shall be gathered through the Gate of Faithfulness and Compliance.
If they curse and revile, they shall be gathered through the Gate of Recitation and Invocation.
If they slander and malign, they shall be gathered through the Gate of Praise and Admiration.
If they overindulge in wine and meat, they shall be gathered through the Gate of Fasting and Abstinence.
If they slander and defame, they shall be gathered through the Gate of Exposition and Teaching.
If they are arrogant and disdainful, they shall be gathered through the Gate of Reverence and Worship.
If they are stubborn and overbearing, they shall be gathered through the Gate of Gentleness and Humility.
If they disbelieve in the consequences of sins, blessings, and past lives, they shall be gathered through the Gate of Causes and Conditions.
If they cling to existence and nonexistence, they shall be gathered through the Gate of the Middle Way.
If they engage in disputes of right and wrong, self and other, they shall be gathered through the Gate of Equality.
If they are greedy, filthy, and defiled, they shall be gathered through the Gate of Purity.
If they are obstinate and unyielding, they shall be gathered through the Gate of Cyclic Transformation.
If they ceaselessly create and act, they shall be gathered through the Gate of Non-Action.
If they are rigid and unchanging, they shall be gathered through the Gate of Rounded Adaptation.
If they are restless and competitive, they shall be gathered through the Gate of Stillness and Concentration.
If they are afflicted and unable to let go, they shall be gathered through the Gate of Liberation.
If they are sorrowful and joyless, they shall be gathered through the Gate of Carefree Wandering.

Through these twenty-four gates, all shall be constantly gathered. Would not all beings find joy in this?"

The Primordial Supreme Lord said: "I originally gathered through non-gathering, exhorting and transforming all beings. Once beings awaken, there is also no cause for gathering. If one can uphold and observe these teachings, boundless blessings shall be attained."

*The Supreme Lingbao Repentance for Facing Heaven and Atoning for Sins, Scroll the Fifth*

At that time, the Golden Portal’s Great Sage, the Primordial Lord of the Highest Origin, was seated upon his precious cloud-jade throne in the wondrous realm of the Nine Clarities, the Heavenly Palace of Five Clouds. He convened a great assembly of immortals, expounding the wondrous Dharma of True Unity to broadly deliver all beings, causing them all to attain transcendence and awakening.

At that moment, the Most High Dao Lord, the Most High Lord Lao, together with all the Heavenly Great Sages, the Perfected of Wondrous Conduct, the Supreme Perfected of the Nine Heavens, the Four Controllers and Five Emperors, and all the divine immortals—each riding five-colored jade wheels, eight-scene jade chariots, flying cloud canopies, ten-fold spirit banners, dragon standards, and phoenix plumes—burned incense and scattered flowers, traversing the void and pacing the heavens, chanting cavernous hymns. They circled the jeweled terrace of kalpas’ height, all together praising and singing to the Primordial Lord of the Highest Origin, rejoicing in celebration.

At that time, the August One, with great majesty and virtue, emitted the seven-jeweled divine radiance, illuminating the vast heavens and reaching down to the boundless worlds, the Nine Dark Realms’ long-night hells. The karmic retributions of good and evil were all made manifest.

Then, the Heavenly Lords of the Nine Qi of the East, with their attendant Perfected and numinous officials, ascended to the Golden Portal.
Then, the Heavenly Lords of the Three Qi of the South, with their attendant Perfected and numinous officials, ascended to the Golden Portal.
Then, the Heavenly Lords of the Seven Qi of the West, with their attendant Perfected and numinous officials, ascended to the Golden Portal.
Then, the Heavenly Lords of the Five Qi of the North, with their attendant Perfected and numinous officials, ascended to the Golden Portal.
Then, the Heavenly Lord of the One Qi of the Center, with his attendant Perfected and numinous officials, ascended to the Golden Portal.

They arrayed themselves in ranks, burned incense, and presented the registers of the world’s multitudes—of life and death, sin and blessing.

In an instant, the myriad-transforming palaces and terraces were all adorned with carved water crystal, lapis lazuli, coral, and amber, with qilin and lions guarding left and right. Each proceeded to their jeweled seats to expound the registers of life and death from the Fengdu hells.

Suddenly, the wailing cries of the dead souls in hell, undergoing interrogation and punishment, resounded in agony. Again, one saw the forsaken dead souls, unclaimed in the gloom, unrecorded by the ghostly officials.

Then the Five Thearchs above inquired: "What karmic retribution has this multitude of sinners committed to endure such unbearable torment? We beseech the Heavenly Compassion to grant them deliverance."

The Primordial Thearch addressed the Thearch Lords, saying: "The dead souls of the Lower Kalpa endure this interrogation. For in former lives, they were disloyal and unfilial, their lord-subject bonds devoid of righteousness, their father-son ties lacking kindness. They disrespected the Three Luminaries, disbelieved in sin and blessing, deceived their masters and slandered the Dao, rebelled against their kin, wantonly slaughtered living beings, and indulged in greed and lust. The Life Mandate Officers stripped them of their allotted years, leaving their lifespans uncertain. Now, their dead souls face karmic reckoning, their kalpas exhausted with no release.

These souls, in former lives, were addicted to wine and meat, slaughtering without restraint. They performed no good deeds, devoted themselves solely to unrighteousness. Though their allotted years were not yet spent, the ghostly gods of the Six Heavens’ Cavernous Palaces seized upon their transgressions, unleashing plagues and pestilence. They met untimely deaths—by water, fire, bandits, epidemics, blades, or warfare—enduring hardships in public and private, entangled in disputes, shackled by slander, thwarted in all endeavors. For years and months uncounted, they suffered misfortune without respite.

Again, one saw the Wind-and-Thunder Hell, where black gales and crashing thunderbolts, jagged lightning and flying spears, assailed the sinners, tearing their limbs asunder, piercing their five viscera. For ten thousand kalpas, they endured ceaseless torment, day and night.

Again, one saw the Fire-Glare Hell, where sinners swallowed flames and devoured coals, scorched by fire. Their faces and heads were charred, fire-mountains crowned their skulls, flames sprouting from their skin, flesh, and bones. For ten thousand kalpas, they endured ceaseless torment, day and night.

Again, one saw the Diamond Hell, where sinners were beaten without number by iron hammers and metal rods. Their limbs rotted, their sinews and bones scattered. Iron forks pierced their bellies, metal hammers stuffed their hearts. For ten thousand kalpas, they endured ceaseless torment, day and night.

Again, one saw the Dark-and-Cold Hell, where sinners were submerged in freezing ice, their sinews and bones severed by frost-edged blades. Cauldrons of venomous brew were poured upon them, their bodies disintegrating, their hearts and bellies ruptured. For ten thousand kalpas, they endured ceaseless torment, day and night.

Again, one saw the Copper-Pillar Hell, where sinners embraced and climbed copper pillars engulfed in raging flames. Their outer and inner flesh charred and festered, their backs and bellies oozed pus. For ten thousand kalpas, they endured ceaseless torment, day and night.

Again, one saw the Butchery Hell, where sinners were hung upside down, their bodies carved by blades. Their four limbs, sinews, skin, and five viscera were all sliced by knives. Blood flowed across the ground, their suffering beyond endurance. For ten thousand kalpas, they endured ceaseless torment, day and night.

Again, one saw the Fire-Chariot Hell, where sinners were torn asunder by five chariots, their limbs scattered. Some were bound to fire-chariots, dragged east and west, north and south. Each wheel bristled with blades, slicing the sinners as the wheels turned, while raging fires roasted them to charred ruin. For ten thousand kalpas, they endured ceaseless torment, day and night.

Again, one saw the Cauldron Hell, where sinners were impaled by iron forks and plunged into boiling cauldrons. Their bodies were stewed and dissolved, their limbs rotted, their pus and blood reeking, their suffering beyond endurance. For ten thousand kalpas, they endured ceaseless torment, day and night.

Then, the Primordial Thearch, the Ten Directions’ Savior-from-Suffering Heavenly Worthy, and the Deliverance Perfected Ones radiated their great majestic light, employing the six supernatural powers to command the sinful souls to close their eyes and silently reflect, recalling the days of their past lives and the evil deeds they had committed. Some had murdered their lords or fathers, been unfilial to their parents; some had slandered true immortals; some had harmed their brothers; some had plotted against their masters; some had committed incest with kin; some had robbed and killed; some had butchered the orphaned and poor, bullying the weak with strength; some had abused their power to oppress the vulnerable; some had defiled sacred texts; some had harbored secret malice and envy; some had wielded vicious tongues and sowed discord; some had incited strife among the good. For kalpas uncounted, they had accumulated these sins, now suddenly recalled in full. Each soul saw clearly, their sorrow and remorse redoubled. They longed for liberation, all beseeching deliverance.

The Primordial Thearch again addressed the attendant Perfected, saying: "I see these sinners, for kalpas unending, have disbelieved in scriptures and repentance, devoted themselves solely to transgression. Thus, their names are inscribed in the ledgers of evil, their bodies consigned to the Nine Dark Realms, their souls trapped in the Three Wretched Paths, with no means of escape.

If there are faithful men and women who, for the sake of their deceased ancestors, parents, and kin, establish fasts, perform the Dao, prostrate in prayer, and present petitions; who aid the orphaned and poor, release living beings to extend life—then I shall dispatch the Great One Savior-from-Suffering Heavenly Worthy from the Purple Tenuity’s Upper Palace. There, he shall open the Three Heavenly Mystic Treasuries, the Sevenfold Jeweled Scriptures, the Jade Tablets and Coral Cases, and reveal the Heavenly Worthy’s august names. The sixth scroll of *The Most High Numinous Treasure Repentance for Facing Heaven and Atoning for Sins* begins.

At that time, the Primordial Lord of the Highest was within the Yellow Gold Palace of the Great Canopy Heaven, amidst curtains of the seven treasures. His majestic power manifested in full, his auspicious radiance blazing, illuminating heaven and earth. The Perfected and immortals of his retinue, an innumerable host, raised standards and bore incense, arrayed to his left and right, pacing in celestial circuits and extolling the Most High.

Then the Heavenly Immortals, Earthly Immortals, and Water Immortals, each arrayed in solemn dignity, ascended to the Golden Portal to present the records of the living and dead, the merits and transgressions of the myriad peoples of the ten thousand states and nine provinces—every name and deed, without the slightest omission.

At that time, the Primordial Lord of the Highest addressed the attendant Perfected at his side: "I observe that all sentient beings are but empty illusions, their thoughts perishing in an instant, never pausing for even a moment. Bound to the wheel of suffering and rebirth, the common folk remain unaware, shuttling through the Three Paths, enduring ten thousand kalpas of bitterness. Receiving form after form, they are ensnared by afflictions, all arising from deluded thoughts, inverted views, and attachments to life, death, existence, and annihilation. Unable to liberate themselves, they are most pitiable."

At that moment, within the Dharma assembly, the Perfected of Golden Splendor and the Perfected of Vast Blessings, bearing tablets and adorned with pendants, stepped forth from the ranks to burn incense and prostrate before the Golden Portal of the Celestial Emperor: "We, having accumulated profound goodness, now dwell in the Jade Clarity and are privileged to attend at your side, reverently hearing the Dharma’s teachings and receiving instruction for all beings. Yet we now see that those below—heedless of past lives, disobedient to scriptures and precepts—contend over right and wrong, their six senses clouded, their hearts ensnared by the Five Poisons."

When they commit transgressions, they know no fear. Some invoke ghosts and spirits, seeking their aid; others point to the Three Luminaries and their seven generations of ancestors, swearing false oaths. They turn kin against kin, inflicting harm and slaughter without principle. As their lives draw to an end, they cling to their homes, wealth, and treasures, cherishing their own bodies and gazing back with longing at wives and daughters, their hearts gripped by desperate attachment. Or they utter wicked vows, and their creditors and enemies appear before them. Sinking into the Five Paths, they find no escape.

We humbly beseech the Heavenly Compassion to open wide its mercy, deliver all beings, and lead them out of the dark realms, that all may awaken to the Dao.

Then the Most High Lord of the Primordial Dao addressed the attendant Perfected Ones: "I observe that the beings below, lost in deluded thoughts and inverted views, all arise from the heart. They forcibly create distinctions, their minds struck by fleeting impulses, and upon encountering circumstances, they fall into confusion. Every thought they conceive is false. They must steady their resolve and contemplate their bodies with wisdom—bone, flesh, skin, limbs, hair, the six roots, the four great elements, the five viscera, and the hundred spirits. When they carefully reflect and ponder, they find no true substance. All is but a temporary aggregation, a confluence of illusory forms. Searching within and without, where is the self to be found? Since the body is but an illusion, the heart becomes empty. Emptiness and illusion are not real; all is but deluded thought. Right and wrong, love and hatred, attachment to forms and sounds, scents, tastes, touches, and dharmas—jealousy, stinginess, greed, killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, deceitful speech, harsh words, all such deeds—vanish entirely. With inner and outer purity and emptiness, one awakens to the true Dao."

The Most High Lord of the Primordial Dao addressed the attendant Perfected Ones: "When you contemplate the body with settled wisdom, you find no true substance. Those who cling to false views do so because their six roots and three karmic actions remain impure. The six roots are: the eye root, the ear root, the nose root, the tongue root, the body root, and the mind root. These six roots give rise to all karmic actions, just as grasses and trees produce flowers, leaves, seeds, and fruits. In turn, the six emotions, six thieves, and six desires generate all karmic actions. If one employs wisdom to reflect, the karmic actions of the six roots are all exhausted.

The three karmic actions are: bodily karma, mental karma, and verbal karma. Bodily karma includes killing, stealing, and sexual misconduct; mental karma includes stinginess, greed, and anger; verbal karma includes deceitful speech, falsehoods, harsh words, and divisive speech. Together, these form the ten evils. When one carefully reflects, all ten evils are seen as insubstantial. By gradually eliminating the three karmic actions and the six roots, diminishing them again and again, and persisting in this practice over time, one naturally awakens to the true Dao."

The Most High Lord of the Primordial Dao addressed the Perfected Ones attending on either side: "I pity the beings below, who for kalpas uncounted have set their minds and intentions upon falsehoods, lacking in sincerity and truth, indulging in deceitful speech. Some utter such speech before the sacred images of the Heavenly Worthies; others do so before the scriptures and Daoist altars; still others before their parents and revered elders, before the wise and the venerable, before the powerful and the noble, or before those of keen understanding. Even before the divine assemblies of the heavens, the sun, moon, and stars, their every thought is tainted with deceitful speech. Their sins are grave indeed. Today, before the sacred altar of the Three Treasures, they repent and seek forgiveness, praying that all may be cleansed.

I pity these beings, whose bodies and minds give rise to deceitful speech, falsehoods, harsh words, divisive speech, jealousy toward those who surpass them, and the stirring of strife and contention. They sever the bonds of kinship, turn falsehood into truth, and transform deception into reality. Today, through repentance, may all be purified, and may they enter the root of faith."

The Most High Lord of the Primordial Dao addressed the Perfected Ones attending on either side: "I observe that the beings below, from the moment they assume form, employ their eyes, ears, nose, and tongue to conceive evil—killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, dissipation, stinginess, greed, anger, delusion, inverted views, deceitful speech, falsehoods, harsh words, divisive speech, jealousy toward those who surpass them, consuming alcohol and meat, violating the Three Luminaries, turning from truth toward falsehood, believing in perverse and inverted views, sacrificing to ghosts and spirits, failing to honor the Three Treasures, slandering and reviling, arrogance and contempt, indulgence in sensual desires, attachment to scents and flavors, sinking into infatuation with touch and dharmas, creating evil within and without, each giving rise to the other. The six roots interact, compounding transgressions, their roots of sin growing ever deeper. With every thought, they commit wrongs, accumulating boundless sins over time, all lodged within their bodies, beyond reckoning.

Yet with a single thought of the heart, all may be purified. It is like a bright mirror covered in dust, its surface obscured by grease and grime, accumulating into cataracts that cloud its inner and outer radiance. But when it encounters a skilled craftsman who wipes, polishes, and cleanses it, its surface and depths become luminous once more, reflecting near and far as it did in the beginning. Why is this so? Because its nature is fundamentally pure. So too is the human condition: the spirit is inherently pure, free from all defilement. Yet after assuming form, one gradually becomes tainted by transgressions—the six roots, six emotions, six thieves, six desires, and the discriminations of the six consciousnesses—creating defilements and obscurations. The body becomes an obstacle, and one loses the true nature, drifting through the cycles of birth and death, ever falling into the roots of sin. Entangled in karmic retribution, one enters hell, suffering myriad torments, revolving through ten thousand kalpas.

Out of compassion, I pity these beings and have, from kalpa to kalpa, turned the wheel in the human realm, appearing now among the barbarians, now among the Chinese, now old, now young, now noble, now base, employing every expedient means to teach and deliver them. The scriptural teachings have spread, awakening all beings, that they may escape suffering and forever depart from the hells. Yet beings are dull-witted and fail to comprehend. Therefore, I now distinguish for you the causes and conditions of sin and merit, that all beings may attain liberation."

The Most High Lord of the Primordial Dao addressed the assembly of Perfected Ones: "If there are faithful men and women below who receive and uphold this scripture, burn incense, and repent, washing away all the sufferings within their bodies, they shall attain purity and dissolve the boundless, measureless roots of past evil karma."

The celestial sages and all divine immortals ever desire that people diligently burn incense and repent, for then ten heavenly benevolent deities shall protect them, and all sages shall safeguard their persons. If the roots of sin bind the body, entwining it within and without, then malevolent spirits shall afflict and harm them, sickness shall cling to their bodies, and they shall suffer water, fire, blades, weapons, venomous creatures, fierce beasts, fetters, imprisonment, and manifold torments. Foolish mortals know only to adorn their faces, garments, hands, and feet outwardly, yet cannot inwardly cleanse their bodies and minds of the roots of sin and evil karma—how utterly deluded! If one diligently washes and purifies the face, hands, feet, and garments, one shall surely attain purity, encounter divine immortals, and obtain blessings and felicity.
