*Scroll Seven of the Supreme Lingbao Repentance for Atonement Before Heaven begins*

At that time, the Primordial Celestial Venerable was in the Jade Clarity Palace within the Great Canopy Heaven, seated upon the Five-Cloud Celestial Treasure Wondrous Terrace. He gathered the celestial immortals, terrestrial immortals, aquatic immortals, the numinous perfected of the Three Realms, and an immeasurable host. All proceeded to the Celestial Pass, ascending to the Jade Clarity, burning incense and scattering flowers, pacing the void in circumambulation, and prostrating before the Most August.

Then, the Celestial Venerable radiated his majestic light and broadly expounded the wondrous Dharma, vowing to deliver all beings and enable their awakening to the Dao.

At that moment, the Perfected of Supreme Clarity, the Perfected of the Great Ultimate, and the Perfected of Wondrous Conduct stepped forward, burned incense, and prostrated before the Most August, saying: "Since time immemorial, we have been graced to dwell among the ranks of the perfected and honorably attend the jeweled portals. Each time we hear the numinous sounds, we awaken the dust-bound multitudes. We constantly contemplate the myriad people below, adrift in the sea of desire, tossed upon the waves of love, ceaselessly revolving through birth and death. We know not what meritorious deeds might enable them to escape this sinking abyss and attain complete deliverance."

Then, the Primordial Celestial Venerable addressed the attendant perfected at his side, saying: "If there are faithful men and women in the world below who perpetually engage in acts of benefit, restraining their mouths and mortifying their bodies, bestowing alms of wealth and treasure, and constantly cultivating fields of merit—extending aid to birds, beasts, and all creatures possessing consciousness, universally relieving hunger and cold—this is foremost among all deeds.

"If they dig wells by the roadside, construct dwellings, plant orchards and groves, and succor the weary and suffering; or if they build bridges across rivers to ferry travelers, diligently and tirelessly performing such acts—then the host of sages will guard their bodies, and they shall accrue boundless merit."

The Primordial Celestial Venerable addressed the attendant perfected at his side, saying: "I pity the multitude of beings entangled in the Three Poisons and Ten Evils, beset by demonic sprites, malevolent ghosts, evil spirits, venomous insects, fierce beasts, weapons of war, fire and flood, fetters and prisons, illness and suffering, calamities and misfortunes, unable to find peace.

"For this reason, I expound for you the great Dharma of the Three Caverns, the talismanic scriptures and precious sutras, to save and protect the world and grant it peace and happiness. Yet beings, deluded and ignorant, fail to recognize sin and merit, indulging their six senses. Some kill living beings, steal, engage in licentiousness and debauchery, hoard with greed, seethe with anger, wallow in ignorance and delusion, utter deceitful and frivolous speech, slander with malicious words, and devour the flesh of living creatures. They defy heaven and earth, forsake the true and follow the perverse, sacrifice to ghosts and spirits, committing a multitude of sins without a single good deed. Thus, poisonous winds and malevolent qi, the demonic ghosts of the Six Heavens, pervade the human realm, perpetuating slaughter day and night without cease. I grieve deeply for them.

"I constantly dispatch the Celestial Emperor Kings, the Ten Ultimate Immortals, the Four Controllers and Five Emperors to inspect and deliver them, enabling all to awaken and transcend, avoiding the multitude of evils, and dissolving their long-standing transgressions."

The Primordial Celestial Venerable again addressed the celestial immortals at his side, saying: "I observe that since time without beginning, ordinary beings have sunk into the suffering of sin, creating manifold evil karma—killing living beings, stealing, engaging in licentiousness and debauchery, hoarding with greed, seething with anger, wallowing in ignorance and delusion, slandering with malicious words, uttering deceitful and frivolous speech, devouring the flesh of creatures, destroying lives, defying heaven and earth, disbelieving in sin and merit. The weight of their karmic deeds is immeasurable.

"They may establish the precious thrones of the Three Clarities and the stellar altars of the Five Emperors in the sacred halls of temples or within the pure chambers of their own homes. Burning incense and scattering flowers, they may prostrate before heaven and earth, repent and present memorials, beseeching the dissolution of their transgressions. Thus, their bodies and dwellings shall be purified, and all calamities shall be entirely eradicated, accruing boundless merit.

"If emperors, kings, empresses, imperial consorts, princes, or celestial descendants arouse the supreme aspiration and invite Daoist masters and ritual masters to establish a ritual arena in the main palace hall or a pure Daoist chamber for the sake of their seven generations of ancestors, seven generations of lineage, deceased parents, and all kin—reciting scriptures, performing repentance rituals, burning incense and lighting lamps, repenting and practicing the Dao, bestowing alms of wealth, clothing, and bedding, releasing living beings to extend their lives, and broadly conducting fasts and offerings with unwavering devotion—then I shall dispatch the Ten Celestial Perfected, the Four Controllers and Five Emperors, and the Ten Upright Numinous Officials to descend and observe.

"If their minds and bodies remain steadfast, the sick shall recover, the dead shall revive, the imperiled shall be delivered, the imprisoned shall be freed, travelers shall return, and officials shall be promoted. Water, fire, weapons of war, tigers, wolves, venomous beasts, evil spirits, and demonic sprites—all calamities and difficulties—shall never afflict their bodies. Their years shall be long, and each shall attain peace and tranquility.

"If, for the sake of deceased ancestors, they aspire to liberate them from the Nine Dark Hells, the Knife Mountains, the Sword Trees, the Cauldrons of Boiling Oil, and the torments of whips and cudgels, enabling them to ascend to the celestial halls, roam freely in non-action, and awaken to the supreme Dao—

"If, for emperors, empresses, princes, the people, the land, and all beings, they recite scriptures and perform repentance rituals to save and protect all, they shall enjoy peace in this life and accrue boundless merit.

"If weapons of war arise on all sides, harming the myriad people, reciting scriptures and performing repentance rituals shall cause them to retreat and disperse without inflicting harm.

"If epidemics spread and the people lie stricken with illness, reciting scriptures and performing repentance rituals shall bring immediate recovery and peace to the multitude.

"If floods and droughts disrupt the balance, harming the five grains, reciting scriptures and performing repentance rituals shall bring timely wind and rain, and the hundred grains shall flourish.

"If malevolent winds and poisonous qi, scorching fires, and conflagrations consume dwellings, reciting scriptures and performing repentance rituals shall harmonize the celestial qi, and all things shall be pure and moist.

"If evil ghosts, venomous insects, and fierce beasts harm people, reciting scriptures and performing repentance rituals shall cause them all to retreat and flee."

If women are with child and struggle in labor, unable to deliver, reciting scriptures and performing repentance rituals shall bring safety to both mother and child, sparing them from peril and distress.

If palaces, halls, or dwellings are troubled by spectral demons, malevolent spirits, or disturbed qi, reciting scriptures and performing repentance rituals shall restore tranquility, banishing all fear forever.

The Primordial Lord of the Dao addressed the perfected attendants at his side, saying: "The merit of repentance rituals is beyond comprehension. It safeguards nations and households, harmonizes Heaven and stabilizes Earth, dissolves celestial disasters above, and averts poisonous harm below. Its blessings are beyond measure, universally delivering gods and humans."

The Primordial Lord of the Dao spoke again to the perfected attendants: "For the sake of all beings, I have broadly established fields of merit, greatly constructing virtuous deeds—copying scriptures, creating images, founding temples to deliver people, reciting scriptures, performing repentance rituals, holding purification fasts, and practicing almsgiving. The karmic rewards are towering and truly profound.

Why is this so? Wealth is the lifeblood of beings, deeply cherished and hard to relinquish. Yet those who can surrender their lives and possessions without stinginess, widely establishing merit and aiding the destitute and impoverished, inwardly stilling greed and outwardly eliminating bandits and thieves, shall profit both humans and gods, and in life and death receive grace. The merit of such salvation brings boundless blessings, and even the seven generations of ancestral spirits shall all be delivered."

The Primordial Lord of the Dao addressed the perfected attendants at his side, saying: "I and the host of immortals gaze down upon all beings, whose lives are like mayflies—born at dawn, dead by dusk—truly pitiable and sorrowful.

When a person dies, the cycles of the Five Agents are exhausted, their qi severed and spirit departed, marrow drained and bones withered, their form desolate. Their heart trembles in fear, their spirit quakes in dread. At the moment of parting from life, they endure great suffering. Their inner and outer kin surround them, sons and daughters weeping in grief, the departing soul terrified, not knowing where it will go. As the body grows cold and hollow, and the last breath fades, the evil deeds and transgressions of their lifetime appear before them.

If one has accumulated goodness in past lives, heavenly beings shall support and protect them, and their soul shall ascend to realms of bliss. If one has accumulated transgressions in life, ox-headed demons and rakshasas shall drive them into hell, where they shall endure every torment.

At such a time, the mighty and noble, the proud and wealthy, all vanish in an instant. Fine carriages and grand steeds—what concern are they now? Estates, gold, and treasures all belong to others. Wives, children, and kin—can they take one’s place? All karmic adversaries stand before them, like shadows following form, inescapable.

Yet if faithful men and women make grand vows, offering great sacrifices to Heaven and Earth on behalf of deceased parents and all ancestral kin, submitting memorials and petitions, reciting true scriptures—it shall be as darkness finding light, as illness finding medicine, as poverty finding treasure, as hunger finding food, as a prisoner finding release, as drought finding rain. Their sins shall be washed away, and all shall be purified, ascending to halls of blessing, escaping the Five Sufferings, and attaining eternal deliverance."

The Primordial Lord of the Dao spoke again to the perfected attendants at his side: "In the ten directions of the world below, if devout and faithful men and women of the Dao, on behalf of suffering souls in hell or sin-laden evil ghosts, establish the precious altars of the Three Clarities and the sacred altars of the Five Emperors, burn incense and light lamps, offer rare delicacies and exotic fruits, submit memorials and petitions, and hold grand sacrifices to the hosts of heaven—for all creatures, whether the six livestock or flocks of fur and feather, donkeys, mules, oxen, or horses burdened by heavy karmic sins—I shall dispatch the Most High Lord of Salvation, the Heavenly Worthy of Primordial Unity, to open the Purple Tenuity’s Upper Palace and the precious caskets of jade registers. The august names of the Heavenly Worthies shall be proclaimed, and all people below shall be transmitted and delivered. Extolling and praising, chanting the cavernous scriptures, contemplating the divine and invoking the perfected, they shall beseech the erasure of sins from the Nine Dark Realms and the karmic burdens of the six livestock. Thus shall they be delivered to the heavens of humanity, freed from suffering, and attain boundless blessings, all achieving deliverance.

*Beginning of the Eighth Scroll of the Most High Numinous Treasure Repentance for Heavenly Homage and Atonement of Sins*

At that time, in the first kalpa of the Dragon Han era, the Primordial Celestial Venerable, the Great Sage of the Golden Portal, was in the Jade Clarity Sacred Realm’s Primordial Yang Treasure Palace, seated upon the Five Clouds Heavenly Treasure Wondrous Terrace, expounding the sublime Dharma to the celestial great sages. Suddenly, the gates of heaven trembled violently, and the Primordial Celestial Venerable, with his divine radiance, illuminated below. There appeared a dense, black, noxious, blood-red qi rising to assail the heavenly gates, coiling and lingering without dispersal. This qi reeked of blood and filth, startling the assembled host.

The Primordial Celestial Venerable addressed the celestial great sages and perfected ones at his side: "Below, in the vast and boundless Dark Sea of the great wilderness, whose depths are unfathomable, stands a great mountain piercing the azure vault above and descending into the windy springs below, named the Northern Yin Fengdu Mount Luo. It is the master of yin qi and the pivot of the nine earths. Beneath it lies a great cavern called the Palace of the Yin Realm, wherein resides the Supreme Yin Water Emperor. Within the Northern Yin Celestial Lord are myriad officials of the netherworld, and the mountain holds three palaces, nine bureaus, and thirty-six great iron hells. The grasses and trees of this mountain naturally emit toxic qi, transforming all into blades and swords. Their edges flash through the air, black smoke billows, and malevolent winds howl ceaselessly day and night—all places where the netherworld officials torture and punish sinful ghosts and the dead.

Within are six palaces of great demonic evil spirits who, seeing sentient beings lost in darkness and delusion, descend in formations to the human realm, wantonly creating monstrous calamities, harming the living, and entangling the souls of the seven generations of deceased ancestors. They bring forth all manner of disasters, malignant illnesses, plagues, and toxic qi, causing indiscriminate death and untimely harm—so pitiable that one cannot bear to hear of it.

Then the attendant perfected ones, arrayed in ranks, burned incense and memorialized, prostrating themselves and beseeching the Most Venerable to open the power of great compassion and wisdom, to save and deliver all beings, that both the living and the dead may receive grace and escape the suffering of sin. They implored: 'May all sinners be spared the three calamities of the present world, the nine misfortunes, the five pestilences, the seven afflictions, the myriad diseases, the toxic qi, and the perils of demonic spirits and ghosts. May their lives be free from harm.'"

Should you deign to show compassion, then lift your gaze and receive the sacred words.

Thereupon the Most Venerable addressed the attendant perfected ones, saying: "I pity all beings as a mother cherishes her child. Now, for your sake, I shall expound these wondrous words—heed them well, and hold them fast in your hearts."

The attendant perfected ones and all divine immortals bowed their heads to the ground, listening to the sacred decree of the Primordial Sovereign of the Dao.

In ancient times, the people were simple and guileless, free from malice, following the natural course of their fate. They fulfilled their allotted years without untimely harm. But in this degenerate age, human hearts have grown shallow and corrupt, rupturing the five emotions. Discord and deception prevail, deceit and delusion intertwine. They no longer speak of true cultivation but indulge in perverse conduct, forsaking the real for the false, abandoning the Dao and virtue. They defy heaven and earth, usurp ministers and overthrow rulers, disloyal and unfilial, devoid of love and compassion. They deceive and mislead the common folk, oppress and tyrannize the people, wrongfully kill living beings, and cruelly harm all life. They forge countless karmic enmities, inviting manifold calamities.

Some engage in robbery and plunder, committing murder and injury. Others fall prey to malevolent demons that destroy their bodies. Some suffer the bites of venomous snakes, tigers, wolves, or poisonous insects. Others face official disasters, slanderous tongues, or unjust imprisonment—beaten, bound, exiled, or sentenced to penal servitude. Some households are struck by plagues, their bodies afflicted by toxic qi, their kin ravaged by illness and death, their families torn asunder. Some are struck down by celestial thunder, others consumed by heavenly fire. All such transgressions arise from the weight of accumulated karma.

The qi of slaughter from the Six Heavens and the legions of ghosts from the Northern Feng, together with the deities of the Five Peaks and the ghostly marshals of the slain, roam the world, seizing upon the faults of sinners to unleash their toxic qi. They slaughter the wicked, who in turn prey upon one another, leading to death, the ruin of households, and the extinction of descendants. Witnessing this, I am deeply grieved—so pitiable that one cannot bear to hear of it.

Yet if there are those in the world who uphold the Dao, who awaken the supreme mind, who generously bestow wealth to relieve the destitute, who release living beings to extend their lives, who recite scriptures and repent with unwavering devotion—then above, they will dispel calamities, and below, they will avert myriad disasters.

Should a land be plagued by unending warfare and pestilence, if its people sincerely recite this repentance and observe pure fasts, then the scourge of war will cease, malevolent forces will withdraw, heaven and humanity will rejoice, and the nation will know peace.

If one finds themselves in the wilderness, pursued by tigers or wolves, let them sincerely invoke this scripture and vow to recite it—then protective deities will come to their aid, and the beasts will retreat, causing no harm.

If one ventures upon the sea and encounters fierce winds, let them vow to recite this scripture—then the waves will calm, and they will reach the shore.

If one is caught amidst the blades of battle, let them vow to recite this scripture—then weapons will vanish, and no harm will come.

If one is imprisoned in shackles, let them vow to recite this scripture—then their wrongs will be redressed, and they will surely be freed.

If one is tormented by malevolent spirits or demonic entities, let them vow to recite this scripture—then the spirits will vanish, daring not to cause harm.

When the day of one’s death arrives and their soul enters the Nine Dark Hells, if their family—sons, daughters, husbands, or wives—establishes a Nine Darks fast and ritual, offering reverence to the Three Palaces, then the soul will transcend the Five Sufferings and be reborn according to its merit.

Upon hearing this scripture, the sinners in the Nine Dark Hells will awaken in body and mind, all arousing the intention for the Dao, never to retreat. Thereupon, heaven will respond by sending a decree to release the imprisoned souls, and all will be delivered.

In that moment, the Black Registers of the Nine Darks will be consumed in flames, the flames of Fire Mountains will subside, the waves of Ice Pools will still, and those who once swallowed fire and ate coals will taste sweet dew. The golden hammers and iron rods will transform into lotus blossoms. Divine immortals will lift them up to ascend to the Southern Palace, where all will be reborn.

Through the great power of the Primordial Sovereign of the Dao and the boundless compassion of the Most Venerable, all beings will be saved, their bodies and minds purified, liberated from the Fengdu Hell, and reborn according to their wishes.

Then the Savior from Suffering Perfected One is commanded to open the Terrace of Yang, to unfurl the Jade Chest of Purple Scripts, and to proclaim the august name of the Heavenly Worthy.

You should establish the Three Clarities’ sacred thrones and the Five Emperors’ numinous altars, hang banners and offer flowers, array rare delicacies and exotic fruits, present solemn offerings, recite scriptures and repentances, submit memorials and petitions, and perform rituals to give thanks to the stellar hosts of the heavens, the Five Emperors, and the Three Officials. Burn incense and light lamps, chant the cavernous hymns, and beseech the erasure of the Nine Darks’ Jade Casket of Everlasting Night from the Registers of Luminous Perfection—so that all imprisoned souls may escape suffering, their boundless sins dissolved, and boundless blessings attained, to rely upon in life and death.

*The Ninth Scroll of the Supreme Pervasive Treasure Repentance for Atonement Before Heaven*

At that time, the Primordial Celestial Venerable was seated upon a seven-jeweled wondrous terrace within the Jade Capital’s Golden Portal in the Supreme Great Luo Heaven. Together with the Most High Jade Dawn Dao Lord and the Most High Sagely Ancestor Lord Lao, he assembled all the gods and immortals of the heavens to expound the wondrous Dharma, broadly delivering celestial and human beings, that all might attain the Dao and forever awaken to non-action. Then, among the Dharma assembly, the Jade Clarity Perfected and the Supreme Ultimate Perfected, along with the gods and immortals of all heavens, holding talismans and bearing tablets, burned incense and scattered flowers, pacing in celestial circles, extolling the sagely virtue. Never before had such been heard or seen. They stepped forth from the ranks to bow and addressed the Most Honored One: "We, your servants, humbly attend your cloud-borne chariot, having received the appointment to the ranks of the Perfected."

We observe that all sentient beings below are benighted in body and mind, unaware of the wondrous transformations of the Numinous Treasure’s spontaneous efficacy—how then may they be saved and delivered? Many suffer the six premature deaths and five injuries, the hundred spirits and nine grotesqueries; malevolent ghosts roam widely, pestilential poisons and myriad diseases arise, giving rise to calamities and misfortunes. Creditors and adversaries, slanderous tongues, and ceaseless wailing fill the air; human hearts are stricken with sorrow and dread. Cold and heat arise within, illness manifests without. They pray to unorthodox spirits, offer blood sacrifices in pursuit of blessings, and recklessly prognosticate fortune and misfortune, entangling themselves in a hundred monstrosities. Thus they incur guilt before the Three Officials, and the Ten Directing Spirits, the Deities of Destiny, and the Recorders inscribe their transgressions, submitting them to the Celestial Treasury. Their allotted years and blessings are stripped away, their lifespans shortened by the stroke of fate. They die by their own hands or are born into suffering, with no means of liberation.

At times, the Five Bushel Star Officials report omens of change: disasters, floods, droughts, unseasonable winds and rains, the fourfold rise of warfare, pestilence, and death. The sovereign is filled with anxiety, the common people plunged into misery, with no means of deliverance. We humbly beseech the Celestial Compassion of the Most High to safeguard the nation’s destiny, deliver the multitudes of the people, and radiantly proclaim the transformative power of the Dao, that all sentient beings may awaken to and comprehend the Orthodox and True, and all attain transcendence.

Then the Most High Primordial Lord addressed the Perfected attendants at his side: “Since the beginningless kalpas, I have constantly dwelt among humankind, teaching and delivering sentient beings, that the ten directions, the Three Realms, and all beings—mundane and sacred, celestial and human—might universally attain liberation, abide in serene constancy, and neither arise nor perish. By upholding the precepts, reciting the scriptures, and broadly establishing fields of merit, one may deliver and liberate sentient beings. All the sages revere this, all demons bow in submission, and their names are inscribed in the Upper Clarity.”

“I pity sentient beings for their benightedness in body and mind, unable to hear the teachings. Now, for your sake, I proclaim the Ten Supreme Precepts, which generate blessings for humans and devas, create good karma in life and death, bestow blessings, and dispel calamities—yielding boundless recompense.”

The Heavenly Worthy addressed the Perfected attendants: “The first precept: the multitudes of the lower realms must not kill, nor harbor the thought of killing, nor kill deliberately or out of greed. They must constantly practice compassion, delivering all sentient beings, and regard all beings as themselves.

The second precept: they must not steal, nor harbor the thought of theft. They must constantly practice yielding and decline ill-gotten gains, regarding all wealth and treasures as their own.

The third precept: they must not engage in licentiousness, nor harbor lustful thoughts. They must constantly practice purity, dwelling in seclusion amidst the scenery, and regard all men and women as their own flesh and blood.

The fourth precept: they must not be covetous or greedy, nor harbor greedy thoughts. They must constantly practice generosity, broadly aiding the poor, maintaining equanimity of mind, and making no distinction between self and others.

The fifth precept: they must not give way to anger, nor harbor angry thoughts. They must constantly practice joy, reconciling enemies and kin, and regard all sentient beings as their own children.

The sixth precept: they must not be deluded, nor harbor deluded thoughts. They must constantly practice wisdom, guiding the ignorant and confused, and regard all sentient beings as their own hands and feet.

The seventh precept: they must not engage in frivolous speech, nor harbor frivolous thoughts. They must constantly practice integrity, maintaining inner and outer harmony, and regard the scriptures and precepts with constant recitation.

The eighth precept: they must not speak falsely, nor harbor false thoughts. They must constantly practice sincerity, concealing nothing and deceiving none, and regard all people without false imaginings.

The ninth precept: they must not engage in harsh speech, cursing, or any form of verbal abuse. They must constantly maintain right mindfulness, never giving rise to malicious intent, and regard venomous serpents as self-generating their own poison.

The tenth precept: they must not sow discord among relatives and friends with divisive speech. They must constantly practice uprightness, never fostering partiality, and regard all beings without notions of favor or aversion.”

The Most High Primordial Lord addressed the Perfected attendants at his side: “These precepts I proclaim are the city walls and dwelling houses of sentient beings. Men and women who uphold them will constantly have Jade Lads and Jade Maidens, Vajra Warriors, and the Ten Celestial Benevolent Spirits attending and guarding them at their sides. They will dispel calamities, transcend adversities, preserve life, and prolong existence. Immortals will revere them, deities will guard their gates. Swords and weapons, water and fire, tigers and wolves, venomous serpents, illnesses, imprisonment, demonic thieves, malevolent spirits, hunger, cold, suffering, and all disasters and misfortunes will not afflict them. Those who seek sons will have sons; those who seek daughters will have daughters. Wealth, honor, longevity, and joy will follow their hearts’ desires. They will possess wisdom and intelligence, their forms and appearances will be upright and proper, and their merit and virtue will be towering and inconceivable.

If good-hearted men and women perform repentance rites, practice the Dao, uphold the precepts, and cultivate goodness, it will be like a precious sword cutting through all obstacles, like a Dharma boat ferrying all across, like a raging fire burning all away, like pure water washing all clean. From the Three Clarities downward to the perfected immortals of the ten directions, none fail to uphold these scriptures and precepts. The precepts serve to prevent wrongdoing and halt evil, to discipline body and mind, subdue external demons, and move the numinous immortals—yielding boundless blessings.”

The Most High Primordial Lord addressed the Perfected attendants at his side: “I observe that the sentient beings of the lower realms, since the beginningless kalpas, have taken human form only to indulge in stinginess, greed, and sensual desires, drinking wine and eating meat without restraint. They nourish their flesh and blood, fostering pus and filth, thereby generating illness and affliction, deepening the roots of sin, and enduring the sufferings of birth, old age, sickness, and death. Heat, dampness, wind, and cold assail them; pain, itching, aches, and soreness afflict them. Malignant winds and toxic qi enter their bodies, infecting their forms with a hundred diseases. Moment by moment, impermanence prevails; day and night, they weep in sorrow.

Their births and endowments of consciousness differ, yet day and night they cycle through myriad births and deaths. Some dwell in the womb, congealing into pus and blood, only to dissolve and vanish. Others remain in the mother’s belly, unable to be born; if born, they perish at once. Though briefly separated from their mothers, they die immediately—beyond count. Some live one or two years, others a hundred, yet in every moment they change, their essence and qi waning. Headaches and fevers, a thousand afflictions assail them. In their entire lives, they know little peace. This is truly due to their gluttonous consumption of filth, filling their bodies, the fumes of wine and meat steaming their organs, malignant winds and toxic qi fanning their frames, minerals and metals dissolving their forms—so that their bodies do not endure.”

I drink not, nor eat, abiding in the Dao by nature,
transforming without bound, living long without death.
Ever do I expound the scriptures and precepts,
opening the path to deliver all beings—
yet the common folk, deluded and foolish, cannot believe or accept.

I am ever filled with sorrow and compassion for this,
and so I set forth the rites of fasting,
that they may extinguish sickness and suffering.
I also reflect upon all beings:
since the beginningless kalpas of time,
through the two states of existence and perishing,
all their kin and kindred,
every transgression they have committed in this world—
the gods of the Five Paths,
the roaming messengers,
the Deities of Fate and Record,
the awe-inspiring spirits who inspect and record their offenses—
all these submit their reports to the heavens,
entangling them across lifetimes,
leaving no escape.
Every evil they have endured,
when may they hope to return?

Today, with the five limbs prostrate upon the earth,
burning incense and making repentance,
they beseech the erasure of the jade tablets of the Nine Dark Realms,
that all in heaven and earth may be freed from suffering,
their boundless sins dissolved,
their boundless blessings attained.

The Primordial Lord of the Dao once more addressed the perfected attendants at his side:
“If in the world below there are those who uphold the Dao,
who for the aquatic beings—dragons, turtles, fish, and clams,
the shelled and scaled creatures of the waters—
erect altars, perform repentance rites, recite scriptures,
burn incense, and light lamps,
repenting and cleansing the watery palaces and damp abodes of these creatures,
and beseech the grace of heaven to deliver them,
that all may shed their scales and shells,
return to the human path,
and have every transgression absolved—
then I command the Heavenly Worthy of Great Compassion and Salvation
to open the Palace of Radiant Yang,
to bring forth the jade tablets and golden registers bearing the august names of the Heavenly Worthies,
to extol and praise them,
to chant the sacred verses,
to present petitions for redemption,
that all aquatic beings—fish and dragons—
may be freed from suffering,
their boundless sins dissolved,
and boundless blessings born.

Thus do we burn incense,
devoting body and life,
prostrating with the five limbs upon the earth.
With single-minded reverence, we bow in homage.”

The Tenth Scroll of the *Supreme Lingbao Repentance for Atonement Before Heaven*

At that time, the Primordial Celestial Venerable was within the Golden Portal of the Great Luo Heaven, upon the jeweled terrace, gathering the multitude of immortals to broadly expound the wondrous Dharma for the deliverance of humanity. The celestial, terrestrial, and aquatic immortals of the Three Bureaus, the officials of the Five Peaks and Four Waterways, and the hundred departments of the earthly prisons all arrayed their majestic regalia, adjusted their swords and sashes, mounted cloud-dragons, ascended to the celestial portal, lined up to burn incense, and stood in attendance beside the jasper pavilion, each presenting the registers of life and death, blessings and sins of the people from the four directions. Then, the Primordial Celestial Venerable manifested his great numinous power, widely casting auspicious light to illuminate the mountains, rivers, and lands of the myriad nations, revealing even the most minute karmic transgressions without exception.

At that time, the Golden Flower Perfected One, the Jade Purity Perfected One, the Wondrous Conduct Perfected One, and the Savior from Suffering Perfected One burned incense and prostrated before the Most Venerable, presenting a memorial that said: "We now behold the multitudes of the lower realms, many of whom fail to believe and revere, indulging their bodies and minds, perpetuating cruel and poisonous deeds, slaughtering living beings, committing the three poisons of oral karma—so grave are their transgressions that the Ten Upright Deities, the Life-Recording and Register-Keeping Officials, record their crimes and submit them to the Celestial Treasury. Through kalpas unending, their sins entangle them, leaving no means of deliverance. Rewards and punishments, blessings and misfortunes are meted out with the precision of a hair’s breadth.

We see that those among the multitudes who accumulate goodness in life and perpetually practice hidden virtue are sheltered by the qi of Heaven, borne by the qi of Earth, illumined by the stars, revered by ghosts and spirits, followed by the Five Fortunes, and distanced from a thousand calamities. Yet those who accumulate transgressions and perpetrate cruel deeds in life are unsheltered by Heaven, unborne by Earth, unillumined by the stars, harmed by ghosts and spirits, distanced from the Five Fortunes, and followed by a thousand calamities. We observe this with profound sorrow and beseech the Celestial Compassion of the Most Venerable to broadly open the expedient means of salvation, universally delivering all beings to awakening and liberation from defilement."

Then the Most Venerable addressed the great Perfected Ones, saying: "I pity the myriad beings of the lower worlds as if they were my own children, desiring that all attain the Dao. Yet the sins of these beings run deep, and they dwell long in impurity, indulging their passions and desires, wallowing in defilement. In life, they perpetually indulge in lust. Some commit lewd acts within palaces, beneath the stars, or in sacred temples. Others do so in spirit shrines or at communal altars. Some seize and harm others, separating children from mothers, tearing lovers apart, severing bonds of affection, and cutting off tender care. Some engage in incest with kin, or unite with relatives. Others seduce slaves or servants, heedless of beauty or ugliness, wisdom or folly. Some oppress men and women, or sunder husbands and wives. Others defile the ordained, or bare themselves before Heaven and Earth, violating the four classes, indulging in every manner of lust, their minds filled with vile dreams, their couplings unrestrained. They give free rein to the six senses, their transgressions boundless, ensnaring body and mind, clouding the six consciousnesses, depleting their essence and qi, and amassing grave sins. Today, through repentance and purification, may all these transgressions be utterly eradicated."

The Primordial Celestial Venerable again addressed the attendant Perfected Ones at his side, saying: "I see that men and women of the lower realms, from the moment they conceive the intent to act, constantly engage in theft. Some steal sacred images of the Celestial Venerable, scriptures, Dharma treasures, or other property. Others steal from ordained Dharma masters, or from sacred temples and stellar altars. Some pilfer funds meant for the creation of revered images, or the estates and permanent assets of monasteries. Others take offerings meant for fasts and jiao rites, or the property of shrines and spirits. Some steal from their parents, children, or kin, or extort wealth through coercion. Others deceive through official matters, or forcibly seize property without just cause. Some employ deceit or false pretenses, or refuse to repay loans out of greed. Others exploit the ignorant, or bully and humiliate others to take their wealth. From the moment a single thought of theft arises, regardless of the amount, boundless sins accumulate unseen within, never brought to light. Today, as they burn incense and prostrate in repentance, may all their transgressions be washed away."

The Primordial Celestial Venerable again addressed the attendant Perfected Ones at his side, saying: "I observe the multitudes of the lower realms, amassing wealth like mountains, yet their hearts are never satisfied. Insatiable in greed, they scheme and contrive, toiling in body and mind, utterly devoid of benevolence. They live in the world with avaricious hearts, cutting and scraping. Some behold the Celestial Venerable or the stars and conceive miserly greed. Others see sacred temples or scriptures and do the same. Some encounter Daoist masters or Dharma teachers and grow stingy. Others see their parents or children and hoard their wealth. Some witness the poor, the orphaned, or the elderly and feel no pity. Others see the dying, the maimed, or the disabled and remain unmoved. Some observe prisoners in shackles or those in famine and feel no compassion. Others see travelers in distress, or those in water or fire emergencies, and turn away. Some exploit servants or laborers, yet refuse to give alms. They withhold offerings from the Celestial Venerable and stellar altars, from scriptures and registers, from fasts and jiao rites, from the copying of scriptures or the creation of images, from virtuous Dharma masters, from the poor and orphaned, from prisoners in shackles, from the sick and suffering, from those in water or fire emergencies, from travelers in dire need, or from those starving in famine.

A person lives for a day, yet plans for a hundred years. Born with not a single coin, they depart with not a single coin. At death, all is emptiness. How foolish to cling to miserliness and greed, devoid of compassion! At the moment of death, their treasures, mansions, storehouses, estates, and lands all pass to others. Their wives and children weep, their kin scatter—what benefit remains? In life, they accumulate karma, each deed bearing its retribution, too dreadful to recount.

I further see the multitudes of the lower realms, who daily amass sins, their hearts entangled in greed and malice, cutting and scraping from the orphaned and poor without a shred of pity. Some stand before sacred images of the Celestial Venerable and conceive anger. Others do so before temples and scriptures, or upon seeing ordained Daoists."

Some grow enraged upon seeing scriptures copied or images crafted. Some grow enraged upon seeing fasting rites or Daoist altars. Some grow enraged upon seeing temple spirits or deities. Some grow enraged upon seeing the old, the sick, the orphaned, or the poor. Some grow enraged upon seeing prisoners in their cells. Some grow enraged upon seeing the dying in dire straits. Some grow enraged upon seeing floods, fires, or calamities. Some grow enraged upon seeing famine and starvation. Some grow enraged upon seeing slaves or laborers. Some grow enraged upon seeing the destitute begging. Some grow enraged upon seeing oxen, horses, or the six livestock. Such karmic impulses of the heart are measureless and boundless. In all their conduct and bearing, in every thought and intention, they lack all mercy and forbearance. Today, they prostrate themselves in repentance, beseeching the erasure of all these transgressions.

The Primordial Lord of the Dao says: I observe the multitudes of the lower realms, who conduct themselves in the world with the six senses benighted, utterly devoid of even a shred of goodness. Some, before sacred images of the Celestial Venerable, act in utter folly. Some, before the stars and the Great Dao, act in utter folly. Some, before Daoist temples and sacred altars, act in utter folly. Some, in the midst of scripture recitations and Daoist rites, act in utter folly. Some, upon seeing ordained Daoists, act in utter folly. Some, upon seeing the sages of the empty sky, act in utter folly. Some, before their parents, wives, or children, act in utter folly. Some, before Heaven and Earth, the sun, the moon, and the stars, act in utter folly. Some curse Heaven and Earth, or revile and imprecate spirits and deities. Some rebel against their lords and fathers, or fail in filial piety to their ancestors. Some turn misfortune into disaster, establish laws that disrupt the natural order, commit incest with their kin, or murder others. They disbelieve in the karmic conditions of sin and blessing, in the retributions of past lives, claiming themselves eternal, neither born nor perishing, unable to distinguish good from evil, or the wise from the foolish. Such folly is unbearable to witness.

All the Perfected Ones now burn incense and prostrate themselves in homage before the Golden Portal of the Celestial Emperor, vowing that from this day forth, for all beings in the lower realms, the three karmic deeds of body, heart, and speech shall be released. May they ever attain purity of the six senses, forever free from contention, ever cultivating hearts of gentleness, harmony, compassion, and love, hearts free from heedlessness and arrogance, free from greed and miserliness. May they ever cultivate hearts of joy, hearts that refrain from killing and protect life, hearts of filial piety, loyalty, and trust, hearts that relieve the poor and rescue the distressed, hearts that benefit all beings with generosity. Those who cultivate such hearts shall be guarded by the ten celestial deities of goodness, their worldly misfortunes forever dispelled, their sins and calamities scattered and destroyed. They shall be forever free from fear, received by immortals, and all shall attain deliverance.

The Primordial Lord of the Dao further addresses the Perfected Ones in attendance: From this day forth, if among the multitudes of the lower realms there are faithful followers of the Dao who, for all foolish beings burdened by sin and evil karma—including the winged and the crawling, the birds and beasts, and the six livestock—establish sacred altars, recite scriptures, perform repentance rites, light lamps, burn incense, prostrate themselves, and present memorials to the heavens, earnestly and without ceasing offering rites of thanksgiving to Heaven and Earth, the sun, the moon, the stars, the Five Peaks, the Four Waterways, and the officials of Fengdu’s netherworld, then I shall dispatch the Most High Lord of Salvation from Suffering. From the Azure Repository within the Northern Numinous Purple Pavilion, he shall bring forth the Jade Tablets of Golden Script bearing the august names of the Celestial Venerable. Chanting and extolling the sacred hymns, contemplating the true and invoking the Dao, he shall beseech the erasure of their names from the Jade Archives of the Nine Dark Realms and the Bureaus of the Celestial Officials. Thus shall the Five Sufferings be absolved and the Three Wretched Paths released. The feathered and furred shall be freed from their sins, all attaining deliverance, returning to the human realm, no longer mired in suffering, forever dwelling in carefree ease, their wishes fulfilled.

They shall ascend beyond the Three Realms, roaming freely in the Supreme Clarity.

Should there be men or women in the world who, on the Three Origins and Eight Festivals, present memorials and petitions, reverently giving thanks to Heaven and Earth, observe pure fasts, and recite the precious names of the Three Clarities, then the perfected ones of the myriad heavens shall, for the hidden souls in hells, the six kinds of livestock, the scaled tribes of water, the dwellers of damp abodes, and all manner of creeping creatures, absolve their transgressions. For those who pray to wash away the calamities of past lives, may all be universally delivered from the gates of earth, forever departing the offices of ghosts, transformed into human form, and universally attain liberation.”

Master Chongmiao burned incense and gave thanks to the August Emperor of the Golden Portal, offering this hymn of praise:

Immortals together grant deliverance,

Here ends the Tenth Scroll of the *Great Repentance of the Lingbao for the Heavenly Seasons*.

chunks.original_text: 太上灵宝朝天谢罪大忏 经名：太上灵宝朝天谢罪大忏。 十卷。 底本出处：《正统道藏》洞真部威仪类。 太上灵宝朝天谢罪大忏卷之一 尔时，元始上帝、太上道君、太上老君在大罗天上玉清圣境，大福天中坐七宝紫微之台，大会群仙，讲演真一妙法，施大威力，布大祥光。 普照无极世界善恶因缘，开示一切众生，令知宿命罪福、过去未来、三世报应之事。 是时，诸天大圣烧香朝拜，列班侍卫，仰听法音。 元始上帝放九色神光、彻照诸天下及万国，威神变化，洞彻无阂，皎在目前，犹如指掌。 左右群仙乘此威光，得见诸天，善恶因缘，内外备尽。 见有大圣高真，项负圆光，身相严妙，或驾景乘空，腾龙驭鹤，飞云步虚，鸾舆凤盖，遨游八极，逍遥无为，神通自在。 或见天仙地仙、金童玉女、无鞅数众，福德快乐。 或见诸仙持旛执节，烧香散华，分身变化。 或见飞天神王、善恶童子，巡游人间，条录善恶，以奏诸天。 或见日月宫殿、星宿宝宫、山河海岳灵官，考校人民，善恶功过，毫分不失。 时有十华真人与诸天大圣，烧香朝拜，上奏至尊，今日得诣琼轩，观听妙会，忝侍左右，愿施威力，建大法桥，接引群伦，咸使得道，永出尘迷。 是时元始上帝告左右侍真曰：卿等群仙，随吾祥光，下观万国大地，山河兆民，善恶报应。 崇建功德、广种福田者，一一皆受诸天人福。 见有帝王后妃、将相大臣，正殿烧香，广陈法会，修奉斋醮，转经礼忏，为一切人天禳灾祈福。 见有帝王后妃、将相大臣、卑身下物，广持百宝，供养诸天。 见有帝王后妃、将相大臣，建立宫观，塑造圣像，转经礼拜，为一切人天广求福利。 见有帝王后妃、将相大臣，散施财宝，救济贫穷老病困苦。 见有帝王后妃、将相大臣，常行慈悲，不杀不害，不奢不费，常行俭约。 见有道士贤者，修建灵观星坛，写经造像。 见有道士贤者，断谷休粮，清净身心，诵习经典。 见有道士贤者，放生续命，济惠贫乏。 见有道士贤者，翘勤星汉，以求轻举。 见有道士贤者，忠孝君亲，慈爱知友。 见有帝王国主、文武大臣，游猎杀害，伤残百姓。 见有帝王国主、文武大臣，酷虐严刑，人民困弊。 见有帝王国主、文武大臣，贪淫贪欲，恣纵六情，宴乐无度。 见有帝王国主、文武大臣、毁坏宫观，烧除法宇。 见有帝王国主、文武大臣，轻慢出家，陵辱法师，苦痛刑害。 见有帝王国主、文武大臣，轻慢天地、日月、星辰，鸩毒善人。 见有男女诽谤出家法身，於宫观中行诸淫欲，杀害群毛，秽污福地。 见有男女杀害父母，五逆不孝，违天负地，不信罪福。 见有男女偷盗常住三宝，供养财物，花果旛幢。 见有男女背道叛师，违盟负誓，抵债欺心。 见有男女柳锁牢狱，鞭笞拷掠，残害身形。 见有男女六形不具，痴聋喑哑，手足挛缩。 见有男女愚痴憨呆，风癞类狂。 见有男女毒虫猛兽，吞螫搏噬。 见有男女中道分离，不终於亲。 见有男女子母分张，卖身奴婢。 见有男女身体破裂，虫烂脓血。 又见地狱，足履刀山，肢体断坏。 又见地狱，手攀剑树，肢节分张。 又见地狱，吞火食炭，遍身烟出。 又见地狱，碓捣硙磨，屑屑如粉。 又见地狱，身抱铜柱，形体焦枯。
chunks.translated_text:
**The Supreme Numinous Treasure Repentance for Audience with Heaven**

**Title:** *The Supreme Numinous Treasure Repentance for Audience with Heaven*
**Ten fascicles.** *Source text:* *Zhengtong Daoist Canon*, *Dongzhen* Section, *Weiyi* Category.

---

**Fascicle One**

At that time, the Primordial Celestial Venerable, the Supreme Dao Lord, and the Supreme Old Lord were in the Jade Purity Sacred Realm of the Great Brahma Heaven, seated upon the Seven-Treasured Purple Tenuity Terrace within the Heaven of Great Blessing. Assembling the multitude of immortals, they expounded the wondrous Dharma of True Unity, manifesting great majestic power and spreading vast auspicious radiance. Universally illuminating the boundless worlds, they revealed to all sentient beings the karmic conditions of good and evil, enabling them to know the retributions of past lives, the rewards of merit and sin, and the consequences of the Three Times.

Thereupon, the celestial great sages burned incense and prostrated in audience, arraying themselves in ranks to attend and listen to the Dharma-sound. The Primordial Celestial Venerable emitted nine-colored divine light, penetrating and illuminating all heavens below and the myriad lands. His majestic spirit transformed, pervading without obstruction, as clear as if held in the palm of the hand. The assembled immortals to his left and right, riding this majestic radiance, beheld the heavens and the karmic conditions of good and evil, both inner and outer, fully revealed.

They saw great sages and lofty perfected ones, their necks bearing circular aureoles, their forms adorned with wondrous marks—some riding upon light and traversing the void, soaring on dragons and driving cranes, treading clouds and pacing the emptiness, or journeying in simurgh-drawn chariots with phoenix canopies, roaming the Eight Extremes in carefree nonaction, their divine transformations self-mastered. Some beheld celestial and terrestrial immortals, golden lads and jade maidens, innumerable multitudes, blessed with happiness and joy. Some saw immortals bearing banners and holding tablets, burning incense and scattering flowers, multiplying their forms in transformation. Some saw flying celestial deva-kings and karmic youths, patrolling the human realm, recording good and evil to report to the heavens. Some saw the palaces of the sun and moon, the jeweled abodes of the stellar lodges, and the numinous officials of mountains, rivers, seas, and peaks, examining the people, assessing their good and evil deeds and merits, without the slightest error.

Then, the Ten Flower Perfected Ones, together with the celestial great sages, burned incense and prostrated in audience, ascending to address the Most Venerable: "Today, we have been granted the honor of attending this jeweled pavilion, beholding and hearing this wondrous assembly. Humbly standing at your side, we pray that you manifest your majestic power, erect a great Dharma-bridge, and guide all beings, that they may attain the Dao and forever transcend the delusions of the dust."

Thereupon, the Primordial Celestial Venerable addressed the attendant perfected ones at his side: "You, the assembled immortals, follow my auspicious radiance and descend to observe the myriad lands and the earth, the mountains and rivers, and the multitudes of people, witnessing the retributions of good and evil. Those who establish meritorious deeds and broadly cultivate fields of blessing shall each receive the blessings of the heavens and humanity.

They saw emperors, empresses, generals, and ministers burning incense in the main halls, widely convening Dharma-assemblies, observing fasts and offering libations, reciting scriptures and performing repentance rites for the sake of all humans and devas to avert calamities and pray for blessings. They saw emperors, empresses, generals, and ministers humbling themselves before all beings, generously offering a hundred treasures to worship the heavens. They saw emperors, empresses, generals, and ministers establishing palaces and temples, sculpting sacred images, reciting scriptures and prostrating in worship to broadly seek blessings and benefits for all humans and devas. They saw emperors, empresses, generals, and ministers dispersing wealth and treasures to relieve the poor, the aged, the sick, and the destitute. They saw emperors, empresses, generals, and ministers constantly practicing compassion, refraining from killing or harming, avoiding extravagance and waste, and always practicing frugality.

They saw worthy Daoists constructing numinous temples and stellar altars, copying scriptures and crafting images. They saw worthy Daoists abstaining from grains and fasting, purifying body and mind, reciting and studying scriptures. They saw worthy Daoists releasing life to extend longevity, aiding and benefiting the impoverished. They saw worthy Daoists diligently striving toward the stellar Han to seek lightness and ascension. They saw worthy Daoists loyal to their lords and filial to their parents, compassionate and loving toward friends.

They saw emperors, kings, civil and military ministers hunting and killing, harming and injuring the common people. They saw emperors, kings, civil and military ministers imposing cruel and harsh punishments, oppressing the people. They saw emperors, kings, civil and military ministers indulging in lust and desire, unrestrained in the six senses, feasting and reveling without moderation. They saw emperors, kings, civil and military ministers destroying palaces and temples, burning and demolishing Dharma-halls. They saw emperors, kings, civil and military ministers disdaining monastics, humiliating Dharma-teachers, inflicting pain and punishment. They saw emperors, kings, civil and military ministers slighting Heaven and Earth, the sun and moon, and the stellar lodges, poisoning and harming the virtuous. They saw men and women slandering the Dharma-body of monastics, engaging in licentious acts within temples, killing living creatures, and defiling sacred grounds. They saw men and women killing their parents, committing the five heinous acts of unfiliality, defying Heaven and betraying Earth, disbelieving in sin and merit. They saw men and women stealing the permanent possessions of the Three Treasures—offerings of wealth, flowers, fruits, banners, and canopies. They saw men and women betraying the Dao and rebelling against their teachers, violating vows and breaking oaths, deceiving others to settle debts. They saw men and women bound in willow locks and imprisoned, whipped, beaten, and tortured, their bodies maimed. They saw men and women with incomplete six senses, mute, deaf, or dumb, their hands and feet crippled and contracted. They saw men and women foolish, dull, and witless, afflicted with leprosy or madness. They saw men and women devoured or stung by venomous insects and fierce beasts. They saw men and women separated midway in life, not fulfilling their bonds with kin. They saw men and women torn from their mothers, sold into slavery. They saw men and women with bodies split open, rotting with maggots and festering with pus and blood.

They further saw hells where feet tread upon knife-mountains, limbs severed and bodies broken. They saw hells where hands grasp sword-trees, limbs and joints torn asunder. They saw hells where fire is swallowed and coals are eaten, smoke issuing from the entire body. They saw hells where pestles pound, mills grind, and bodies are reduced to dust. They saw hells where bodies embrace copper pillars, forms scorched and withered."

chunks.original_text: 神升金阙，名列玉清，天无氛秽，万国咸宁，功德巍巍，福禧无极。 志心朝礼， 王屋山小有清虚洞天仙官， 委羽山大有空明洞天仙官， 西域山太玄极真洞天仙官， 西玄山三玄极真洞天仙官， 青城山宝仙九台洞天仙官， 天台山上清玉平洞天仙官， 罗浮山朱明耀真洞天仙官， 茅山金坛华阳洞天仙官， 林屋山左神幽墟洞天仙官， 括苍山神德隐玄洞天仙官， 霍橦山霍林洞天仙官， 东岳泰山青帝真君， 蓬玄太空洞天仙官， 南岳衡山赤帝真君， 朱陵太虚洞天仙官， 西岳华山白帝真君， 太极总仙洞天仙官， 北岳常山黑帝真君， 太一总玄洞天仙官， 中岳嵩山黄帝真君， 上帝司真洞天仙官， 峨眉山虚灵太妙洞天仙官， 庐山仙灵咏真洞天仙官， 四明山赤水洞天仙官， 阳明山极玄洞天仙官。 元始上帝再告左右侍真曰：吾今以此经散布万国九州，十方世界。 若有奉道之民，发无上道意，遇三元八节之日，为帝王国主、储君太子，烧香朝礼，转念三清宝号、天尊真人名位者，安镇国祚，保天长存，世世不绝，长为人君。 冲妙先生朝谢金阙上帝而献颂曰： 上帝降命，圣算绵长。 金枝挺秀，玉叶弥芳。 五星顺序，七曜垂芒。 赫赫煌煌，空洞灵章。 福我圣皇，宝祚无疆。 天清地宁，万宇辉光。 太上灵宝朝天谢罪大忏卷之一竟 太上灵宝朝天谢罪大忏卷之二 尔时，元始上帝，於赤明劫初，在玉清大罗天上，南丹开阳上馆火炼宫中，大会群仙，四方天帝、无量天人、玉童玉女，持符执节，烧香散花。 吟咏洞章，旋绕天宝妙台； 龙烛凤灯，罗列照耀至尊。

The divine ascends to the Golden Gates, their names inscribed in the Jade Clarity. The heavens are free of defilement, and the ten thousand states enjoy perfect peace. Their merit towers high, their blessings and felicity boundless.

With sincere devotion, we bow in reverence to:
the Immortal Officers of the Xiaoyou Qingxu Grotto-Heaven of Wangwu Mountain,

the Immortal Officers of the Taiyi Zongxuan Grotto-Heaven,
the Yellow Thearch True Lord of Mount Song, the Central Marchmount,
the Immortal Officers of the Shangdi Sizhen Grotto-Heaven,
the Immortal Officers of the Xuling Taimiao Grotto-Heaven of Mount Emei,
the Immortal Officers of the Xianling Yongzhen Grotto-Heaven of Mount Lu,
the Immortal Officers of the Chishui Grotto-Heaven of Mount Siming,
the Immortal Officers of the Jixuan Grotto-Heaven of Mount Yangming.

The Primordial Celestial Venerable once more addressed the attendant perfected ones at his side: "I now scatter this scripture across the ten thousand states and nine provinces, and the worlds of the ten directions. Should there be those who uphold the Dao, who arouse the unsurpassed intention for the Dao, and on the days of the Three Origins and eight seasonal nodes, for the sake of the emperor, the lord of the realm, or the heir apparent and crown prince, burn incense and bow in reverence, reciting the precious titles of the Three Clarities and the names of the Celestial Venerables and perfected ones, they shall secure the peace of the imperial throne, preserving the enduring harmony of Heaven, ensuring their line shall never be severed, and that they shall forever remain sovereigns of the people."

Master Chongmiao prostrated in thanks before the Celestial Venerable of the Golden Gates and offered this hymn of praise:
"The Celestial Venerable bestows his mandate,
His sagely calculations stretch far and long.
Golden branches flourish,
Jade leaves ever fragrant.
The Five Stars follow their order,
The Seven Luminaries cast their radiance.
Resplendent and glorious,
The wondrous celestial verses resound through the void.
Bless our sagely emperor,
His precious throne without end.
Heaven is clear, Earth is tranquil,
The myriad realms shine with brilliance."

*Thus concludes the first fascicle of The Supreme Numinous Treasure Repentance for Audience with Heaven and Atonement for Transgressions.*

*The second fascicle of The Supreme Numinous Treasure Repentance for Audience with Heaven and Atonement for Transgressions begins.*

At that time, the Primordial Celestial Venerable, at the beginning of the Red Clarity Kalpa, in the Upper Palace of the Fire Refinement within the Southern Vermilion Open Yang of the Great Luo Heaven of Jade Clarity, convened a grand assembly of the host of immortals. The Celestial Thearchs of the four directions, the boundless heavenly beings, jade lads and jade maidens, holding talismans and bearing tablets, burned incense and scattered flowers. They chanted the verses of the grottoes, circling the wondrous terrace of the celestial treasures. Dragon candles and phoenix lamps were arrayed in rows, illuminating the Most Honored One.

chunks.original_text: 圣德巍巍； 叹未闻见。 是时，元始上帝以大威力，布大祥光，普照十方，无量国土，皆同一相，表裹开通，一如琉璃，清莹无碍。 十方大圣、一切侍真，随至尊祥光，下见十方万国九州，山河大地，人民苦乐，地狱天堂，罪福果报，如在目前。 是时诸天神王、三府灵官，列班朝礼，进呈天下国土人民罪福之籍，一一分明，并无差忒。 是时，有玉清真人、金华真人与会中一切神仙，烧香局蹐，朝拜至尊。 今日忝预法筵，面礼慈光，观听法音，开导尘迷，咸使悟道，实为夙庆。 元始上帝告左右侍真曰：吾尝在玉清天中下观一切兆民。 积善崇福者，皆有福报。 见有广造经像、立观度人、布施斋戒、济生度死、普救一切者，生天王国主身、供养三宝、烧香然灯、诵经礼拜、广建福田、救灾拔难者，生皇后国母身、信乐经法，持斋念道，布施贫乏者，生富贵聪明身、常行慈悲、济生度死、崇奉三宝、烧香不怠者，生清净出家身、信奉修行，供养星辰者，生长命清净端正身、成就宫观、建立灵坛者，生大富贵聪明身、布施救贫、成就功德无所吝惜者，生天人中身、不杀不盗、不嫉不害者，生长命具足身、供养三宝、怜念一切、慈悲於物者。 生高上豪贵身、子孙昌盛、长命富贵者，从供养天尊大道星辰中来。 夫妻和睦、男女柔顺者，从不隔恩爱中来。 在处得人敬仰、甘膳美衣者，从敬奉天地、礼信三宝中来。 见世尊胜豪贵、人见畏惧者，从敬信三宝中来。 出家法身、为人敬奉者，从说法教化中来。 富贵巍巍、永劫不衰者，从布施成就功德中来。 身心清净、智慧明了者，从护持经法中来。 所居快乐、无诸灾厄者，从放生救物、不害众生中来。 子孙丰足、富贵长寿者，从广行布施求福中来。 女人降生贵子、夫妇常敬爱者，从道场教化信心中来。 形容端正、笑语柔和、众人恭敬者，从供养三宝、持奉经戒中来。 已上福报，皆生世祖祢阴德种植，致得今身之报。 或一身积善，致使宿命善因，得福无量。 元始上帝再谓左右神仙曰：吾见毁坏天尊星辰、大道形像者，死入九幽地狱，酆都考罚。 万劫方生病癞百虫、啖噬臭秽身。 訾毁三洞经箓法典、改换品帙者，死入地狱，考罚百劫，方生野兽舌根烂坏身。 诽谤出家法身者，见世虫癞、过去生六畜身。 破坏宫观灵坛、毁拆真馆者，见世眉须堕落，身体烂坏，过去生毒蛇饿虎身。 不敬天尊大道星辰者，见世愚痴憨痪，过去生六畜鸟兽身。 不信经法宿命报对者，见世为奴婢、过去生蛮夷虏狄身。 轻慢出家法身、秽污三宝福地者，见世跛璧、过去生猜狗身。 淫犯出家、陵辱法师者，见世形容腥臭、过去生粪秽厕溷毒虫身。 邪淫好色、不别尊卑者，见世风邪、过去生六畜猜羊牛马身。 偷盗常住财物及四辈信施衣帛者，过去生颠狂愚痴身。 偷盗三宝花果蔬菜斋食者，见世得消渴饥病、过去生饿虎毒蛇身。 偷盗斋醮供养法食者，见世逢霹雳恶鬼杀害、过去生蟒蛇毒虫身，又生饿狗毒猲身。 骂詈出家法身恶言陵辱者，见世得风痫恶疾、过去生狂狗猛兽身。 破斋犯戒者，见世遭逢牢狱、过去生蝇蛆蝼蚁身。 杀害众生恣心宰杀者，见世得短命疾病、牢狱考决身。 食肉贪杀六畜者，见世百病困苦、过去生麋鹿野兽身。

The sacred virtue towers sublime; yet we have never beheld it. At that time, the Primordial Celestial Venerable, with great majestic power, spread vast auspicious radiance, universally illuminating the ten directions. In the boundless lands, all became of one appearance—inner and outer opened and pervaded, like lapis lazuli, pure and luminous without obstruction. The great sages of the ten directions and all attendant perfected beings, following the Most Honored One’s auspicious light, descended to behold the ten directions, the myriad lands, the nine provinces, mountains and rivers, the great earth, the suffering and joy of the people, hells and heavens, the retribution of sins and blessings, all as if before their very eyes.

At that time, the divine kings of the heavens and the spirit officials of the Three Bureaus arrayed themselves in ranks to pay homage. They presented the registers of the sins and blessings of the lands and peoples of the world, each clearly distinguished, without error or omission. Then, the Perfected of Jade Clarity and the Perfected of Golden Splendor, along with all the immortals in the assembly, burned incense and bowed in reverence, prostrating before the Most Honored One. Today, we humbly partake in this Dharma feast, beholding the compassionate radiance, listening to the Dharma’s sound, awakening the deluded in the dust, and universally guiding them to realize the Dao—truly, this is our long-accumulated blessing.

The Primordial Celestial Venerable addressed the attendant perfected beings at his side: "I have often descended from the Jade Clarity Heaven to observe all the myriad people. Those who accumulate goodness and revere blessings all receive their due retribution. I see those who broadly create scriptures and images, establish temples to deliver people, practice almsgiving and fasting, relieve the living and deliver the dead, universally saving all—such beings are reborn as kings in heavenly realms, as rulers of kingdoms. Those who make offerings to the Three Treasures, burn incense and light lamps, recite scriptures and pay homage, widely establish fields of blessing, and rescue from disasters and hardships—such beings are reborn as queens and mothers of nations. Those who joyfully believe in the scriptures and Dharma, uphold fasting and contemplate the Dao, and give alms to the poor—such beings are reborn in wealthy, noble, and wise forms. Those who constantly practice compassion, relieve the living and deliver the dead, revere the Three Treasures, and never cease burning incense—such beings are reborn in pure, renunciate forms. Those who believe, practice, and make offerings to the stars—such beings are reborn with long lives, purity, and upright beauty. Those who complete temples and establish sacred altars—such beings are reborn in great wealth, nobility, and wisdom. Those who give alms to relieve the poor and accomplish merit without stint—such beings are reborn among heavenly beings. Those who do not kill, steal, envy, or harm—such beings are reborn with long lives and complete faculties. Those who make offerings to the Three Treasures, cherish all beings, and practice compassion toward creatures—such beings are reborn in lofty, noble, and exalted forms. Those whose descendants flourish, with long lives and wealth—such blessings arise from making offerings to the Celestial Venerable, the Great Dao, and the stars. Those whose couples are harmonious and whose sons and daughters are gentle and obedient—such blessings arise from never severing love and affection. Those who are respected and revered wherever they go, enjoying sweet food and fine clothing—such blessings arise from revering heaven and earth and faithfully honoring the Three Treasures. Those who are nobly exalted in this life, feared by all—such
chunks.overlap_context: in the Southern Vermilion Open Yang of the Great Luo Heaven of Jade Clarity, convened a grand assembly of the host of immortals. The Celestial Thearchs of the four directions, the boundless heavenly beings, jade lads and jade maidens, holding talismans and bearing tablets, burned incense and scattered flowers. They chanted the verses of the grottoes, circling the wondrous terrace of the celestial treasures. Dragon candles and phoenix lamps were arrayed in rows, illuminating the Most Honored One.

chunks.original_text: 嗜酒过度、好食荤辛臭秽者，见世风狂猛火焚烧、过去生猿猴身。 死入地狱镬汤中。 又见一切众生，见世手脚断坏、拳缩跛足者，从不敬三宝星辰中来。 两眼双盲、舌根烂坏者，从毁訾经教、轻忽三宝中来。 喑哑不能言语、鼻塞不闻香臭者，从诳说出家、不信经法中来。 眉毛堕落、唇攐舌露、鼻梁崩倒者，从破坏道场、诽谤三宝中来。 颠狂迷妄、形容丑陋者，从唝嗃傲慢、非笑出家法身中来。 劫贼相逢、伤害财物者，从劫夺三宝、常住财物中来。 水溺漂沉、鱼龙伤害者，从损坏三宝常住中来。 火烧灼烂、毒蛇吞噬者，从杀害出家、毁拆观舍中来。 毒虫入口、吐血秽污者，从恶口咒诅、叫唤鬼神中来。 毒虫入孔窍、食啖虎狼、猛兽伤害者，从阴谋毒害欺心中来。 父母妻子离隔、常不同居、昼夜相骂者，从嫉妬奸淫、破人和合、离人骨肉中来。 媅淫不避亲疏好丑者，从猪狗六畜中来。 嗜肉好杀、嗜酒猖狂者，从鱼鳖虾蟆、毒虫猛兽中来。 身体秽污、不净臭秽者，从科蚪毒虫中来。 牛马六畜者，从杀生负讳抵债中来。 野兽獐鹿蝮蝎蟒蛇者，从嫉妬毒害阴谋中来。 饿虎豺狼者，从欺陵劫夺杀伤中来。 厕溷秽虫虾蟆科蚪蝼蚁者，从轻亵三宝、不生敬信中来。 猘犬野猪鱼鳖怪虫者，从背师弃本、违犯经教中来。 燕雀鸠鸰者，从评论经法、自作口业中来。 鹰鹯鸷鸟者，从犯触出家、破毁经教中来。 堕子落胎、腹大项细者，从非笑三宝、傲诞出家中来。 牢狱枷锁、考掠切身者，从谄毒阿党、残虐贫下中来。 鞭掊楚挞、枷锁牢狱者，从毒害贪虐中来。 猫犬野豻豺狼狐貉者，从贪吝虚诞娇诈中来。 鼠融蜈蚣蛐蜓生身者，从阴毒妬害中来。 蜂趸蝎毒蝘蜓蜥蜴者，从咒诅出家、欺忽三宝中来。 蜘蛛曲蟮蚊( )蚤虱者，从慢法轻道、笑谤经籍中来。 边夷下贱、秃头断发、眼深鼻长、身体腥秽者，从杀生邪淫、不信因缘中来。 元始天尊告左右侍真曰：已上罪业，死经地狱受诸考罚，历劫受罪，方得此身。 亦有见世业报，生身所犯业报因缘，一一明示，各须澄心忏悔，获福无量。 元始天尊再告左右侍真曰：下界若有奉道信心男女，发无上诚心，为皇后贵妃、七庙天宗、历世贵族，建三清宝座，五帝星坛，挂旛献花，百珍异果，然香点灯，大醮星辰，拔赎魂仪者，吾遣太乙救苦天尊，开朱陵之阙丹简紫箓，出天尊懿号，赞叹称扬，吟咏洞章，解释九幽滞魄，宿业释散，五道开通，逍遥无为，超生福果。 一切罪犯，并得消除。 是故烧香，归身归命，五体投地。

Those who indulge excessively in alcohol and favor pungent, foul, and filthy foods—such beings in this life suffer madness and are consumed by raging fire, and in past lives were reborn as apes and monkeys. They descend into hell, plunged into cauldrons of boiling liquid.

Moreover, all beings who in this life have severed or crippled limbs, clenched and withered hands, or lame and crooked feet—such afflictions arise from disrespecting the Three Treasures and the stars. Those who are blind in both eyes or whose tongues fester and rot—such afflictions arise from slandering the scriptures and belittling the Three Treasures. Those who are mute and unable to speak, or whose noses are blocked and cannot smell—such afflictions arise from deceiving the ordained and disbelieving the scriptures and Daoist teachings. Those whose eyebrows fall out, lips curl back, tongues loll, or noses collapse—such afflictions arise from destroying sacred altars and slandering the Three Treasures. Those who are deranged, deluded, and grotesque in appearance—such afflictions arise from arrogance, contempt, and mockery of the ordained and the Dharma-body.

Those who encounter bandits and have their possessions harmed—such misfortune arises from plundering the Three Treasures and the permanent endowments of the sacred. Those who drown in water or are harmed by fish and dragons—such misfortune arises from damaging the permanent endowments of the Three Treasures. Those who are burned and scorched by fire or devoured by venomous snakes—such misfortune arises from killing the ordained and demolishing monasteries. Those who have venomous creatures enter their mouths and vomit blood and filth—such afflictions arise from cursing with foul speech and invoking malevolent spirits. Those who have venomous creatures enter their orifices, are devoured by tigers and wolves, or are harmed by fierce beasts—such misfortune arises from secret schemes, poisonous malice, and deceitful hearts.

Those whose parents, spouses, and children are separated, never living together, and constantly quarreling day and night—such misfortune arises from jealousy, adultery, breaking others’ harmony, and severing others’ flesh and blood. Those who engage in lewdness without regard for kinship, beauty, or ugliness—such beings arise from the realm of swine, dogs, and the six domestic animals. Those who crave meat, delight in killing, and indulge in alcohol to the point of madness—such beings arise from the realm of fish, turtles, frogs, venomous creatures, and fierce beasts. Those whose bodies are filthy, unclean, and foul-smelling—such beings arise from the realm of toads and venomous insects.

Those reborn as oxen, horses, and the six domestic animals—such rebirths arise from killing living beings, evading taboos, and defaulting on debts. Those reborn as wild beasts, roebucks, deer, vipers, and pythons—such rebirths arise from jealousy, poisonous malice, and secret schemes. Those reborn as starving tigers and jackals—such rebirths arise from oppression, plunder, killing, and injury. Those reborn as filth-dwelling insects, toads, tadpoles, crickets, and ants—such rebirths arise from disdaining the Three Treasures and lacking reverence and faith. Those reborn as mad dogs, wild boars, fish, turtles, and monstrous creatures—such rebirths arise from turning against their teachers, abandoning their roots, and violating the scriptures and teachings.

Those reborn as swallows, sparrows, and turtledoves—such rebirths arise from debating the scriptures and creating negative karma with their speech. Those reborn as hawks, falcons, and birds of prey—such rebirths arise from offending the ordained and destroying the scriptures and teachings. Those who miscarry or give birth to children with swollen bellies and thin necks—such afflictions arise from mocking the Three Treasures and arrogantly disparaging the ordained. Those who are imprisoned in shackles and subjected to torture and corporal punishment—such misfortune arises from flattery, poisonous partisanship, and cruelty toward the poor and lowly. Those who are whipped, beaten, and bound in shackles and prisons—such misfortune arises from malicious greed and cruelty.

Those reborn as cats, dogs, wild dogs, jackals, wolves, foxes, and raccoon dogs—such rebirths arise from greed, stinginess, falsehood, and deceit. Those reborn with the bodies of rats, moles, centipedes, crickets, and lizards—such rebirths arise from secret malice and jealousy. Those reborn as bees, wasps, scorpions, venomous lizards, and geckos—such rebirths arise from cursing the ordained and disrespecting the Three Treasures. Those reborn as spiders, earthworms, mosquitoes, fleas, and lice—such rebirths arise from disdaining the Dharma, belittling the Dao, and mocking and slandering the scriptures. Those reborn as barbarians of lowly status, bald and with severed hair, deep-set eyes, long noses, and foul-smelling bodies—such rebirths arise from killing living beings, sexual misconduct, and disbelief in karmic causes and conditions.

The Celestial Venerable of Primordial Beginning addressed the attendant perfected beings at his side: "The sins and karmic retributions described above condemn beings to hell, where they endure various tortures and punishments, suffering through kalpas before obtaining these forms. Some experience karmic retribution in this very life, the causes and conditions of their bodily afflictions clearly revealed. Each must purify their minds and repent, thereby gaining immeasurable blessings."

The Celestial Venerable of Primordial Beginning further addressed the attendant perfected beings: "If in the lower realms there are faithful men and women of the Dao who, with utmost sincerity, establish altars for the Three Clarities and the Five Emperors’ stellar platforms on behalf of the empress, imperial consorts, the seven ancestral temples, and the noble lineages of past generations—hanging banners, offering flowers, rare and precious fruits, lighting incense and lamps, and performing grand jiao rites to the stars to redeem and liberate souls—then I shall dispatch the Heavenly Venerable of Great Compassion and Salvation, who will open the vermilion gates of the Scarlet Mound, inscribe the purple registers, proclaim the august names of the Celestial Venerables, chant and praise the cavernous scriptures, and release the stagnant souls of the Nine Dark Realms. Their past karmic obstructions will dissolve, the Five Paths will open, and they will attain carefree non-action, transcending to blessed rebirth. All their transgressions will be eradicated. Therefore, offer incense, surrender body and life, and prostrate with the five limbs touching the ground."

chunks.original_text: 志心朝礼，垂范玉清天尊。 志心朝礼，晨极天皇天尊。 志心朝礼，大慧玄明天尊。 志心朝礼，丹光决定天尊。 志心朝礼，德解上元天尊。 志心朝礼，玄辉仙德天尊。 志心朝礼，譬喻方便天尊。 志心朝礼，紫清普果天尊。 志心朝礼，护生开霞天尊。 志心朝礼，寂然化虚天尊。 志心朝礼，空清诸有天尊。 志心朝礼，明响神道天尊。 志心朝礼，玄会冥感天尊。 志心朝礼，黄光运明天尊。 志心朝礼，度脱真品天尊。 志心朝礼，慧道照明天尊。 志心朝礼，随愿往生天尊。 志心朝礼，慈悲救苦真人。 志心朝礼，慈悲救度真人。 志心朝礼，慈悲大惠真人。 志心朝礼，慈观真人。 志心朝礼，等救真人。 志心朝礼，慧空真人。 志心朝礼，宝相真人。 志心朝礼，玄觉真人。 志心朝礼，空朗真人。 志心朝礼，等相真人。 志心朝礼，慈朗真人。 志心朝礼，曜灵真人。 志心朝礼，清定天师。 志心朝礼，定邪天师。 志心朝礼，收鬼天师。 志心朝礼，制魔天师。 志心朝礼，斩邪天师。 志心朝礼，启天天师。 元始上帝告诸天神王曰：吾今以此经，遣金华真人，赍往下方，散布十方三界，使一切人民转诵。 或有奉道之民、清信男女，遇本命生日，为皇后贵妃、太子天亲，大醮天地、日月、星辰、名山、洞府、得道神仙，咏诵天尊、真人、天师名号者，即有十天善神营护修奉之民，上奏天府，永消世厄，长沐天恩，镇居凤阁，日奉伏明，功德巍巍，获福无量。 志心朝礼， 太白山真德洞天仙官， 西山天宝极真洞天仙官， 大沩山好生玄上洞天仙官， 灊山天柱司玄洞天仙官， 鬼谷山太玄司真洞天仙官， 武夷山升真元化洞天仙官， 玉笥山太秀法乐洞天仙官， 华盖山容城大玉洞天仙官， 盖竹山长曜宝元洞天仙官， 都峤山宝玄洞天仙官， 白石山琼秀长真洞天仙官， 句漏山玉阙宝圭洞天仙官， 九嶷山朝真太虚洞天仙官， 洞阳山洞阳永观洞天仙官， 幕阜山洞真太玄洞天仙官， 大酉山大酉华妙洞天仙官， 金庭山金庭崇妙洞天仙官。 元始上帝再告左右侍真曰：吾今以此经散布万国九州，徧使人天礼念。 迎祥集福，保命延生。 若有善信男女，遇三元八节，烧香转礼三清宝号、金华真人名位。 上愿皇后贵妃、太子天亲，礼拜供养，集福延生，永光宝历，世世不绝，长居紫庭。 冲妙先生烧香朝谢金阙上帝而献颂曰： 西灵圣母，贵曳琼琚。 鸾台凤阁，密从宸舆。 虹光贯斗，月莹太虚。 穆清宫禁，永镇天居。 太上灵宝朝天谢罪大忏卷之二竟 尔时，元始上帝在无上大罗天中，玉京金阙之内，坐天宝妙台，与太上玉晨道君，太上圣祖太清老君，大集群仙，敷扬妙法，讲演经戒。 是时，诸天大圣，一切众真，烧香散花，持旛执节，吟咏洞章，步虚赞叹，功德巍巍，未闻未见。 今日得诣宝轩，列班侍立，恭听法音，愿赐开度。 是时，元始上帝告左右侍真曰：吾以威光普照无极世界，下土兆民，一切群生。 愚痴暗昧沉迷世网，媅滞六欲，不能自觉，常处苦恼，流浪生死，并不开悟。 若有善信男女能发无上道意，为一切众生，立三清宝座、五帝灵坛，挂旛献花，烧香朝礼，转念经忏； 为先祖宗亲、亡过父母、妻子眷属，灭除罪犯，使身心清净，常味灵音，不堕恶道，常行信奉，忏谢前生今世。

The Primordial Celestial Venerable of the Origin again addressed the attendant Perfected Ones on his left and right, saying: "I now disseminate this scripture throughout the myriad lands and the nine provinces, that all in heaven and on earth may reverently recite and venerate it. Thus shall they welcome auspiciousness, gather blessings, protect life, and prolong existence. Should there be faithful men and women who, upon the Three Origins and Eight Festivals, burn incense and circumambulate, revering the precious names of the Three Purities and the ranks of the Golden Flower Perfected, offering prayers for the empress, noble consorts, the crown prince, and imperial kin—worshipping and making offerings—they shall gather blessings and prolong life, perpetually illuminating the precious calendar, generation after generation without end, eternally dwelling in the Purple Court."

The Master of Subtle Wonder burned incense, prostrated in gratitude before the Golden Portal of the Celestial Venerable, and offered this hymn of praise:
*"The Sacred Mother of the Western Numinosity,
Adorned with jade pendants, noble and resplendent.
From the Phoenix Pavilion and the Simurgh Terrace,
She secretly attends the imperial carriage.
Rainbow light pierces the Dipper,
The moon gleams in the Great Void.
Within the solemn and pure palace precincts,
She eternally guards the celestial abode."*

Here ends the second fascicle of *The Supreme Lingbao Repentance Before Heaven for Atonement of Sins*.

At that time, the Primordial Celestial Venerable of the Origin was in the Supreme Great Luo Heaven, within the Jade Capital and Golden Portal, seated upon the Heavenly Treasure Wondrous Terrace. Together with the Most High Jade Maid of the Dawn and the Most High Sagely Ancestor, the Most High and Venerable Lord Lao, he assembled the multitude of immortals to expound the wondrous Dharma and lecture on the scriptures and precepts. At that moment, the great sages of all heavens and all the assembled Perfected Ones burned incense, scattered flowers, held banners and staffs, chanted the cavernous hymns, and paced the void in praise. Their merit and virtue were towering, unheard of and unseen before. Today, they had the fortune to approach the precious hall, array themselves in ranks, and stand in attendance, reverently listening to the Dharma sounds, hoping to receive liberation and deliverance.

Then, the Primordial Celestial Venerable of the Origin addressed the attendant Perfected Ones on his left and right, saying: "With my awe-inspiring radiance, I universally illuminate the boundless worlds, the multitudes of the lower realms, and all sentient beings. Yet they remain foolish, benighted, and sunk in the snares of the world, mired in the six desires, unable to awaken. Constantly abiding in suffering and affliction, they drift and wander through the cycles of birth and death, never attaining enlightenment. Should there be faithful men and women who arouse the supreme intention of the Dao, on behalf of all sentient beings, establishing the precious altars of the Three Purities and the sacred altars of the Five Emperors, hanging banners and offering flowers, burning incense and prostrating in reverence, reciting scriptures and repenting; for their ancestral kin, deceased parents, wives, children, and family members, they may extinguish transgressions, purify body and mind, constantly savor the numinous sounds, avoid falling into evil destinies, and steadfastly practice devotion, repenting for past and present lives."
