chunks.original_text: 举心运心，生不信奉心，诽谤三宝、毁坏三宝、秽污三宝、戏弄三宝、骂詈三宝、咒诅三宝、欺忽三宝、傲诞三宝、唝嗃三宝，訾毁经箓，评论真伪，改易妄言，强辩是非，分别深浅，言议短长，形容不净，衣服不净，手脚不净，口气不净，饮酒食肉，啖嚼荤辛，口出秽言，心不恭敬。 或不净手，或不烧香，或不漱口，或不沐浴，即入灵坛，触犯尊像，秽辱真圣神仙、天王力士、玉女金童、直坛灵官。 或对三清至真经法、出家法师，生不恭敬，形容傲诞，不肯信奉。 或乘车马直入宫观灵坛，逼近尊像，狼藉福地。 或见持斋受戒，永不信奉。 或见礼经斋醮，即便破乱，以为妖妄。 或入道场法席，高声大语，恼触法众。 或发言举意，道说是非，较量真伪。 或倚恃三宝，方便求财。 或假法教化，诳惑百姓。 或费用三宝财物，以养己身。 或恐愶出家，求其长短，以取财物，养育妻子。 诸如上罪，无量无边。 今日发露心诚，朝谢天地三宝星辰，为先祖父母、见存眷属，起恳首陈，乞灭除罪犯，内外清净，咸获超度。 元始上帝再告左右侍真曰：吾伤下土兆民，见存在世，三业六根，罪业深重，长行杀戮，行诸苦酷，不念慈心，杀害群毛，食啖六畜。 或为父母及己身、兄弟、妻儿、延诸亲族、众集乡闾，伤害众生，不计头数。 或杀牛羊、驴马、猪狗、鸡豚依人养牧刍豢之属。 或杀獐鹿、狐兔、虎豹豺狼依泊山林野兽之属。 或杀鹅鸭、鸟鹊、鸠鸽、鸱鸢、凫鹜、鵁鶄飞禽之属。 或杀虫蛇虺蝎蜂虿蚰蜓蜈蚣蚣蝑蝼蚁之属。 或杀鼋鼉、鱼鳖、螺蚌、虾蟆、螯蟹、蟛蜞水虫之属。 或杀蜣螂、蚁蠓、蝜蟠、螟蛉、蝎蠋、丘蚓小虫之属。 或杀蚊、蚤虱、蜉蝣、螖蝝、蠕、蛸翘化生之属。 或飞鹰走犬，张罗布网，杀害众生。 或放火烧山，穷林竭泽，杀害众生。 或持弓矢刀杖，杀害众生。 或手揉足踏，坐按卧捺，杀害众生。 或耕田种作，打墙立壁，杀害众生。 或竖造舍宇，穿坑出土，拆篱作障，杀害众生。 或剖胎破卵，热汤泼地，杀害众生。 或对经像灵坛宫观，杀害众生。 或祷祀鬼神，或为嗔怒，杀害众生。 或命绝手中。 或身亡刀下。 或断其头足。 或剥裂皮毛。 或猛火煎烧。 或沸汤燖煮。 或生分子母，断其胎育。 或固绝命根，令其磨灭。 或杀贤人道士。 或杀老弱女男。 或杀债主冤家。 或杀四方良善。 或恐杀、怖杀、毒药杀、咒杀、骂杀。 或自杀、教杀，诸如上杀，举手动身，杀害无数，无量无边，罪业深重，不忍听闻。 今日若有奉道男女，倾心露恳，朝天礼谢，拜表上章，大醮三官，放生续命，布施财宝，救济孤贫，烧香行道，吟咏洞章，步虚礼忏。 为七世祖弥、亡过父母、一切宗亲忏涤罪犯，改恶修善，洗涤身心，所求皆遂，所望皆成。 所救宗亲，咸得超度，神仙接引，逍遥无为，名上南宫，得归人道，获福无量。 元始上帝再告左右侍真曰：下界若有清信奉道之民，或为水族介虫、蛟龙鱼鳖、虾螺蚌蛤、湿居毒兽、一切鱼龙，建三清宝座、五帝灵坛，烧香然灯，上章拜表，忏谢水居业重之罪者，吾遣太一救苦天尊於云楼青简、金文宝藏，出天尊懿号，徧使人天称扬赞叹，吟咏洞章，思神念道，乞削落明真九幽、长夜之函，使一切水族介虫，离苦解脱，灭无量罪、成获超度。
chunks.translated_text:
When the mind is raised and set in motion, should it harbor disbelief, slander the Three Treasures, defile the Three Treasures, mock the Three Treasures, revile the Three Treasures, curse the Three Treasures, deceive or neglect the Three Treasures, display arrogance toward the Three Treasures, or speak coarsely of the Three Treasures; disparage scriptures and registers, debate their authenticity, alter them with falsehoods, argue over right and wrong, distinguish between deep and shallow, discuss their merits and flaws, present oneself in impurity, wear unclean garments, have unclean hands and feet, foul breath, consume wine and meat, partake of pungent and rank foods, utter filthy words, or lack reverence in the heart—

Or fail to cleanse the hands, omit burning incense, neglect rinsing the mouth or bathing, and thus enter the sacred altar, offending the honored images, defiling the true immortals, divine sages, Heavenly Kings, Valiant Guardians, Jade Maidens, Golden Lads, and Altar Guardians; or show disrespect toward the scriptures and teachings of the Three Clarities and the Perfected, or toward ordained Dharma masters, displaying arrogance and refusing to believe and uphold—

Or ride horses and carriages directly into temples and sacred altars, approaching the honored images too closely, desecrating the blessed grounds; or upon seeing others observe fasts and receive precepts, persist in disbelief; or upon witnessing rituals, scripture recitations, or offerings, disrupt and dismiss them as delusions; or enter the Daoist sanctuary and speak loudly, disturbing the assembly; or speak and act with intent to debate right and wrong, compare truth and falsehood; or rely on the Three Treasures to seek wealth through deceit; or falsely teach the Dharma to deceive the people; or misuse the wealth of the Three Treasures to sustain oneself; or threaten and intimidate monastics to extort their possessions, supporting wives and children—

Such transgressions are boundless and immeasurable. Today, with a sincere heart laid bare, we bow in repentance to Heaven and Earth, the Three Treasures, and the stars, on behalf of our ancestral parents and living kin, kneeling in earnest supplication to beseech the eradication of sins, purifying inner and outer, that all may attain deliverance.

The Most High Lord of the Primordial Dao again addressed the attendant immortals at his side: "I grieve for the multitudes of the lower realms, still dwelling in the world, whose three karmas and six senses bear the weight of grave offenses. They persist in killing, inflicting cruel suffering, devoid of compassion, slaughtering creatures great and small, consuming the six livestock. For the sake of parents, themselves, siblings, spouses, children, extended kin, and village gatherings, they harm countless beings without reckoning.

They kill cattle, sheep, donkeys, horses, pigs, dogs, chickens, and domesticated livestock; or deer, foxes, hares, tigers, leopards, and wild beasts of the mountains and forests; or geese, ducks, birds, magpies, turtledoves, hawks, kites, wild ducks, egrets, and flying fowl; or insects, snakes, vipers, scorpions, bees, wasps, centipedes, millipedes, ants, and crawling creatures; or soft-shelled turtles, fish, turtles, snails, clams, frogs, crabs, and water-dwelling beings; or dung beetles, midges, mole crickets, caterpillars, mantises, earthworms, and tiny insects; or mosquitoes, fleas, lice, mayflies, grubs, and creatures born of transformation.

They hunt with hawks and hounds, set nets and traps, killing countless beings; or set fires to mountains, exhausting forests and draining marshes, slaughtering life; or wield bows, arrows, blades, and staves to kill; or crush with hands and feet, sit or lie upon, killing; or till fields and build walls, killing; or construct houses, dig pits, remove soil, dismantle fences, and erect barriers, killing; or destroy embryos and eggs, pour boiling water on the ground, killing; or kill before scripture images, sacred altars, and temples; or sacrifice to ghosts and spirits, or kill in anger; or take lives in their hands, or die by the blade; or sever heads and limbs, flay skin and fur, roast in fierce fires, boil in scalding water; or separate mother and child, severing their nurturing bond; or utterly destroy their life root, ensuring their annihilation.

They kill virtuous persons and Daoists, the old and weak, women and men; or kill creditors and enemies; or kill the good and kind in all directions; or kill through fear, coercion, poison, curses, or revilement; or commit suicide or incite others to kill. Such killings, with every movement of hand or body, take countless lives, their offenses boundless and grave, too grievous to hear.

Yet today, if there are faithful men and women of the Dao who, with wholehearted sincerity, bow to Heaven in repentance, present memorials and petitions, hold grand offerings to the Three Officials, release life to extend destiny, bestow alms and treasures, relieve the destitute, burn incense and perform the Daoist walk, chant the cavernous scriptures, and circumambulate in repentance—on behalf of their seven generations of ancestors, deceased parents, and all kin—they may wash away sins, reform evil, and purify body and mind. All their prayers shall be fulfilled, all their hopes realized. Their delivered kin shall ascend to the Southern Palace, attain the Dao, and be received by immortals, roaming freely in non-action, their blessings immeasurable."

The Most High Lord of the Primordial Dao again addressed the attendant immortals at his side: "If among the faithful below there are those who, on behalf of aquatic beings—shelled creatures, dragons, fish, turtles, shrimp, snails, clams, and all water-dwelling creatures—establish the precious altars of the Three Clarities and the sacred altars of the Five Emperors, burn incense and light lamps, present memorials and petitions, repenting for the heavy karmic offenses of those dwelling in water, I shall dispatch the Heavenly Worthy of Great Compassion and Salvation from the Cloud Tower and the Golden Repository of Sacred Scriptures to proclaim the august name of the Heavenly Worthy, that all in Heaven and Earth may praise and chant the cavernous scriptures, meditate on the divine and contemplate the Dao, beseeching the erasure of the records of the Nine Hells and the Long Night. Thus shall all aquatic beings and shelled creatures be liberated from suffering, their boundless sins extinguished, and all attain deliverance."

chunks.original_text: 志心朝礼，丹元无碍天尊。 志心朝礼，度人北元天尊。 志心朝礼，无边徧被天尊。 志心朝礼，开化王宫天尊。 志心朝礼，妙道应明天尊。 志心朝礼，至照道运天尊。 志心朝礼，大梵中仙天尊。 志心朝礼，神通照道天尊。 志心朝礼，救生上化天尊。 志心朝礼，诸天玉真天尊。 志心朝礼，金山疑然天尊。 志心朝礼，道运万空天尊。 志心朝礼，玉华妙乐天尊。 志心朝礼，增益善智天尊。 志心朝礼，真相静明天尊。 志心朝礼，云宫重玄天尊。 志心朝礼，开朗神解天尊。 志心朝礼，天皇真君天尊。 志心朝礼，救生中元天尊。 志心朝礼，普朗真人天尊。 志心朝礼，虚无性常天尊。 志心朝礼，玄纪戒生天尊。 志心朝礼，随方自然天尊。 志心朝礼，最胜方便天尊。 志心朝礼，渐妙玄会天尊。 志心朝礼，德解洞玄天尊。 志心朝礼，洞元仙宝天尊。 志心朝礼，慧炬太真天尊。 志心朝礼，神至响明天尊。 志心朝礼，遍空飞驾天尊。 志心朝礼，太玄宝丹天尊。 志心朝礼，一切增益天尊。 志心朝礼，行明高运天尊。 志心朝礼，随愿往生天尊。 志心朝礼，慈悲救苦真人。 志心朝礼，慈悲救度真人。 志心朝礼，慈悲大慧真人。 志心朝礼，景虚真人。 志心朝礼，平等真人。 志心朝礼，大慈真人。 志心朝礼，好生真人。 志心朝礼，景上真人。 志心朝礼，等曜真人。 志心朝礼，靖慧真人。 志心朝礼，智明真人。 志心朝礼，妙慧真人。 志心朝礼，明虚真人。 志心朝礼，部录天师。 志心朝礼，上奏天师。 志心朝礼，除死天师。 志心朝礼，定生天师。 志心朝礼，保护天师。 志心朝礼，普济天师。 元始天尊再告左右侍真曰：吾今出此天尊真人、天师名号，遣金华真人赍往下方，散布万国九州，使一切人民，忏悔朝谢。 或有清信贤者，每遇本命生日，烧香讽诵，醮谢天地，洞府神仙即有记名，神王落死，神王上生，神王录其功德，奏上诸天。 金帛丰足，永保安宁。 或为储君太子、公主天亲，迎祥集庆，大醮星辰，获福无量。 志心朝礼， 麻姑山丹霞洞天仙官， 仙都山玄都祈仙洞天官， 青田山青田大鹤洞天仙官， 锺山朱湖太生洞天仙官， 良常山良常方会洞天仙官， 紫盖山紫玄洞照洞天仙官， 天目山太极玄盖洞天仙官， 桃源山白马玄光洞天仙官， 金华山金华洞元洞天仙官， 海上东岳广桑山青帝洞仙官， 海上南岳长离山赤帝洞仙官， 海上西岳丽农山白帝洞仙官， 海上北岳广野山黑帝洞仙官， 海上中岳昆仑山黄帝洞仙官。 元始上帝再告左右侍真曰：吾今遣太一真人赍此经，散布万国九州，徧使人天礼念，延生保命，集福消灾。 若有奉道之民，遇三元八节、本命生辰，转礼三清宝号、十方真人名位者，身坚体固，永保长生，获福无量。 冲妙先生烧香朝谢金阙上帝而献颂曰： 挺秀雍熙运，日奉至尊前。 身居龙凤阙，名籍继诸仙。 烧香谢天荫，长诵希夷篇。 千生臻百福，列位清微天。 永处逍遥境，长享福自然。 太上灵宝朝天谢罪大忏卷之三竟 太上灵宝朝天谢罪大忏卷之四 尔时，元始上帝在大罗天上玉京金阙紫微天台，大会群仙，敷演妙法，救度天人，咸使悟道，不历诸苦，施大威德，放大光明，普照万国，一切罪福，俱在目前，甚深微妙，方便开度，一切地狱穷魂，苦毒无量，痛楚难言。

The Primordial Heavenly Worthy then addressed the attendant Perfected Ones at his side, saying: "I now reveal these names and titles of the Heavenly Worthies, Perfected Ones, and Celestial Masters, and dispatch the Golden Splendor Perfected One to carry them to the lower realms, scattering them throughout the ten thousand states and nine provinces, so that all people may repent and offer homage in gratitude. If there are faithful and virtuous ones who, upon encountering their life-destiny birthdays, burn incense, chant, and perform rituals to give thanks to Heaven and Earth, the divine immortals of the cavernous palaces will record their names. The divine kings will release them from death, the divine kings will raise them to life, and the divine kings will record their merits, memorializing them to the various heavens. Their wealth and silk will be abundant, and they will forever enjoy peace and security. If they are heirs apparent, princes, or imperial kin, they will welcome auspiciousness and gather blessings. By performing grand rituals to the stars, they will obtain boundless fortune."

The Primordial Supreme Lord then addressed the attendant Perfected Ones at his side, saying: "I now dispatch the Great One Perfected One to carry this scripture, scattering it throughout the ten thousand states and nine provinces, so that humans and devas may universally pay homage and recite it, prolonging life and preserving destiny, gathering blessings and dispelling calamities. If there are those who uphold the Dao, and upon encountering the Three Primes, Eight Nodal Days, or their life-destiny birthdays, circumambulate and pay homage to the precious titles of the Three Clarities and the names of the Perfected Ones of the Ten Directions, their bodies will be firm and their forms solid, forever preserving longevity, and they will obtain boundless fortune."

The Master of Subtle Wonder burned incense, gave thanks before the Golden Portal of the Supreme Lord, and offered this eulogy:
"Emerging in a flourishing and harmonious era,
Daily I serve before the Most High.
My body dwells in the Dragon-Phoenix Palace,
My name is enrolled in the registers of the immortals.
Burning incense, I give thanks for Heaven’s blessings,
Forever chanting the *Xiyi* chapters.
A thousand lives attain a hundred fortunes,
Ranked among the Pure and Subtle Heavens.
Forever abiding in the carefree realm,
Eternally enjoying the blessings of spontaneity."

Here ends the third scroll of *The Supreme Lingbao Repentance for Offering Homage to Heaven and Atoning for Transgressions*.

The fourth scroll of *The Supreme Lingbao Repentance for Offering Homage to Heaven and Atoning for Transgressions*.

At that time, the Primordial Supreme Lord was in the Jade Capital’s Golden Portal of the Great Luo Heaven, upon the Purple Tenuity Heavenly Terrace. Assembling a great congregation of immortals, he expounded the wondrous Dharma, delivering and saving devas and humans, enabling all to awaken to the Dao, sparing them from manifold sufferings. Manifesting great majestic virtue, he emitted great radiance, universally illuminating the ten thousand states. All karmic consequences of transgressions and blessings were made manifest before their eyes—profound, subtle, and wondrous—offering expedient means to open the path to liberation. All the destitute souls in the hells, suffering immeasurable agony and unbearable torment, were thus addressed.

chunks.original_text: 并蒙恩救拔，不溺沉沦，咸得超度。 是时，元始上帝慈悲广洽，更开要道，使过去未来俱沾利益，再告左右侍真曰：人之禀生，同资一气； 及乎诞育，命系三元。 寿夭吉凶，富贵贫贱，因缘罪福，善恶生死，各逐宿命根源，悉有报应，随其业力，永不差移，如影随形，似声应响。 上元正月十五日，天曹天官主录，百司上诣天阙，进呈世人罪福之籍。 七月十五日中元，地官主录，百司上诣天阙，进呈世人罪福之籍。 十月十五日下元水官水府，百司上诣天阙，进呈世人罪福之籍。 三元之日，与三界十方、四司五帝、善恶童子、一切灵官上朝金阙元始座前，考校男女生死之籍，罪福因缘及九幽地狱、水府穷魂，姓名黑簿。 此时若有善信男女，能发自然道意，建造紫微宝台，玉京宝山，楼阁台榭，百宝庄严，香花供养，烧香行道，吟咏洞章，然灯放生，步虚法事，布施发愿，谢过上章，大建斋醮，虔告天地，昼夜不怠者，吾当遣十天真人、诸天神仙、三界四司、救苦灵童下降人间，齐到道场，为其灭罪，保佑生人。 使国土安宁，男女欢泰，众善齐降，诸恶不生。 地狱苦魂，一时解脱。 克生天上快乐，无为率土太平。 功德巍巍，获福无量。 元始上帝再告左右侍真曰：吾见十方无极世界，十方天王造三十二层天台宝盘。 悉以紫金、珠玉、锦谷，紫网宝盖，紫节旌幢，百花饮食，器物百珍，仙乐摇曳，徧满虚空，来诣道场罗列供养。 尔时天尊以神通威力，变此会中国土，悉是琉璃，洞彻内外，皆同一色远近，平等不殊，三界十方，同沾福庆，喜乐难言。 九幽罢对，五苦停酸，国土安宁，人民长寿。 元始上帝再告左右侍真曰：下界若有善信男女，请道士法师，常於三元节日，宣说经戒，罪福因缘，忏悔自己，受身不净，臭秽四大，浮脆假合，念念无常，三业六根，构造诸恶，渐染成愆，轮回生死，堕落三涂，九幽地狱，受诸苦恼，吞火食炭，镬汤煎煮，足履刀山，手攀剑树，硙磨碓捣，锯解锥劖，铁鸟啄睛，铁犁耕舌，牛头乱拷，铁杖负身，脓血流离，身体烂坏，沉沦黑暗，流转泥犁，负石填河，昼夜拷掠。 一入酆都地狱，万劫难原，皆是众生业力自受。 若有善信男女能发善心，为七世祖祢及见存己身、父母骨肉，五苦三涂、穷魂饿鬼、畜生囚徒、老病众生，造玉京高座、紫微天台，挂旛献花，百珍供养，醮谢星宿，拜表上章，礼忏烧香，灭诸罪源，咸皆超度。 元始天尊告左右侍真曰：若有善信男女於三元节日，为一切人天建造斋醮，转经礼忏，供养天尊神仙、列曜星宿、地府百司，为祖考父母，发片善心，精诚不退，过去未来、三世父母，获福无量，灭诸罪犯。 元始上帝告左右侍真曰：吾见下土兆民，多有凶祸，邪鬼所害。 可为先亡祖考、父母尊亲，五腊之日是天地开赦，宜建斋行道，礼忏上章，救拔先祖，咸得超度，获福无量。 正月一日，天腊之日，五帝神仙集於青天安宝华林青灵阙中，校定世人罪福之籍； 五月五日，地腊之日，五帝神仙集於丹天梵宝昌阳丹灵朱阙，校定世人罪福之籍； 七月七日，道德腊之日，五帝神仙集於金门素灵阙中，校定世人罪福之籍； 十月一日，民岁腊之日，五帝神仙集於玄天洞阴黑灵阙中，校定世人罪福之籍；
chunks.translated_text:
And by this grace, they were rescued and uplifted, no longer drowned in the depths of suffering, all attaining transcendence.

At that time, the Primordial Supreme Lord, in his boundless compassion, further revealed the essential Dao, that both past and future might partake of its benefits. He addressed the attendant perfected ones at his side, saying:

"Humans receive life from the same single qi; yet upon birth, their fate is bound to the Three Origins. Longevity or premature death, fortune or misfortune, wealth or poverty, nobility or lowliness—all arise from karmic conditions of sin and blessing, good and evil, life and death. Each follows the root of their past existence, and all receive retribution according to their karmic power, never deviating, as the shadow follows the form, as the echo answers the sound.

On the fifteenth day of the first month of the Upper Origin, the celestial officials of the Heavenly Bureau ascend to the Heavenly Palace, presenting the registers of the world’s sins and blessings. On the fifteenth day of the seventh month of the Middle Origin, the terrestrial officials of the Earthly Bureau ascend to the Heavenly Palace, presenting the registers of the world’s sins and blessings. On the fifteenth day of the tenth month of the Lower Origin, the aquatic officials of the Water Bureau ascend to the Heavenly Palace, presenting the registers of the world’s sins and blessings.

On these Three Origin days, together with the Three Realms and the Ten Directions, the Four Bureaus and Five Emperors, the spirits of good and evil, and all divine officials, they ascend to the Golden Palace before the throne of the Primordial Supreme Lord to examine the registers of men and women’s lives and deaths, the karmic conditions of sin and blessing, and the black ledgers of names from the Nine Dark Hells and the Watery Prison of destitute souls.

At this time, if there are faithful men and women who awaken to the natural Daoist intent, constructing Purple Tenuity treasure terraces, Jade Capital treasure mountains, pavilions and towers adorned with a hundred treasures, offering incense and flowers, burning incense and practicing the Dao, chanting sacred hymns, lighting lamps and releasing living beings, performing the *Step-in-Emptiness* rituals, making offerings and vows, submitting petitions of repentance, and holding grand fasts and jiao rites, reverently beseeching Heaven and Earth day and night without ceasing—then I shall dispatch the Ten Perfected Celestials, the divine immortals of the heavens, the officials of the Three Realms and Four Bureaus, and the youthful spirits of salvation to descend into the human realm, all gathering at the ritual site to eradicate their sins and protect the living. Thus, the land will be at peace, men and women will rejoice in prosperity, all blessings will descend, and no evils will arise. The suffering souls of hell will all be liberated at once, ascending to the joy of Heaven, and the realm will enjoy effortless great peace. Their merit will be towering, and their blessings boundless."

The Primordial Supreme Lord again addressed the attendant perfected ones at his side, saying: "I see that in the boundless worlds of the Ten Directions, the Heavenly Kings of the Ten Directions construct thirty-two-tiered celestial terraces and treasure platters, all adorned with purple gold, pearls, jades, brocades, and grains, with purple nets and treasure canopies, purple-tasseled banners and streamers, a hundred kinds of flowers and foods, vessels of a hundred treasures, and celestial music filling the void, all coming to the ritual site in array for offerings.

At that time, the Heavenly Worthy, through his divine power, transformed the land of this assembly into lapis lazuli, translucent within and without, all of one color, equal in near and far. The Three Realms and Ten Directions all partook of blessings and joy beyond words. The Nine Dark Hells ceased their trials, the Five Sufferings halted their bitterness, the land was at peace, and the people enjoyed long life."

The Primordial Supreme Lord again addressed the attendant perfected ones at his side, saying: "If in the lower realm there are faithful men and women who invite Daoist masters and Dharma teachers to regularly proclaim the scriptures and precepts on the Three Origin festival days, expounding the karmic conditions of sin and blessing, repenting their own impurities—the foul and filthy Four Great Elements, the fragile and transient union of the body, the impermanence of every thought, the Three Actions and Six Roots constructing all evils, gradually staining and forming transgressions, cycling through birth and death, falling into the Three Wretched Realms, the Nine Dark Hells, enduring all manner of torments—swallowing fire and eating coals, boiled in cauldrons, treading upon knife mountains, grasping at sword trees, ground in mills, pounded in mortars, sawed apart, drilled and chiseled, having their eyes pecked by iron birds, their tongues plowed by iron plows, beaten by ox-headed demons, their bodies burdened with iron staves, their pus and blood flowing, their bodies rotting away, sinking into darkness, revolving in the muddy hells, carrying stones to fill rivers, tortured day and night. Once entering the Fengdu Hell, they endure ten thousand kalpas without reprieve—all self-inflicted by the karmic power of sentient beings.

If there are faithful men and women who awaken to goodness, constructing Jade Capital high seats and Purple Tenuity celestial terraces for the sake of their seven generations of ancestors, their living parents and kin, the Five Sufferings and Three Wretched Realms, the destitute souls, hungry ghosts, animals, prisoners, the elderly and sick, hanging banners and offering flowers, presenting a hundred treasures, performing jiao rites to the stars, submitting petitions, bowing in repentance, burning incense to extinguish the roots of sin—all will be transcended.

The Primordial Heavenly Worthy addressed the attendant perfected ones at his side, saying: "If on the Three Origin festival days, faithful men and women hold fasts and jiao rites for all humans and devas, reciting scriptures, bowing in repentance, making offerings to the Heavenly Worthies, immortals, stellar deities, and the hundred bureaus of the earthly prison, and for the sake of their ancestors and parents, awaken even a single good thought with unwavering sincerity—then their past, present, and future parents of three generations will gain boundless blessings and have all their sins extinguished."

The Primordial Supreme Lord addressed the attendant perfected ones at his side, saying: "I see that the people of the lower realm suffer many calamities and harm from evil spirits. For the sake of their deceased ancestors, parents, and honored kin, on the Five La Days—when Heaven and Earth grant amnesty—it is fitting to hold fasts, practice the Dao, bow in repentance, and submit petitions to rescue and transcend their ancestors, gaining boundless blessings.

On the first day of the first month, the Heavenly La Day, the Five Emperor Immortals gather in the Azure Heaven’s Peaceful Treasure Flower Grove at the Azure Spirit Palace to examine the registers of the world’s sins and blessings. On the fifth day of the fifth month, the Earthly La Day, the Five Emperor Immortals gather in the Cinnabar Heaven’s Brahma Treasure Prosperous Yang at the Vermilion Spirit Palace to examine the registers of the world’s sins and blessings. On the seventh day of the seventh month, the Daoist La Day, the Five Emperor Immortals gather in the Golden Gate’s Plain Spirit Palace to examine the registers of the world’s sins and blessings. On the first day of the tenth month, the People’s Year La Day, the Five Emperor Immortals gather in the Dark Heaven’s Cavern Yin at the Black Spirit Palace to examine the registers of the world’s sins and blessings."

Manifesting great majestic virtue, he emitted great radiance, universally illuminating the ten thousand states. All karmic consequences of transgressions and blessings were made manifest before their eyes—profound, subtle, and wondrous—offering expedient means to open the path to liberation. All the destitute souls in the hells, suffering immeasurable agony and unbearable torment, were thus addressed.

chunks.original_text: 十二月遇腊日，是王侯腊之日，此日五方五帝集於玄都玉京元灵戊己金阙元始上帝八景殿中，校定世人罪福之籍。 此五腊日皆是天地合攒之日，定吉凶死生簿籍。 若有男女为过去先祖父母，礼忏上表谢罪，灭除黑簿罪升度七祖父母，入名上清，皆得超度。 夫五腊日者，皆生人九祖、父母，幽岳鬼魂。 此日为酆都北阴大帝引出责问，久处阴司，年代积罪，结衅端由及子孙姓名、坟墓所在。 如积劫未有追赎，因此日延累生人引问得子孙亲姻、九族姓名为生人罪状，积衅幽司，九族延灭。 此日可为先祖亡过父母，上表忏谢宿愆，追拔幽涂，皆亡人一一得之。 常日祭祀，不可得违，为酆都幽深，难为通彻，沐赖真猷，皆得宿愆，解释幽司，不欲久滞。 死魂久滞，则天曹责及幽司官吏，亦责及生人。 转福为祸，灾难自此而生。 若有至孝男女此日修奉斋醮，即黑簿除名，获福无量，皆得超度。 元始上帝告左右侍真曰：下界众生，识见不同； 习恶造善，根基各异。 今说要言，各宜信奉。 若众生好杀害损伤者，即以慈悲门摄之。 若偷盗劫夺财物者，即以分义门摄之。 若邪淫放荡者，即以贞洁门摄之。 若怪贪吝惜者，即以布施门摄之。 若瞋怒斗争者，即以欢喜门摄之。 若愚痴颠倒者，即以方便门摄之。 若绮言浮华者，即以简正门摄之。 若妄语虚诳者，即以信顺门摄之。 若恶口咒诅者，即以诵念门摄之。 若两舌恶骂者，即以赞叹门摄之。 若饮酒食肉过度者，即以斋戒门摄之。 若诽谤訾毁者，即以讲说门摄之。 若倨傲轻慢者，即以礼拜门摄之。 若刚强豪健者，即以柔弱门摄之。 若不信罪福宿命者，即以因缘门摄之。 若执击有无者，即以中道门摄之。 若是非彼我者，即以平等门摄之。 若贪浊秽污者，即以清净门摄之。 若坚固不移者，即以轮转门摄之。 若造作不休者，即以无为门摄之。 若局守不变者，即以圆转门摄之。 若躁竞不安者，即以静定门摄之。 若烦恼不释者，即以解脱门摄之。 若忧悲不乐者，即以逍遥门摄之。 以此二十四门常摄一切，众生不亦乐乎。 元始上帝曰：吾本以无摄为摄，劝化众生。 众生既悟，亦无摄因。 若能持奉，获福无量。 元始上帝再告左右侍真曰：下界兆庶，若有清信奉道之民，为九祖先远父母幽魂，或於古观灵坛，或在本家净室，建三清宝座、点七曜明灯，烧香行道，吟咏洞章，转礼经忏，大醮诸天，精诚不怠者，吾遣太乙救苦天尊，於九炁天宫开七宝云楼、青简金文，出天尊懿号，下降人间，徧使人天礼念，为削落九幽长夜玉匮之函，使七祖超度，魂上南宫，神仙接引，逍遥无为，获福无量。 是故烧香，归身归命，五体投地。 志心朝礼， 玉清圣境虚无自然元始天尊， 上清真境太上道君灵宝天尊， 太清仙境太上老君道德天尊， 太上昊天至尊金阙玉皇上帝， 南极星主紫微上宫天皇大帝， 中天星主紫微中宫北极大帝， 承天效法厚德光大后土皇地祇， 南极长生大帝统天元圣天尊， 东极青华大帝太乙救苦天尊， 贞明大圣九天应元雷声普化天尊， 九天雷祖大帝除灾济物天尊， 紫微碧玉宫太一大天帝保制劫运天尊， 六天洞渊大帝伏魔上上太一天尊， 六波天主帝君普施法润天尊， 九天可韩司丈人朱陵度命天尊，
chunks.translated_text:
On the La Day that falls in the twelfth month—the La Day of Kings and Lords—the Five Emperors of the Five Directions gather in the Primordial Spirit’s Wu-Ji Golden Gate within the Jade Capital of the Mysterious Metropolis, in the Eight Radiance Hall of the Primordial Supreme Lord, to examine the registers of the world’s sins and blessings. These five La Days are the days when Heaven and Earth converge, when the ledgers of fortune, misfortune, life, and death are fixed.

If there are men and women who, for their past ancestors and parents, perform rites of repentance, submit petitions, and offer thanks for transgressions, they may erase names from the Black Register of sins and ascend to deliver their seven generations of ancestors, inscribing their names in the Upper Clarity. All shall thus attain deliverance.

These five La Days concern the nine generations of ancestors and parents of the living, as well as the ghostly souls in the Dark Mountain. On these days, the Great Emperor of the Northern Darkness of Fengdu summons them forth for interrogation, questioning those long confined in the nether courts, whose sins have accumulated over the ages, whose offenses and origins are bound to the names of their descendants and the locations of their graves. If, after kalpas of time, no redemption has been sought, the living shall be implicated on this day, their names and those of their kin and nine clans recorded as the living’s offenses, their transgressions bound to the dark courts, their nine clans doomed to annihilation.

On this day, one may submit petitions and perform rites of repentance for deceased ancestors and parents, redeeming them from the dark paths, so that each of the departed may attain deliverance. Daily sacrifices must not be neglected, for the depths of Fengdu are profound and difficult to penetrate; only by relying on true principles may one resolve past transgressions, release the souls from the dark courts, and prevent prolonged confinement. If the dead remain long confined, the Heavenly Offices shall hold the officials of the dark courts accountable, and the living shall also be held responsible. Blessings shall turn to misfortune, and calamities shall arise therefrom.

If there are filial sons and daughters who, on this day, observe fasts and offer jiao rites, their names shall be stricken from the Black Register, and they shall gain boundless blessings, all attaining deliverance.

The Primordial Supreme Lord addressed the attendant perfected ones at His side: "The beings of the lower realms possess varying perceptions; their habits of evil and good, their roots and foundations, differ. I now speak these essential words, and all should believe and uphold them.

If beings engage in killing, harm, and injury, they shall be gathered through the Gate of Compassion.
If they steal, rob, or seize wealth, they shall be gathered through the Gate of Righteous Sharing.
If they indulge in licentiousness and debauchery, they shall be gathered through the Gate of Chastity.
If they are greedy, miserly, and stingy, they shall be gathered through the Gate of Almsgiving.
If they are wrathful and contentious, they shall be gathered through the Gate of Joy.
If they are foolish and deluded, they shall be gathered through the Gate of Expedient Means.
If they engage in frivolous and flowery speech, they shall be gathered through the Gate of Simplicity and Rectitude.
If they lie and deceive, they shall be gathered through the Gate of Faithfulness and Compliance.
If they curse and revile, they shall be gathered through the Gate of Recitation and Invocation.
If they slander and malign, they shall be gathered through the Gate of Praise and Admiration.
If they overindulge in wine and meat, they shall be gathered through the Gate of Fasting and Abstinence.
If they slander and defame, they shall be gathered through the Gate of Exposition and Teaching.
If they are arrogant and disdainful, they shall be gathered through the Gate of Reverence and Worship.
If they are stubborn and overbearing, they shall be gathered through the Gate of Gentleness and Humility.
If they disbelieve in the consequences of sins, blessings, and past lives, they shall be gathered through the Gate of Causes and Conditions.
If they cling to existence and nonexistence, they shall be gathered through the Gate of the Middle Way.
If they engage in disputes of right and wrong, self and other, they shall be gathered through the Gate of Equality.
If they are greedy, filthy, and defiled, they shall be gathered through the Gate of Purity.
If they are obstinate and unyielding, they shall be gathered through the Gate of Cyclic Transformation.
If they ceaselessly create and act, they shall be gathered through the Gate of Non-Action.
If they are rigid and unchanging, they shall be gathered through the Gate of Rounded Adaptation.
If they are restless and competitive, they shall be gathered through the Gate of Stillness and Concentration.
If they are afflicted and unable to let go, they shall be gathered through the Gate of Liberation.
If they are sorrowful and joyless, they shall be gathered through the Gate of Carefree Wandering.

Through these twenty-four gates, all shall be constantly gathered. Would not all beings find joy in this?"

The Primordial Supreme Lord said: "I originally gathered through non-gathering, exhorting and transforming all beings. Once beings awaken, there is also no cause for gathering. If one can uphold and observe these teachings, boundless blessings shall be attained."

The Primordial Supreme Lord again addressed the attendant perfected ones at His side: "If among the multitudes of the lower realms there are faithful and devout followers of the Dao who, for the sake of their nine generations of ancestors and distant parents in the dark realms, establish the Three Clarities’ sacred thrones and light the Seven Luminaries’ bright lamps—whether in ancient temples and numinous altars or in purified chambers within their own homes—burn incense, perform the Dao, chant the Cavernous Chapters, recite scriptures and repent, and offer grand jiao rites to the myriad heavens with unwavering sincerity, I shall dispatch the Most High Sovereign of Salvation, the Heavenly Worthy of Great Compassion, to open the Seven-Treasure Cloud Tower in the Nine Qi Heavenly Palace, revealing the Golden Script of the Azure Tablets and proclaiming the august names of the Heavenly Worthies. Descending to the human realm, they shall enable all in heaven and earth to perform rites of reverence and invocation, erasing the records from the Jade Caskets of the Nine Dark Realms’ eternal night, so that the seven generations of ancestors may attain deliverance, their souls ascending to the Southern Palace, where immortals shall receive and guide them to carefree non-action, gaining boundless blessings.

Therefore, burn incense, surrender body and life, prostrate with the five limbs touching the earth, and with sincere devotion, pay homage to:

The Jade Clarity Sacred Realm’s Void and Spontaneous Primordial Heavenly Worthy,
The Upper Clarity True Realm’s Most High Dao Lord and Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy,
The Great Clarity Immortal Realm’s Most High Lord Lao and Heavenly Worthy of Dao and Virtue,
The Most High Azure Heaven’s August Supreme Lord, the Golden Gate Jade Emperor,
The Purple Tenuity’s Supreme Palace’s Heavenly Emperor of the Southern Culmen,
The Purple Tenuity’s Central Palace’s Great Emperor of the Northern Culmen,
The Earthly Deity Who Upholds Heaven and Emulates the Law, the August and Illustrious Empress of Earth,
The Great Emperor of Longevity of the Southern Culmen, the Heavenly Worthy Who Governs Heaven and the Primordial Sage,
The Great Emperor of the Eastern Culmen of Azure Radiance, the Heavenly Worthy of Great Compassion Who Saves from Suffering,
The Great Sage of True Illumination, the Heavenly Worthy of Universal Transformation Who Responds to the Thunder’s Voice,
The Great Emperor and Thunder Ancestor of the Nine Heavens, the Heavenly Worthy Who Eliminates Disasters and Aids All Beings,
The Great Heavenly Emperor of the Purple Tenuity’s Azure Jade Palace Who Protects and Controls the Kalpas,
The Great Emperor of the Six Heavens’ Cavernous Abyss Who Subdues Demons, the Supreme Heavenly Worthy of the Great One,
The Lord Emperor of the Six Waves of Heaven Who Universally Bestows the Dharma’s Moisture,
The Heavenly Worthy of the Nine Heavens’ Controller of the Red Mound Who Delivers Lives."

If there are those in the world who uphold the Dao, faithful households, who on their life-destiny birthdays, the Eight Festivals, or the Three Primes, burn incense and recite, establishing grand fasts and offering sacrifices, chanting the precious titles of the Three Clarities and the names of the Perfected Ones—may their highest prayers ascend: for the Three Dukes and their assisting ministers, for generals and officials, to present memorials and petitions, welcoming auspiciousness and gathering blessings, forever attaining wealth and nobility, and long preserving distant longevity."

The Master of Subtle Wonder burned incense and gave thanks to the Golden Portal’s Lord of Heaven, offering this hymn of praise:
Heaven-born wisdom comes to aid the flourishing age,
With ice-like jade’s sharpness and phoenix-bird’s grace.
Harmonizing the primal transformations, striving to aid concord,
Farmers sing in green fields, weapons rest from the four frontiers.
May the Five Blessings long gather, the celestial fortune forever abide.

At that time, the Golden Portal’s Great Sage, the Primordial Lord of the Highest Origin, was seated upon his precious cloud-jade throne in the wondrous realm of the Nine Clarities, the Heavenly Palace of Five Clouds. He convened a great assembly of immortals, expounding the wondrous Dharma of True Unity to broadly deliver all beings, causing them all to attain transcendence and awakening.

At that moment, the Most High Dao Lord, the Most High Lord Lao, together with all the Heavenly Great Sages, the Perfected of Wondrous Conduct, the Supreme Perfected of the Nine Heavens, the Four Controllers and Five Emperors, and all the divine immortals—each riding five-colored jade wheels, eight-scene jade chariots, flying cloud canopies, ten-fold spirit banners, dragon standards, and phoenix plumes—burned incense and scattered flowers, traversing the void and pacing the heavens, chanting cavernous hymns. They circled the jeweled terrace of kalpas’ height, all together praising and singing to the Primordial Lord of the Highest Origin, rejoicing in celebration.

At that time, the August One, with great majesty and virtue, emitted the seven-jeweled divine radiance, illuminating the vast heavens and reaching down to the boundless worlds, the Nine Dark Realms’ long-night hells. The karmic retributions of good and evil were all made manifest.

Then, the Heavenly Lords of the Nine Qi of the East, with their attendant Perfected and numinous officials, ascended to the Golden Portal.

chunks.original_text: 忽闻地狱死魂，受对考罚，痛声号绝。 又见死魂无托，冥暗之中，鬼官不录。 是时五帝上问：此辈罪人，是何业报，受拷痛切难任。 伏愿天慈，特垂救度。 元始上帝谓帝君曰：下元生人，死魂受考。 为前生，不忠不孝，君臣不义，父子不慈，不敬三光，不信罪福，欺师谤道，反逆宗亲，广杀物命，纵恣贪淫，司命夺算，寿无定年，死魂报对，劫尽无解。 此人为前生耽酒嗜肉，杀戮无度，不造善功，专行不道，年算未尽，被六天洞宫鬼神，乘人罪衅，放其毒疫，夭伤人命，水火、盗贼、疫疠、刀兵危难，困苦官私，口舌枷锁，迍骞令人，所为不遂，年月岁久，遭遇不少。 又见风雷之狱，常有黑风震雷，霹雳飞戈，冲突罪人，分散肢体，穿穴五脏，万劫受苦，昼夜不息。 又见火翳之狱，有诸罪人，吞火食炭，为火所烧，头面焦燎，头戴火山，皮肤骨肉，节节生火，万劫受苦，昼夜不息。 又见金刚之狱，有诸罪人，金锤铁杖，乱拷无数，肢体烂坏，筋骨零落，铁叉穿腹，金锤塞心，万劫受苦，昼夜不息。 又见溟泠之狱，有诸罪人，沉没寒冰，剑戟霜刃，冲断筋骨，百毒之汁，以灌其上，五体零落，心腹破坏，万劫受苦，昼夜不息。 又见铜柱地狱，有诸罪人，身上铜柱，大火猛焰，令诸罪人，手抱足登，表裹焦烂，腹背脓溃，万劫受苦，昼夜不息。 又见屠割地狱，有诸罪人，身被倒悬，刀剑割体，四肢筋脉，皮肤五藏，皆有刀刃割切，其中罪人，血流满地，非可堪忍，万劫受苦，昼夜不息。 又见火车地狱，有诸罪人，五车裂体，四肢分散，或身处火车，东西南北，一一车轮，皆有兵刃，随轮运转，割切罪人，加诸猛火，烧炙焦烂，万劫受苦，昼夜不息。 又见镬汤地狱，有诸罪人，身被铁叉，叉入镬汤，五体煮渍，四肢烂溃，脓血臭秽，不可堪忍，万劫受苦，昼夜不息。 是时，元始上帝、十方救苦天尊、救度真人，施大威光，假六通慧，力令诸罪魂，闭目静思，自识宿命生存之日，造诸恶业。 或手弒君父不孝二亲，或诽谤真仙，或残伤兄弟，或谋反师尊，或淫犯骨肉，或劫贼杀害，或屠割孤贫、以强陵弱。 以贵虐残，或秽慢灵文，或阴贼嫉妬，或恶口两舌，或斗乱善人，积劫以来，所犯诸罪，一时顿忆。 各各明了，倍增悲恼，愿求解脱，咸乞救度。 元始上帝再告侍真曰：吾见诸罪人，旷劫以来，不信经忏，唯罪是修，遂使名书恶簿，身没九幽，魂滞三涂，无由解脱。 若有清信男女，发心为上世亡魂、父母眷属，建斋行道，拜表上章，济接孤贫，放生续命者，吾遣太乙救苦天尊於紫微上宫开三天奥藏、七部琼篇、蕊简琅函，出天尊懿号，下降人间，赞叹讽诵，吟咏洞章，消灭罪犯，削落九幽长夜。 玉匮之函，遍使一切罪魂，离苦解脱，随愿往生，逍遥无为，咸获超度。 是故烧香，归身归命，五体投地。 志心朝礼， 玉清圣境虚无自然元始天尊， 上清真境太上道君灵宝天尊， 太清仙境太上老君道德天尊， 太上昊天至尊金阙玉皇上帝， 南极星主紫微上宫天皇大帝， 中天星主紫微中宫北极大帝， 承天效法厚德光大后土皇地祇， 南极长生大帝统天元圣天尊， 东极青华大帝太乙救苦天尊， 贞明大圣九天应元雷声普化天尊，

chunks.original_text: 造业之时，无所畏惧。 或叫唤鬼神，以为救助； 或上指三光七祖，以为盟誓。 六亲相残，伤杀无道，临命终时，恋其室宅财宝，爱惜本身，顾怜妻女，心迫情切。 或发恶愿，债主冤家，俱在目前，沉沦五道，无由解脱。 伏愿天慈大开恩宥，救度群伦，出离幽冥，咸使悟道。 是时，元始上帝告侍真曰：吾观下界众生，妄想颠倒，皆从心起。 强生分别，击念在心，触境生迷，举心皆妄。 当自定志，智慧观身，骨肉肌肤、形骸毛发、六根四大、五藏百神，谛想思惟，总无实处。 共相假合，结聚成身。 表裹寻求，我在何处。 身既是假，心即成空。 空假非真，悉为妄想。 是非憎爱，贪着色声，香味触法，嫉妬悭贪，杀盗邪淫，绮言恶骂，凡诸作业，泯尔皆除。 内外清虚，自悟真道。 元始上帝告侍真曰：汝等定智观身，总无实处。 人之执见者，为六根三业未净。 一曰眼根，二曰耳根，三曰鼻根，四曰舌根，五曰身根，六日意根。 夫六根者，能生诸业。 犹如草木生诸花叶子实，展转六情六贼六欲，能生诸业。 若能用智慧思惟、六根诸业皆尽。 夫三业者，一者身业，二者心业，三者口业。 身则杀盗邪淫，心则悭贪瞋怒，口则绮言妄语。 恶口两舌，共成十恶，谛思十恶，悉是浮虚。 但自三业及六 根渐自除灭，损之又损，久能行之，真道自悟。 元始上帝告左右侍真曰：吾念下界众生，历劫以来，运心起意，多有虚妄，并不真淳，多有绮言。 或於天尊圣像前，行诸绮言。 或於经法道场前，行诸绮言。 或於父母尊亲前，行诸绮言。 或於贤人长者前，行诸绮言。 或於豪贵长者前，行诸绮言。 或於聪明识解前，行诸绮言。 或於诸天圣众日月星辰前，举心皆行绮言，其罪深重。 今日恭对三宝灵坛前忏谢，咸乞荡除，吾念众生，立身运心，绮言妄语，恶口两舌，嫉妬胜己，斗乱是非，离人骨肉，反虚成实，转伪为真。 今日忏悔，皆令清净，得入信根。 元始上帝告左右侍真曰：吾观下界众生，立身以来，眼耳鼻舌，起意造恶，杀生偷盗，邪淫放荡，悭贪瞋怒，愚痴颠倒，绮言妄语，恶口两舌，嫉妬胜己，饮酒食肉，违犯三光，背真向伪，信邪倒见，祷祀鬼神，不奉三宝，訾毁唝嗃，轻慢傲诞，媅滞色欲，染习香味，沉迷触法，内造外作，展转相生。 六根互起，更相成愆，罪根增长，念念成非，有无量罪数，结习来久，总在身中，不可称计。 一发念心，皆得清净，犹如明鉴尘埃，蒙蔽脂垢，积聚生翳，内外不明。 一旦遇良工，拂拭磨洗，表裹光彻，远近洞照，还复如初。 何以故？ 性本清净，人生亦尔； 神本清净，无诸滓秽。 但受形之后，渐染成愆，六根六情，六贼六欲，六识分别，妄作秽弊，生身障翳，失其真性，流浪生死，动入罪根，报对相缠，便入地狱，受诸苦恼，万劫轮转。 吾以慈悲怜念众生，故从劫到劫，转轮人间，或生夷夏，或老或少，或贵或贱，种种方便教化，度脱众生。 经教流传，开悟一切，使离苦恼，永出泥犁。 但众生智劣，不能解悟，我今为汝分别罪福因缘，令一切众生，悉得解脱。 元始上帝谓众真曰：若有下方善信男女受持此经，烧香忏悔，洗涤身中一切苦恼，悉得清净，消无量无边宿根恶业。

When they commit transgressions, they know no fear. Some invoke ghosts and spirits, seeking their aid; others point to the Three Luminaries and their seven generations of ancestors, swearing false oaths. They turn kin against kin, inflicting harm and slaughter without principle. As their lives draw to an end, they cling to their homes, wealth, and treasures, cherishing their own bodies and gazing back with longing at wives and daughters, their hearts gripped by desperate attachment. Or they utter wicked vows, and their creditors and enemies appear before them. Sinking into the Five Paths, they find no escape.

We humbly beseech the Heavenly Compassion to open wide its mercy, deliver all beings, and lead them out of the dark realms, that all may awaken to the Dao.

Then the Most High Lord of the Primordial Dao addressed the attendant Perfected Ones: "I observe that the beings below, lost in deluded thoughts and inverted views, all arise from the heart. They forcibly create distinctions, their minds struck by fleeting impulses, and upon encountering circumstances, they fall into confusion. Every thought they conceive is false. They must steady their resolve and contemplate their bodies with wisdom—bone, flesh, skin, limbs, hair, the six roots, the four great elements, the five viscera, and the hundred spirits. When they carefully reflect and ponder, they find no true substance. All is but a temporary aggregation, a confluence of illusory forms. Searching within and without, where is the self to be found? Since the body is but an illusion, the heart becomes empty. Emptiness and illusion are not real; all is but deluded thought. Right and wrong, love and hatred, attachment to forms and sounds, scents, tastes, touches, and dharmas—jealousy, stinginess, greed, killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, deceitful speech, harsh words, all such deeds—vanish entirely. With inner and outer purity and emptiness, one awakens to the true Dao."

The Most High Lord of the Primordial Dao addressed the attendant Perfected Ones: "When you contemplate the body with settled wisdom, you find no true substance. Those who cling to false views do so because their six roots and three karmic actions remain impure. The six roots are: the eye root, the ear root, the nose root, the tongue root, the body root, and the mind root. These six roots give rise to all karmic actions, just as grasses and trees produce flowers, leaves, seeds, and fruits. In turn, the six emotions, six thieves, and six desires generate all karmic actions. If one employs wisdom to reflect, the karmic actions of the six roots are all exhausted.

The three karmic actions are: bodily karma, mental karma, and verbal karma. Bodily karma includes killing, stealing, and sexual misconduct; mental karma includes stinginess, greed, and anger; verbal karma includes deceitful speech, falsehoods, harsh words, and divisive speech. Together, these form the ten evils. When one carefully reflects, all ten evils are seen as insubstantial. By gradually eliminating the three karmic actions and the six roots, diminishing them again and again, and persisting in this practice over time, one naturally awakens to the true Dao."

The Most High Lord of the Primordial Dao addressed the Perfected Ones attending on either side: "I pity the beings below, who for kalpas uncounted have set their minds and intentions upon falsehoods, lacking in sincerity and truth, indulging in deceitful speech. Some utter such speech before the sacred images of the Heavenly Worthies; others do so before the scriptures and Daoist altars; still others before their parents and revered elders, before the wise and the venerable, before the powerful and the noble, or before those of keen understanding. Even before the divine assemblies of the heavens, the sun, moon, and stars, their every thought is tainted with deceitful speech. Their sins are grave indeed. Today, before the sacred altar of the Three Treasures, they repent and seek forgiveness, praying that all may be cleansed.

I pity these beings, whose bodies and minds give rise to deceitful speech, falsehoods, harsh words, divisive speech, jealousy toward those who surpass them, and the stirring of strife and contention. They sever the bonds of kinship, turn falsehood into truth, and transform deception into reality. Today, through repentance, may all be purified, and may they enter the root of faith."

The Most High Lord of the Primordial Dao addressed the Perfected Ones attending on either side: "I observe that the beings below, from the moment they assume form, employ their eyes, ears, nose, and tongue to conceive evil—killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, dissipation, stinginess, greed, anger, delusion, inverted views, deceitful speech, falsehoods, harsh words, divisive speech, jealousy toward those who surpass them, consuming alcohol and meat, violating the Three Luminaries, turning from truth toward falsehood, believing in perverse and inverted views, sacrificing to ghosts and spirits, failing to honor the Three Treasures, slandering and reviling, arrogance and contempt, indulgence in sensual desires, attachment to scents and flavors, sinking into infatuation with touch and dharmas, creating evil within and without, each giving rise to the other. The six roots interact, compounding transgressions, their roots of sin growing ever deeper. With every thought, they commit wrongs, accumulating boundless sins over time, all lodged within their bodies, beyond reckoning.

Yet with a single thought of the heart, all may be purified. It is like a bright mirror covered in dust, its surface obscured by grease and grime, accumulating into cataracts that cloud its inner and outer radiance. But when it encounters a skilled craftsman who wipes, polishes, and cleanses it, its surface and depths become luminous once more, reflecting near and far as it did in the beginning. Why is this so? Because its nature is fundamentally pure. So too is the human condition: the spirit is inherently pure, free from all defilement. Yet after assuming form, one gradually becomes tainted by transgressions—the six roots, six emotions, six thieves, six desires, and the discriminations of the six consciousnesses—creating defilements and obscurations. The body becomes an obstacle, and one loses the true nature, drifting through the cycles of birth and death, ever falling into the roots of sin. Entangled in karmic retribution, one enters hell, suffering myriad torments, revolving through ten thousand kalpas.

Out of compassion, I pity these beings and have, from kalpa to kalpa, turned the wheel in the human realm, appearing now among the barbarians, now among the Chinese, now old, now young, now noble, now base, employing every expedient means to teach and deliver them. The scriptural teachings have spread, awakening all beings, that they may escape suffering and forever depart from the hells. Yet beings are dull-witted and fail to comprehend. Therefore, I now distinguish for you the causes and conditions of sin and merit, that all beings may attain liberation."

The Most High Lord of the Primordial Dao addressed the assembly of Perfected Ones: "If there are faithful men and women below who receive and uphold this scripture, burn incense, and repent, washing away all the sufferings within their bodies, they shall attain purity and dissolve the boundless, measureless roots of past evil karma."

chunks.original_text: 六天洞渊大帝伏魔上上太一天尊， 六波天主帝君溥施法润天尊， 九天可韩司丈人朱陵度命天尊， 九天采访使应元保运妙化天尊， 东方九炁天中青灵始老洞空天 南方三炁天中丹灵真老洞清天 西方七为天中皓灵皇老洞虚天尊， 北方五炁天中五灵玄老洞征天尊， 中央一炁天中玄灵元老洞真天尊。 志心朝礼，东南方好生度命天尊。 志心朝礼，开拔苦魂天尊。 志心朝礼，因缘高仙天尊。 志心朝礼，解悟普照天尊。 志心朝礼，无名太玄天尊。 志心朝礼，神化高素天尊。 志心朝礼，开功保命天尊。 志心朝礼，戒生紫虚天尊。 志心朝礼，大圣圣王天尊。 志心朝礼，大洞成清天尊。 志心朝礼，结威八神天尊。 志心朝礼，明真智明天尊。 志心朝礼，升玄真明天尊。 志心朝礼，紫府仙灵天尊。 志心朝礼，慧观明仙天尊。 志心朝礼，青宫妙真天尊。 志心朝礼，无碍保生天尊。 志心朝礼，保命戒生天尊。 志心朝礼，日新大乘天尊。 志心朝礼，法华妙乐天尊。 志心朝礼，流电云宫天尊。 志心朝礼，霞想凝湛天尊。 志心朝礼，万变太和天尊。 志心朝礼，朱湛妙霞天尊。 志心朝礼，盖天法王天尊。 志心朝礼，六觉玄通天尊。 志心朝礼，太清洞真天尊。 志心朝礼，广天妙运天尊。 志心朝礼，法海宝心天尊。 志心朝礼，天皇升极天尊。 志心朝礼，道行真空天尊。 志心朝礼，五老梵行天尊。 志心朝礼，妙虚玄通天尊。 志心朝礼，宝明慧解天尊。 志心朝礼，救生正真天尊。 志心朝礼，朱花妙彩天尊。 志心朝礼，尊神戒生天尊。 志心朝礼，权实真一天尊。 志心朝礼，重玄应感天尊。 志心朝礼，慈光朱日天尊。 志心朝礼，景玄真人。 志心朝礼，明空真人。 志心朝礼，明玄真人。 志心朝礼，明上真人。 志心朝礼，万道真人。 志心朝礼，景明真人。 元始上帝告左右侍真、天地水府三官、一切圣众曰：吾今以此诸天尊名号，下降人间，遣金华真人徧布万国九州，使一切人民礼诵。 若有清真之士、奉道之人，或遇三元八节、五腊十直、生日忌辰，为七世幽魂、先祖父母、一切群生，修斋行道，请道士法师，步虚赞叹，拜表上章，礼谢天地、日月、星辰、地府冥官、水府仙者，即有十直灵官奏上诸天，蒙此功德，拔离五苦，度脱三涂。 上登朱陵府，下入开光门，神仙同接引，万世福长存，普天皆获庆，浩劫荷天恩。 志心朝礼， 蓬莱山得道一切神仙， 榑桑山得道一切神仙， 方丈山得道一切神仙， 沧浪山得道一切神仙， 瀛州上真得道一切神仙， 祖洲上真得道一切神仙， 聚窟洲上真得道一切神仙， 炎洲上真得道一切神仙， 凤麟洲上真得道一切神仙， 玄洲上真得道一切神仙， 流洲上真得道一切神仙， 长洲上真得道一切神仙， 元洲上真得道一切神仙， 生洲上真得道一切神仙， 天下三十六靖庐仙官， 天下二十八治名山得道一切神仙。 元始上帝再告左右侍真曰：吾今遣玉清真人赍此经，降下人间，使一切众生散布供养，四时转念，上消天灾，下禳毒害，增福无量。 若有积善之民，遇三元八节、本命忌辰，为亡过先祖、父母幽魂，追荐冥福，烧香礼诵三清宝号、诸大真人名位，愿上世亡魂，使所生父母、一切兆民，生生获福，早遇神仙，身臻五福，长享自然。

chunks.original_text: 冲妙先生朝谢金阙上帝而献颂曰： 玉帝宣天旨，普放幽夜魂。 八难俱解释，五道悉开通。 酆都绝报对，上朝朱陵宫。 群生悟至道，永享福无穷。 太上灵宝朝天谢罪大忏卷之六竟 太上灵宝朝天谢罪大忏卷之七 尔时，元始上帝在大罗天中玉清宫内，坐五云天宝妙台，集诸天仙、地仙、水仙、三界灵真、无鞅数众，齐赴天关，上朝玉清，烧香散花，步虚旋绕，朝拜至尊。 是时，上帝大布威光，广演妙法，念度一切，咸使悟道。 时有上清真人、太极真人、妙行真人，出班烧香，朝拜至尊：臣自历劫以来，叨居真列，荣侍琼轩，每听灵音，开悟尘品，长念下方兆庶，流吹欲海，飘浪爱河，轮回生死，不曾暂息，未知作何善果，出离沉沦，尽获超度。 是时，元始上帝告左右侍真曰：下界若有善信男女，长行利益，割口损身，施舍财宝，常作福田，济及鸟兽蠢动含灵，普救饥寒，最为第一。 若道边开井，建立屋宇，种植果林，抚养劳苦，及於江河广立桥梁，运度行旅，勤行不倦。 众圣护身，得福无量。 元始上帝告左右侍真曰：吾念众生，在三毒十恶之中，为诸魍魉、精魅、恶鬼、邪神、毒虫、猛兽、刀兵、水火、杻械、牢狱、疾病、苦痛、凶祸缠绕，不能自安。 吾固为汝演说三洞大法、符箓宝经，救护世间，令得安乐。 为众生愚痴，不识罪福，放纵六情。 或杀生偷盗，邪淫放荡，悭贪瞋怒，愚痴颠倒，绮言妄语，恶口两舌，啖食众生，违天犯地，背正信邪，祷祀鬼神，众罪纵横而无片善，致使毒风恶炁，六天魔鬼，徧满人间，流行杀伐，日夜不停。 吾甚哀悯。 吾常遣诸天帝王、十极神仙、四司五帝，按行救度，咸使超悟，不遇众恶，夙愆消荡 元始上帝再告左右天仙曰：吾见凡夫，从无量劫来，沉沦罪苦，造诸恶业，杀生偷盗，邪淫放荡，悭贪瞋怒，愚痴颠倒，恶口两舌，绮言妄语，啖食群毛，杀害生性，违天逆地，不信罪福，业力探重，不可称量。 可於宫观灵坛，或在本家净室，建立三清宝座、五帝星坛，烧香散花，朝礼天地，忏悔上章，乞消罪犯，身宅清净，一切诸厄，尽得消除，获福无量。 若有帝王、国主、后妃、帝子、天孙，发无上心，请道士法师，为七世祖祢、七代宗亲、亡过父母、一切眷属，於正殿宫庭，或清净道室，建置道场，转礼经忏，烧香然灯，忏悔行道，散施财宝，衣服卧具，放生续命，广设斋醮，勤心不退，吾遣十天真人、四司五帝、十直灵官，下降观察。 身心不怠者，使病者得差，死者得活，厄者得度，禁者得脱，行者得还，仕者得迁。 水火、刀兵、虎狼、毒兽、邪精、魍魉，一切厄难，永不干身，年命长远，各得安宁。 若为亡过祖考，心愿出离九幽刀山、剑树镬汤、鞭挞楚痛之中，上生天堂，逍遥无为，咸悟至道。 若为帝王、后妃、帝子、人民、土地、一切众生，转礼经忏，救护群品，见世安乐，获福无量。 若兵戈四起，侵害兆民，转礼经忏，即得退散，无有损伤。 若疾疫时行，人民卧疾，转礼经忏，即得痊愈，兆民安乐。 若水旱不调，五谷妨害，转礼经忏，即得风雨顺调，百谷滋茂。 若恶风毒气，飘灼火灾，烧失宅舍，转礼经忏，即得天炁调和，百物清润。 若恶鬼、毒虫、猛兽害人，转礼经忏，悉皆迸退。

Master Chongmiao prostrated before the Golden Portal of the Celestial Emperor and offered this hymn of praise:

"The Jade Emperor proclaims the celestial decree,
Universally releasing souls from the dark of night.
The Eight Difficulties all dissolve,
The Five Paths all open wide.
Fengdu’s retributions cease,
And they ascend to the Crimson Palace on high.
All beings awaken to the supreme Dao,
Forever enjoying boundless fortune."

*Thus concludes Scroll Six of the Supreme Lingbao Repentance for Atonement Before Heaven*

*Scroll Seven of the Supreme Lingbao Repentance for Atonement Before Heaven begins*

At that time, the Primordial Celestial Venerable was in the Jade Clarity Palace within the Great Canopy Heaven, seated upon the Five-Cloud Celestial Treasure Wondrous Terrace. He gathered the celestial immortals, terrestrial immortals, aquatic immortals, the numinous perfected of the Three Realms, and an immeasurable host. All proceeded to the Celestial Pass, ascending to the Jade Clarity, burning incense and scattering flowers, pacing the void in circumambulation, and prostrating before the Most August.

Then, the Celestial Venerable radiated his majestic light and broadly expounded the wondrous Dharma, vowing to deliver all beings and enable their awakening to the Dao.

At that moment, the Perfected of Supreme Clarity, the Perfected of the Great Ultimate, and the Perfected of Wondrous Conduct stepped forward, burned incense, and prostrated before the Most August, saying: "Since time immemorial, we have been graced to dwell among the ranks of the perfected and honorably attend the jeweled portals. Each time we hear the numinous sounds, we awaken the dust-bound multitudes. We constantly contemplate the myriad people below, adrift in the sea of desire, tossed upon the waves of love, ceaselessly revolving through birth and death. We know not what meritorious deeds might enable them to escape this sinking abyss and attain complete deliverance."

Then, the Primordial Celestial Venerable addressed the attendant perfected at his side, saying: "If there are faithful men and women in the world below who perpetually engage in acts of benefit, restraining their mouths and mortifying their bodies, bestowing alms of wealth and treasure, and constantly cultivating fields of merit—extending aid to birds, beasts, and all creatures possessing consciousness, universally relieving hunger and cold—this is foremost among all deeds.

"If they dig wells by the roadside, construct dwellings, plant orchards and groves, and succor the weary and suffering; or if they build bridges across rivers to ferry travelers, diligently and tirelessly performing such acts—then the host of sages will guard their bodies, and they shall accrue boundless merit."

The Primordial Celestial Venerable addressed the attendant perfected at his side, saying: "I pity the multitude of beings entangled in the Three Poisons and Ten Evils, beset by demonic sprites, malevolent ghosts, evil spirits, venomous insects, fierce beasts, weapons of war, fire and flood, fetters and prisons, illness and suffering, calamities and misfortunes, unable to find peace.

"For this reason, I expound for you the great Dharma of the Three Caverns, the talismanic scriptures and precious sutras, to save and protect the world and grant it peace and happiness. Yet beings, deluded and ignorant, fail to recognize sin and merit, indulging their six senses. Some kill living beings, steal, engage in licentiousness and debauchery, hoard with greed, seethe with anger, wallow in ignorance and delusion, utter deceitful and frivolous speech, slander with malicious words, and devour the flesh of living creatures. They defy heaven and earth, forsake the true and follow the perverse, sacrifice to ghosts and spirits, committing a multitude of sins without a single good deed. Thus, poisonous winds and malevolent qi, the demonic ghosts of the Six Heavens, pervade the human realm, perpetuating slaughter day and night without cease. I grieve deeply for them.

"I constantly dispatch the Celestial Emperor Kings, the Ten Ultimate Immortals, the Four Controllers and Five Emperors to inspect and deliver them, enabling all to awaken and transcend, avoiding the multitude of evils, and dissolving their long-standing transgressions."

The Primordial Celestial Venerable again addressed the celestial immortals at his side, saying: "I observe that since time without beginning, ordinary beings have sunk into the suffering of sin, creating manifold evil karma—killing living beings, stealing, engaging in licentiousness and debauchery, hoarding with greed, seething with anger, wallowing in ignorance and delusion, slandering with malicious words, uttering deceitful and frivolous speech, devouring the flesh of creatures, destroying lives, defying heaven and earth, disbelieving in sin and merit. The weight of their karmic deeds is immeasurable.

"They may establish the precious thrones of the Three Clarities and the stellar altars of the Five Emperors in the sacred halls of temples or within the pure chambers of their own homes. Burning incense and scattering flowers, they may prostrate before heaven and earth, repent and present memorials, beseeching the dissolution of their transgressions. Thus, their bodies and dwellings shall be purified, and all calamities shall be entirely eradicated, accruing boundless merit.

"If emperors, kings, empresses, imperial consorts, princes, or celestial descendants arouse the supreme aspiration and invite Daoist masters and ritual masters to establish a ritual arena in the main palace hall or a pure Daoist chamber for the sake of their seven generations of ancestors, seven generations of lineage, deceased parents, and all kin—reciting scriptures, performing repentance rituals, burning incense and lighting lamps, repenting and practicing the Dao, bestowing alms of wealth, clothing, and bedding, releasing living beings to extend their lives, and broadly conducting fasts and offerings with unwavering devotion—then I shall dispatch the Ten Celestial Perfected, the Four Controllers and Five Emperors, and the Ten Upright Numinous Officials to descend and observe.

"If their minds and bodies remain steadfast, the sick shall recover, the dead shall revive, the imperiled shall be delivered, the imprisoned shall be freed, travelers shall return, and officials shall be promoted. Water, fire, weapons of war, tigers, wolves, venomous beasts, evil spirits, and demonic sprites—all calamities and difficulties—shall never afflict their bodies. Their years shall be long, and each shall attain peace and tranquility.

"If, for the sake of deceased ancestors, they aspire to liberate them from the Nine Dark Hells, the Knife Mountains, the Sword Trees, the Cauldrons of Boiling Oil, and the torments of whips and cudgels, enabling them to ascend to the celestial halls, roam freely in non-action, and awaken to the supreme Dao—

"If, for emperors, empresses, princes, the people, the land, and all beings, they recite scriptures and perform repentance rituals to save and protect all, they shall enjoy peace in this life and accrue boundless merit.

"If weapons of war arise on all sides, harming the myriad people, reciting scriptures and performing repentance rituals shall cause them to retreat and disperse without inflicting harm.

"If epidemics spread and the people lie stricken with illness, reciting scriptures and performing repentance rituals shall bring immediate recovery and peace to the multitude.

"If floods and droughts disrupt the balance, harming the five grains, reciting scriptures and performing repentance rituals shall bring timely wind and rain, and the hundred grains shall flourish.

"If malevolent winds and poisonous qi, scorching fires, and conflagrations consume dwellings, reciting scriptures and performing repentance rituals shall harmonize the celestial qi, and all things shall be pure and moist.

"If evil ghosts, venomous insects, and fierce beasts harm people, reciting scriptures and performing repentance rituals shall cause them all to retreat and flee."

chunks.original_text: 若妇人怀妊，临产不分，转礼经忏，即得子母平安，并无厄难。 若宫殿舍宇，精邪鬼怪，故炁不安，转礼经忏，即得安静，永无怖惧。 元始上帝告左右侍真曰：礼忏功德，不可思议。 保国宁家，和天安地，上消天灾，下禳毒害，其福难称，普度天人。 元始上帝、再谓侍真曰：吾为众生，广作福田，大建功德，写经造像，置观度人，转礼经忏，修斋布施，果报巍巍，实为深厚。 何以故？ 财者，众生性命，切己难忘，能舍命财，心无吝惜。 广建功德，接济孤贫，内息悭贪，外除劫贼，人天利润，生死蒙恩。 救护之功，获福无量。 七祖先灵，尽皆超度。 元始上帝告左右侍真曰：吾与群仙，下观一切众生，命若蜉蝣之虫，朝生暮死，甚可哀伤。 夫人死者，五行数尽，气绝神逝，髓竭骨枯，形骸萧索，心怖神惧。 舍命之时，受大苦恼，内外六亲，围绕左右，男女悲泣，死魂惶惧，莫知去处。 身体虚冷，气息一绝，生前所作恶业罪犯，俱在目前。 若人前世积善，天人扶卫，魂超福境； 若人生平积业，牛头罗剎，驱入地狱，受诸苦恼。 当此之时，英雄豪贵，顿尔俱消。 高车大马，何关人事。 庄宅金宝，尽属他人。 妻子眷属，岂能相代。 一切冤对，俱在目前，如影随形，莫可逃避。 若有善信男女，大启洪愿，为亡过父母、一切宗亲，大醮天地，拜表上章，转礼真经，如暗得明，如疾得药，如贫得宝，如饥得食，如囚得出，如旱得雨。 洗涤罪障，皆得清净，上生福堂，出离五苦，永得超度。 元始上帝再告左右侍真曰：下界十方国土，若有清信奉道男女，或为地狱苦魂、罪障恶鬼，建三清宝座、五帝灵坛，烧香然灯，百珍异果，上章拜表，大醮诸天。 为一切六畜群毛、堵狗牛马、驴骡业畜，忏谢恶业重罪者，吾遣太乙救苦天尊，开紫微上宫、琼简紫箓宝函，出天尊懿号，传度下方一切人民，称扬赞叹，吟咏洞章，思神念真，乞削落九幽长夜之罪、六畜之业。 使出度人天，离苦解脱，获福无量，咸得超度。 是故烧香，归身归命，五体投地。 志心朝礼， 玉清圣境虚无自然元始天尊， 上清真境太上道君灵宝天尊， 太清仙境太上老君道德天尊， 太上昊天至尊金阙玉皇上帝， 南极星主紫微上宫天皇大帝， 中天星主紫微中宫北极大帝， 承天效法厚德光大后土皇地祇， 南极长生大帝统天元圣天尊， 东极青华大帝太一救苦天尊， 贞明大圣九天应元雷声普化天尊， 九天雷祖大帝除灾济物天尊， 紫微碧玉宫太一大天帝保制劫运天尊， 六天洞渊大帝伏魔上上太一天尊， 六波天主帝君溥施法润天尊， 九天可韩司丈人朱陵度命天尊， 九天采访使应元保运妙化天尊， 东方九炁天中青灵始老洞空天尊， 南方三炁天中丹灵真老洞清天尊， 西方七炁天中皓灵皇老洞虚天尊， 北方五炁天中五灵玄老洞微天尊， 中央一炁天中玄灵元老洞真天尊。 志心朝礼，西南方太灵虚皇天尊。 志心朝礼，道功真空天尊。 志心朝礼，玄会为说天尊。 志心朝礼，因果上光天尊。 志心朝礼，度幽洞玄天尊。 志心朝礼，玄会神妙天尊。 志心朝礼，益智方便天尊。 志心朝礼，湛然中天天尊。 志心朝礼，梵行太皇天尊。 志心朝礼，万德洞玄天尊。 志心朝礼，八景戒生天尊。

The Primordial Celestial Venerable again addressed the attendant perfected ones, saying: "I now dispatch the Perfected One of Golden Florescence to descend with this scripture, dispersing it throughout the ten thousand states and nine provinces, that all in the human and heavenly realms may chant and recite it. On behalf of their present parents, deceased ancestors, and all sentient beings, they may perform reverent rites to dissolve karmic misfortunes of old. Those who devoutly make offerings shall see their households flourish, their generations prosper, myriad disasters averted, and divine spirits guard their gates.

If there are Dao-following folk or faithful men and women in the world who, upon encountering the Three Origins, Five Vegetarian Feasts, or their destined birthdays, perform purification rites and chant the precious titles of the Three Clarities and the golden scripture of the jade scroll, they may redeem all the sinful ghosts and offenders in the Fengdu hells, wishing them liberation and deliverance, ascending to the Vermilion Palace, and rebirth into the human realm."

The Master of Subtle Wonder burned incense, paid homage, and offered thanks to the Golden Portal Celestial Venerable, presenting this hymn of praise:

The Primordial Venerable of Jade Capital,
Lord of creation and myriad transformations,
Reveals the numinous scripture to the Three Officials,
Opening the nine dark prisons below.
In Fengdu’s cauldrons of blazing hells,
Compassion showers the Dharma rain,
Washing clean the souls of all sins,
That all may attain deliverance.

*End of the Seventh Scroll of the Most High Numinous Treasure Repentance for Heavenly Homage and Atonement of Sins*
*Beginning of the Eighth Scroll of the Most High Numinous Treasure Repentance for Heavenly Homage and Atonement of Sins*

At that time, in the first kalpa of the Dragon Han era, the Primordial Celestial Venerable, the Great Sage of the Golden Portal, was in the Jade Clarity Sacred Realm’s Primordial Yang Treasure Palace, seated upon the Five Clouds Heavenly Treasure Wondrous Terrace, expounding the sublime Dharma to the celestial great sages. Suddenly, the gates of heaven trembled violently, and the Primordial Celestial Venerable, with his divine radiance, illuminated below. There appeared a dense, black, noxious, blood-red qi rising to assail the heavenly gates, coiling and lingering without dispersal. This qi reeked of blood and filth, startling the assembled host.

The Primordial Celestial Venerable addressed the celestial great sages and perfected ones at his side: "Below, in the vast and boundless Dark Sea of the great wilderness, whose depths are unfathomable, stands a great mountain piercing the azure vault above and descending into the windy springs below, named the Northern Yin Fengdu Mount Luo. It is the master of yin qi and the pivot of the nine earths. Beneath it lies a great cavern called the Palace of the Yin Realm, wherein resides the Supreme Yin Water Emperor. Within the Northern Yin Celestial Lord are myriad officials of the netherworld, and the mountain holds three palaces, nine bureaus, and thirty-six great iron hells. The grasses and trees of this mountain naturally emit toxic qi, transforming all into blades and swords. Their edges flash through the air, black smoke billows, and malevolent winds howl ceaselessly day and night—all places where the netherworld officials torture and punish sinful ghosts and the dead.

Within are six palaces of great demonic evil spirits who, seeing sentient beings lost in darkness and delusion, descend in formations to the human realm, wantonly creating monstrous calamities, harming the living, and entangling the souls of the seven generations of deceased ancestors. They bring forth all manner of disasters, malignant illnesses, plagues, and toxic qi, causing indiscriminate death and untimely harm—so pitiable that one cannot bear to hear of it.

Then the attendant perfected ones, arrayed in ranks, burned incense and memorialized, prostrating themselves and beseeching the Most Venerable to open the power of great compassion and wisdom, to save and deliver all beings, that both the living and the dead may receive grace and escape the suffering of sin. They implored: 'May all sinners be spared the three calamities of the present world, the nine misfortunes, the five pestilences, the seven afflictions, the myriad diseases, the toxic qi, and the perils of demonic spirits and ghosts. May their lives be free from harm.'"

chunks.original_text: 如蒙哀悯，则仰受圣 言。 於是至尊告诸侍真曰：吾愍一切 众生，如母念子。 今为汝等敷演妙言，子可谛听，在心勿忘。 左右侍真、一切神仙，稽颡听命元始上帝圣言。 往昔人民淳朴，无有恶心，任命自然，终其 天算，无有夭伤。 今末世时代，浇薄人 心，破坏五情。 离乱更相，诳惑互相， 彼此不言正化，唯用邪行，背真从伪， 不道不仁，违天逆地，攻臣伐主，不忠 不孝，无爱无慈，欺诱万民，酷虐百姓， 枉杀众生，残害物命，结诸冤对，动多 患难。 或行劫夺，恶贼杀伤。 或恶魔 之所灭身。 或被蚖蛇、虎狼、百虫、毒 螫之所加害。 或官灾口舌，无故枉生， □击牢狱，鞭杖徒刑。 或家遭瘟疫，身 染毒气，大小疾病，人口死亡，六亲断绝，骨肉支离。 或天雷馘斩。 或天火烧身。 诸如罪犯，并是积业深重是致。 六天杀炁、北酆鬼众与五岳之神、阵亡鬼帅，游走天下，乘其罪衅，放其毒炁，以杀恶人，更相残贼，以致死亡，家道破坏，子孙绝灭。 吾见如此，甚可哀伤，不忍听闻。 世间若有奉道之民，发无上心，广施财宝，救济贫乏，放生续命，转念经忏，精心不退，上消凶灾，下禳万祸。 若遇国土兵灾不息，疫毒流行，若人虔心礼诵此忏、修设清斋者，则兵灾静息，妖恶自屏，天人称悦，欣国太平。 若在山林旷野，为虎狼猛兽之所奔突，则当虔心礼告，许转是经，则有护法善神救助，猛兽自退，终不为害。 若入大海，遭遇恶风，许转是经，风浪静息，得达於岸。 若军阵白刃之中，许转是经，兵杖伏匿，不有伤害。 若在牢狱枷锁之中，许转是经，冤枉自伸，必得解脱。 若为鬼魅邪精刑害，许转是经，鬼神消灭，不敢为害。 若人命过之日，魂入九幽地府，萦留男女夫妻为亡人立九幽斋醮，礼谢三宫，魂超五苦，随福受生。 是时，九幽地狱罪人闻说是经，身心开悟，皆发道意，永不退转，遂感上天降命，释放罪魂，咸皆超度。 是时九幽黑簿，一时焚烬，火山息焰，冰池静波，吞火食炭，化为甘露，金锤铁仗，变成莲花。 神仙拯拔，上朝南宫，咸得托化。 元始上帝以大威力，布大慈悲，救度一切众生，咸使身心清净，出离酆都地狱，随愿往生。 乃命救苦真人开通阳之台，展紫文琼笈，出天尊懿号。 汝等可建立三清宝座、五帝灵坛，挂旛献花，百珍异果，严陈供养，转礼经忏，拜表上章，醮谢诸天星宿、五帝三官，烧香然灯，吟咏洞章，乞削落明真九幽玉匮长夜之函，普使幽魂离苦解脱，消无量罪，获无量福，生死受赖。 是故烧香，归身归命，五体投地。 志心朝礼， 玉清圣境虚无自然元始天尊， 上清真境太上道君灵宝天尊， 太清仙境太上老君道德天尊， 太上昊天至尊金阙玉皇上帝， 南极星主紫微上宫天皇大帝， 中天星主紫微中宫北极大帝， 承天效法厚德光大后土皇地祇， 南极长生大帝统天元圣天尊， 东极青华大帝太乙救苦天尊， 贞明大圣九天应元雷声普化天， 九天雷祖大帝除灾济物天尊， 紫微碧玉宫太一大天帝保制劫运天尊， 六天洞渊大帝伏魔上上太一天尊， 六波天主帝君普施法润天尊， 九天可韩司丈人朱陵度命天尊， 九天采访使应元保运妙化天尊， 东方九炁天中青灵始老洞空天尊， 南方三炁天中丹灵真老洞清天尊，

chunks.original_text: 志心朝礼，寂然清悟天尊。 志心朝礼，灵真东华天尊。 志心朝礼，法海宝化天尊。 志心朝礼，洞元万灵天尊。 志心朝礼，无染太玄天尊。 志心朝礼，九幽拔罪天尊。 志心朝礼，随愿往生天尊。 志心朝礼，慈悲救苦真人。 志心朝礼，慈悲救度真人。 志心朝礼，慈悲大惠真人。 志心朝礼，应感真人。 志心朝礼，等慧真人。 志心朝礼，无想真人。 志心朝礼，太玄真人。 志心朝礼，万寿真人。 志心朝礼，太宝真人。 志心朝礼，无畏真人。 志心朝礼，等惠真人。 志心朝礼，金轮真人。 志心朝礼，玄上真人。 志心朝礼，法轮真人。 元始上帝告诸天神仙曰：吾今以此经，遣清华真人宝往下方，散布万国九州，遍使人天礼诵。 若有善信男女、修道之人，或遇本命忌辰、三元八节，烧香转礼天尊真人位号，醮谢地府冥官，为上世亡魂、生身父母、一切宗亲，忏谢夙愆罪犯、恶业重殃，脱落幽司，解除缠结，魂生福境，托化人伦，神仙接引，上朝太清。 志心朝礼， 酆都山北阴玄天酆都大帝， 酆都山左府太阳宫注生冥官， 酆都山右府太阴宫注死冥官， 酆都山七非府黑劫府定罪冥官， 酆都山连宛府明晨府定罪冥官， 酆都山九幽府谅事府定罪冥官， 酆都山咸池府灵纽府定罪冥官， 酆都山阴天府定罪冥官， 酆都山参灵狱律令狱考鬼灵官， 酆都山清灵狱九平狱考鬼灵官， 酆都山玄沙狱河伯狱考鬼灵官， 酆都山青韶狱禁罪狱考鬼灵官， 酆都山玄天狱天一狱考鬼灵官， 酆都山黄天狱风雷狱考鬼灵官， 酆都山平天狱虚天狱考鬼灵官， 酆都山女青狱自然狱考鬼灵官， 酆都山玄都狱元政狱考鬼灵官， 酆都山刑政狱万死狱考鬼灵官， 酆都山泉曲狱九天狱考鬼灵官， 酆都山寒冰狱镬汤狱考鬼灵官， 酆都山纣绝阴天宫洞魔王圣众， 酆都山大杀谅事宗天宫洞魔王圣众， 酆都山恬照罪气天宫洞魔王圣众， 酆都山宗灵七非天宫洞魔王圣众， 酆都山敢司连宛天宫洞魔王圣众， 酆都山明晨耐犯武城天宫洞魔王圣众， 酆都山休明总虚天宫洞魔王圣众， 酆都山玄司重政天宫洞魔王圣众， 酆都山正真绍灵司天宫洞魔王圣众， 酆都山玉纪明晨天宫洞魔王圣众， 酆都山赤映云曲天宫洞魔王圣众， 酆都山统仙升灵希微天宫洞魔王圣众。 元始上帝再告左右侍真曰：吾今遣清华真人降下此经，散布万国九州，普使人天，传写转礼，为上世亡魂，追荐冥福，度上南宫，皆归人道，咸得长生。 世间若有奉道之民、善信男女，遇三元八节吉日、本命忌辰，为先灵七祖、父母宗亲，修斋礼诵三清宝号、天真名位，或为亡过先祖、见在亲姻，拜表上章，放生续命，广建福田，齐同修奉，异骨成亲，国安民丰，欣乐太平，宗奉礼拜，皆得度世。 冲妙先生烧香朝拜金阙上帝而献颂曰： 倾心朝太极，玉帝降洪恩。 天符宣地府，开度长夜魂。 幽都解七祖，灵符告三官。 神仙同接引，上朝朱陵天。 永脱罪业根，长享福自然。 太上灵宝朝天谢罪大忏卷之八竟 太上灵宝朝天谢罪大忏卷之九 尔时，元始上帝在无上大罗天中玉京金阙之内坐七宝妙台，与太上玉晨道君、太上圣祖老君，大集诸天一切神仙，敷扬妙法，广度天人，咸使得道，永悟无为。 是时，法会中有玉清真人、太极真人与诸天神仙，持符执节，烧香散花，步虚旋绕，赞叹圣德，称未闻见，出班朝礼，上奏至尊：臣等忝侍云轩，受任真位。

With wholehearted reverence, we bow to the Perfected of the Dharma Wheel.

The Primordial Celestial Venerable addressed the gods and immortals of all heavens, saying: "I now dispatch this scripture with the Perfected of Pure Radiance, sending them down to the lower realms to disseminate it throughout the ten thousand states and nine provinces, that all in the human and celestial realms may perform its recitation and veneration. If there be faithful men and women or Dao cultivators who, upon encountering their life’s fateful days, the Three Primes, or the Eight Festivals, burn incense and recite the names of the Heavenly Worthies and Perfected, offering libations to the underworld officials to supplicate for their departed ancestors, living parents, and all kin, repenting past transgressions, grave offenses, and heavy karmic afflictions—then shall the souls in the dark realms be released, their entanglements dissolved, their spirits reborn in blessed realms, transformed into human existence, received by immortals, and ascend to the Grand Clarity.

With wholehearted reverence, we bow to the Great Emperor of the Northern Darkness of Mount Fengdu in the Mysterious Heaven of the Northern Shade.
With wholehearted reverence, we bow to the Life-Recording Underworld Official of the Left Palace of Mount Fengdu in the Palace of Grand Yang.
With wholehearted reverence, we bow to the Death-Recording Underworld Official of the Right Palace of Mount Fengdu in the Palace of Grand Yin.
With wholehearted reverence, we bow to the Sin-Determining Underworld Official of the Black Calamity Palace of the Seven Wrongs Bureau of Mount Fengdu.
With wholehearted reverence, we bow to the Sin-Determining Underworld Official of the Bright Dawn Palace of the Linked Winding Bureau of Mount Fengdu.
With wholehearted reverence, we bow to the Sin-Determining Underworld Official of the Nine Dark Realms’ Judgment Bureau of Mount Fengdu.
With wholehearted reverence, we bow to the Sin-Determining Underworld Official of the Divine Tether Bureau of the Xianchi Palace of Mount Fengdu.
With wholehearted reverence, we bow to the Sin-Determining Underworld Official of the Dark Heaven Bureau of Mount Fengdu.
With wholehearted reverence, we bow to the Ghost-Examining Divine Officials of the Threefold Spirit Prison and the Law-Enforcing Prison of Mount Fengdu.
With wholehearted reverence, we bow to the Ghost-Examining Divine Officials of the Ninefold Level Prison and the Clear Spirit Prison of Mount Fengdu.

With wholehearted reverence, we bow to the Sacred Host of the Cavernous Demon Kings of the Palace of the Unifying Immortals and Ascendant Numinous Subtlety of Mount Fengdu."

The Primordial Celestial Venerable further addressed the attendant Perfected at his side, saying: "I now dispatch the Perfected of Pure Radiance to descend with this scripture, disseminating it throughout the ten thousand states and nine provinces, that all in the human and celestial realms may transmit, copy, recite, and venerate it. For the sake of departed ancestors, they shall dedicate merit to the underworld, guiding souls to the Southern Palace, that all may return to the human path and attain longevity. If there be Dao-following folk or faithful men and women in the world who, upon encountering the Three Primes, the Eight Festivals, or their life’s fateful days, perform rites for their seven generations of ancestors, parents, and kin—reciting the precious names of the Three Clarities and the titles of the Celestial Perfected, or submitting memorials for departed ancestors and living relatives, releasing life to extend destiny, and broadly cultivating fields of merit—then shall their disparate bones become kin, the nation be at peace, the people prosper, and all rejoice in great harmony. Through veneration and worship, all shall attain deliverance."

Master Chongmiao, burning incense and bowing to the Golden Portal of the Celestial Venerable, offered this hymn of praise:
"With devoted heart, we bow to the Supreme Ultimate,
As the Jade Emperor bestows vast grace.
Heavenly decrees proclaim to the earthly prisons,
Opening deliverance for the long-night souls.
The dark realms release the seven generations,
Divine talismans announce to the Three Officials.
Immortals together receive and guide,
Ascending to the Vermilion Mound Heaven.
Forever freed from the roots of sin,
Eternally enjoying blessings by nature."

*Thus concludes the Eighth Scroll of the Supreme Pervasive Treasure Repentance for Atonement Before Heaven.*

*The Ninth Scroll of the Supreme Pervasive Treasure Repentance for Atonement Before Heaven*

At that time, the Primordial Celestial Venerable was seated upon a seven-jeweled wondrous terrace within the Jade Capital’s Golden Portal in the Supreme Great Luo Heaven. Together with the Most High Jade Dawn Dao Lord and the Most High Sagely Ancestor Lord Lao, he assembled all the gods and immortals of the heavens to expound the wondrous Dharma, broadly delivering celestial and human beings, that all might attain the Dao and forever awaken to non-action. Then, among the Dharma assembly, the Jade Clarity Perfected and the Supreme Ultimate Perfected, along with the gods and immortals of all heavens, holding talismans and bearing tablets, burned incense and scattered flowers, pacing in celestial circles, extolling the sagely virtue. Never before had such been heard or seen. They stepped forth from the ranks to bow and addressed the Most Honored One: "We, your servants, humbly attend your cloud-borne chariot, having received the appointment to the ranks of the Perfected."

chunks.original_text: 伏见下方一切群生，身心暗昧，不识灵宝自然妙化，何能救度。 多为六夭五伤，百精九丑，恶鬼广行，疫毒百病，因起凶祸，债主冤家，口舌诽谤，哭声相绩，人心悲惶，寒热起内，病生於外，祷祝不正之鬼，追烹血食，妄说吉凶，留连百怪，结罪三官，为十直之神司命司录写录罪犯，上奏天府，夺其算禄，减刻寿龄，自死自生，无由解脱。 或五斗星官告变，灾祸水旱，风雨不顺，四起刀兵，疫病死亡，国主忧惶，百姓涂炭，无由救拔。 伏愿上帝天慈，保其国祚，救度兆民，光宣道化，咸使群生，悟解正真，尽获超度。 是时，元始上帝告左右侍真曰：我从无始劫来，常在人间教化救度众生，使十方三界、凡圣天人普使开通，湛然常存，不生不灭，持戒诵念，广建福田，救获众生。 众圣钦仰，群魔稽首，列名上清。 吾念众生身心暗昧，不能得闻，今为汝等说无上十戒，作人天福业，生死善缘，降福消灾，获报无量。 天尊告侍真曰：第一戒者，下土兆民，不得杀生及怀杀想、故杀、贪杀，常行慈悲，救度一切群生，观诸众生，长如自己； 第二戒者，不得偷盗及怀盗想，常行退让，不受非义之物，观诸财宝如己之物； 第三戒者，不得邪淫及怀淫想，常行清洁，触景幽栖，观诸男女如己骨肉； 第四戒者，不得怪贪及怀贪想，常行布施，广济贫穷，平等一心，无彼我想； 第五戒者，不得瞋怒及怀怒想，常行欢喜，和睦冤亲，观诸众生犹如赤子； 第六戒者，不得愚痴及怀痴想，常行智慧，劝诱愚迷，观诸众生如己手足； 第七戒者，不得绮言及怀绮想，常行忠正，内外淳和，观诸经戒，常生念诵； 第八戒者，不得妄言及怀妄想，常行信实，隐显无欺，观诸人民无虚妄想； 第九戒者，不得恶口骂詈及诸恶口，常行正念，不起毒心，观彼毒蛇自生毒气； 第十戒者，不得两舌，斗乱亲朋，常行端直，不起爱僧，观诸彼我无向背想。 元始上帝告左右侍真曰：吾说此戒是众生城郭、依栖屋宅。 能受持男女常有玉童玉女、金刚力士、十天善神，常侍卫左右。 消灾度厄，保命延生，神仙敬仰，神明护门，刀兵水火、虎狼毒蛇、疾病牢狱、鬼贼邪精、饥寒苦难一切灾祸不干，求男得男，求女得女，富贵寿乐，所愿从心，智慧聪明，形容端正，功德巍巍，不可思议。 若有善心男女，礼忏行道，持戒修善，如彼宝剑能断一切，如彼法船能度一切，如彼猛火能烧一切，如彼净水能洗一切。 自三清以下乃至十方真仙，莫不皆持经戒也。 戒者，防非止恶，检敕身心，降伏外魔，感动灵仙，得福无量。 元始上帝告左右侍真曰：吾见下界众生，自旷劫以来，受身为人，只为悭贪嗜欲，饮酒食肉，啖嚼无厌。 长此肌肤养其脓血，致生病恼，弥益罪根，生老病苦，暑湿风寒，痛痒疼酸，恶风毒气入身，染体百病来侵，念念无常，昼夜悲泣。 受生禀识，各各不同，日夜循环，万生万死。 或处胞胎，洳成脓血，随即消化。 或居母腹，不得出生，生即破坏，虽则分娩，子母暂殊，即便死亡，不可称计。 或一岁两岁乃至百年念念改张，衰耗精气，头痛壮热，万恼相侵，一生之中，无少安乐者，良由广食秽浊、积满身中、酒肉熏肥、蒸郁藏府、恶风毒气、吹扇形骸、金石化消、身形不久。
chunks.translated_text:
We observe that all sentient beings below are benighted in body and mind, unaware of the wondrous transformations of the Numinous Treasure’s spontaneous efficacy—how then may they be saved and delivered? Many suffer the six premature deaths and five injuries, the hundred spirits and nine grotesqueries; malevolent ghosts roam widely, pestilential poisons and myriad diseases arise, giving rise to calamities and misfortunes. Creditors and adversaries, slanderous tongues, and ceaseless wailing fill the air; human hearts are stricken with sorrow and dread. Cold and heat arise within, illness manifests without. They pray to unorthodox spirits, offer blood sacrifices in pursuit of blessings, and recklessly prognosticate fortune and misfortune, entangling themselves in a hundred monstrosities. Thus they incur guilt before the Three Officials, and the Ten Directing Spirits, the Deities of Destiny, and the Recorders inscribe their transgressions, submitting them to the Celestial Treasury. Their allotted years and blessings are stripped away, their lifespans shortened by the stroke of fate. They die by their own hands or are born into suffering, with no means of liberation.

At times, the Five Bushel Star Officials report omens of change: disasters, floods, droughts, unseasonable winds and rains, the fourfold rise of warfare, pestilence, and death. The sovereign is filled with anxiety, the common people plunged into misery, with no means of deliverance. We humbly beseech the Celestial Compassion of the Most High to safeguard the nation’s destiny, deliver the multitudes of the people, and radiantly proclaim the transformative power of the Dao, that all sentient beings may awaken to and comprehend the Orthodox and True, and all attain transcendence.

Then the Most High Primordial Lord addressed the Perfected attendants at his side: “Since the beginningless kalpas, I have constantly dwelt among humankind, teaching and delivering sentient beings, that the ten directions, the Three Realms, and all beings—mundane and sacred, celestial and human—might universally attain liberation, abide in serene constancy, and neither arise nor perish. By upholding the precepts, reciting the scriptures, and broadly establishing fields of merit, one may deliver and liberate sentient beings. All the sages revere this, all demons bow in submission, and their names are inscribed in the Upper Clarity.”

“I pity sentient beings for their benightedness in body and mind, unable to hear the teachings. Now, for your sake, I proclaim the Ten Supreme Precepts, which generate blessings for humans and devas, create good karma in life and death, bestow blessings, and dispel calamities—yielding boundless recompense.”

The Heavenly Worthy addressed the Perfected attendants: “The first precept: the multitudes of the lower realms must not kill, nor harbor the thought of killing, nor kill deliberately or out of greed. They must constantly practice compassion, delivering all sentient beings, and regard all beings as themselves.

The second precept: they must not steal, nor harbor the thought of theft. They must constantly practice yielding and decline ill-gotten gains, regarding all wealth and treasures as their own.

The third precept: they must not engage in licentiousness, nor harbor lustful thoughts. They must constantly practice purity, dwelling in seclusion amidst the scenery, and regard all men and women as their own flesh and blood.

The fourth precept: they must not be covetous or greedy, nor harbor greedy thoughts. They must constantly practice generosity, broadly aiding the poor, maintaining equanimity of mind, and making no distinction between self and others.

The fifth precept: they must not give way to anger, nor harbor angry thoughts. They must constantly practice joy, reconciling enemies and kin, and regard all sentient beings as their own children.

The sixth precept: they must not be deluded, nor harbor deluded thoughts. They must constantly practice wisdom, guiding the ignorant and confused, and regard all sentient beings as their own hands and feet.

The seventh precept: they must not engage in frivolous speech, nor harbor frivolous thoughts. They must constantly practice integrity, maintaining inner and outer harmony, and regard the scriptures and precepts with constant recitation.

The eighth precept: they must not speak falsely, nor harbor false thoughts. They must constantly practice sincerity, concealing nothing and deceiving none, and regard all people without false imaginings.

The ninth precept: they must not engage in harsh speech, cursing, or any form of verbal abuse. They must constantly maintain right mindfulness, never giving rise to malicious intent, and regard venomous serpents as self-generating their own poison.

The tenth precept: they must not sow discord among relatives and friends with divisive speech. They must constantly practice uprightness, never fostering partiality, and regard all beings without notions of favor or aversion.”

The Most High Primordial Lord addressed the Perfected attendants at his side: “These precepts I proclaim are the city walls and dwelling houses of sentient beings. Men and women who uphold them will constantly have Jade Lads and Jade Maidens, Vajra Warriors, and the Ten Celestial Benevolent Spirits attending and guarding them at their sides. They will dispel calamities, transcend adversities, preserve life, and prolong existence. Immortals will revere them, deities will guard their gates. Swords and weapons, water and fire, tigers and wolves, venomous serpents, illnesses, imprisonment, demonic thieves, malevolent spirits, hunger, cold, suffering, and all disasters and misfortunes will not afflict them. Those who seek sons will have sons; those who seek daughters will have daughters. Wealth, honor, longevity, and joy will follow their hearts’ desires. They will possess wisdom and intelligence, their forms and appearances will be upright and proper, and their merit and virtue will be towering and inconceivable.

If good-hearted men and women perform repentance rites, practice the Dao, uphold the precepts, and cultivate goodness, it will be like a precious sword cutting through all obstacles, like a Dharma boat ferrying all across, like a raging fire burning all away, like pure water washing all clean. From the Three Clarities downward to the perfected immortals of the ten directions, none fail to uphold these scriptures and precepts. The precepts serve to prevent wrongdoing and halt evil, to discipline body and mind, subdue external demons, and move the numinous immortals—yielding boundless blessings.”

The Most High Primordial Lord addressed the Perfected attendants at his side: “I observe that the sentient beings of the lower realms, since the beginningless kalpas, have taken human form only to indulge in stinginess, greed, and sensual desires, drinking wine and eating meat without restraint. They nourish their flesh and blood, fostering pus and filth, thereby generating illness and affliction, deepening the roots of sin, and enduring the sufferings of birth, old age, sickness, and death. Heat, dampness, wind, and cold assail them; pain, itching, aches, and soreness afflict them. Malignant winds and toxic qi enter their bodies, infecting their forms with a hundred diseases. Moment by moment, impermanence prevails; day and night, they weep in sorrow.

Their births and endowments of consciousness differ, yet day and night they cycle through myriad births and deaths. Some dwell in the womb, congealing into pus and blood, only to dissolve and vanish. Others remain in the mother’s belly, unable to be born; if born, they perish at once. Though briefly separated from their mothers, they die immediately—beyond count. Some live one or two years, others a hundred, yet in every moment they change, their essence and qi waning. Headaches and fevers, a thousand afflictions assail them. In their entire lives, they know little peace. This is truly due to their gluttonous consumption of filth, filling their bodies, the fumes of wine and meat steaming their organs, malignant winds and toxic qi fanning their frames, minerals and metals dissolving their forms—so that their bodies do not endure.”
chunks.overlap_context: assembly, the Jade Clarity Perfected and the Supreme Ultimate Perfected, along with the gods and immortals of all heavens, holding talismans and bearing tablets, burned incense and scattered flowers, pacing in celestial circles, extolling the sagely virtue. Never before had such been heard or seen. They stepped forth from the ranks to bow and addressed the Most Honored One: "We, your servants, humbly attend your cloud-borne chariot, having received the appointment to the ranks of the Perfected."
